title: Shut Up & Write!‚Ñ¢ Santa Rosa REMOTE ZOOM FRIDAY
description:
Shut Up & Write!¬Æ Wine Country
**This event is hosted on the Shut Up & Write website, so please [sign up here](https://shutupwrite.com/series/shut-up-write-online-with-lorraine-s/7480) for your writing event.**

**ABOUT THE EVENT**
Welcome! I will email passcode to those who register.
Be sure to enable email on MeetUp!
Then, please check your email!
Join us virtually for an hour + of writing using Zoom. Let's keep together as much as we can during these uncertain times and keep on writing. Look for the schedule online and join us.

We‚Äôve discovered that it‚Äôs strikingly helpful to write with other writers. See if it‚Äôs true for you at 3pm on Friday afternoon. Be it a book, blog, script, essay, dissertation, resume, melody, poem or just plain work stuff, you are invited to write it with us. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice. Instead of just thinking about writing, come and get some real writing done.

JOIN US!

1. RSVP - space is limited to 12 people. (registration closes at one half hour before the event starts). You will receive the link to access the event at that time. REMEMBER TO CHECK YOUR EMAIL FOR PASSCODE!
2. Before or at 3pm join the meeting with the link you receive AND ADD PASSCODE.

Please note:

1. If you don't have Zoom set up on your computer yet, leave 15-30 minutes ahead of time to get it set up!
2. If you have difficulty with audio (don't have a microphone set up), as long as you have a speaker, you can call in (you'll see phone numbers when you log in).
3. If you are late, you won't be able to intro with us, but you are still welcome to join in.
4. If you won't be able to make it, please cancel so that the space is available to another writer.

SCHEDULE:
3:00 - quick intros.
around 3:10 - timer starts: write for 70 mins.
4:20 - (the end) wrap up

Wherever you are, we hope to see you online! Keep on writing...
Regards,
Lorraine Segal
source: Meetup: Shut Up & Write Wine Country

title: Online: Resilience & the Open Heart: Somatic Practices for Everyday Stress
description:
**with Pawan Bareja, PhD**

When we are out of alignment with our deepest heart values, life feels stressful. Whether the trigger is personal heartbreak, economic pressure, relational conflict, or the weight of the climate crisis, the body often reacts with anxiety, collapse, anger, or overwhelm long before the mind can make sense of it. You are invited to move from stress to love by transforming these patterns through embodied heart practices.

Each week, we will begin by gently noticing where activation lives in the body.¬†We‚Äôll then engage in embodied heart-opening practices to soothe the nervous system and reconnect with inner clarity. After practice, we will re-check the nervous system to observe what has shifted, revealing resilience as something softly felt, measurable, and trainable.

As the heart opens and the body softens, many experience deeper rest, clearer thinking, a renewed sense of connection to loved ones, and the courage to live a more meaningful life.

title: Our Wild Watershed- The Beauty Of Mushrooms with David Campbell
description:
Hosted by the¬†Laguna de Santa Rosa Foundation, this engaging presentation invites you to join David Campbell as he uncovers the hidden world of mushrooms in our wild watershed‚Äîguaranteed to leave you in awe.

As the rainy season begins, wild mushrooms are popping up all over Sonoma County, and there‚Äôs no better time to learn about them!

Join David Campbell for a presentation full of photos and a lifetime of insight into the rich wild fungal activity in local forests and watersheds. This is an interactive, welcoming session where open discussion and questions are encouraged. Attendees are invited to bring recently collected mushroom specimens of interest for observation and identification during the meeting.

Come learn, explore, and deepen your understanding of the fascinating world of local mushrooms‚Äîall from the comfort of the presentation space.

Presenter Bio: David Campbell has been studying, teaching, and safely enjoying wild mushrooms for over 50 years. He served more than a decade on the council of the Mycological Society of San Francisco \(MSSF\), including two terms as president, and was the original president of the Mycological Society of Marin County \(MycoMarin\). Focused on edible and poisonous mushrooms, he has led numerous fungal forays for MSSF, the Sonoma Mycological Association \(SOMA\), and the annual Napa Truffle Festival.

David has decades of experience with the San Francisco Poison Control Center responding to mushroom-related incidents and has facilitated mycological seminars with author David Arora. As an expert mycophagist and long-time educator, he is the principal of Wild About Mushrooms Company, teaching basic mycology and organizing wild mushroom events across California. His international tour company, MycoVentures, offers truffle, mushroom, and wine tours in Italy and Croatia.

title: Bayou Moon at the Redwood Cafe inn Cotati
description:
Bayou Moon, a high-energy, professional band, delivers more than just music, they create an ambience of joy and connection at every show. Blending Southern soul, New Orleans funk with West Coast grooves, their sound and stage presence enhance any venue with an uplifting and dynamic performance. From the first downbeat to the final note, Bayou Moon takes audiences on a musical journey of rhythm, emotion and fun.

Bayou Moon‚Äôs repertoire flows seamlessly through a curated roster of R&B ballads, swamp rock and funky dance-floor-shaking hits. With original takes on beloved songs some familiar, some delightfully refreshing ‚Äì Bayou Moon leaves audiences energized and yearning for more. ‚ÄúWe want people to leave lighter, happier, more alive,‚Äù says Mark Webb-Heims, bass player and musical director. ‚ÄúThat‚Äôs what music can do and that‚Äôs what drives Bayou Moon!‚Äù

Bandleader Jim Sides sought to create a band with purpose, soul and exceptional professionalism, resulting in a talented mix of unique musicians all committed to this ideal. With varying performance backgrounds and extensive musical experience, this powerhouse ensemble brings style, skill and heart to every performance.

Bayou Moon is adaptable and easy to work with ‚Äì from the booking to the sound check to the final encore. Whether it‚Äôs a packed club, a wedding, a corporate event, a casino or a festival stage, the band collaborates seamlessly with planners, venues and production teams to deliver a flawless experience.

title: Benise
description:
Emmy Award Winning Spanish Guitar and Dance Spectacular.

It‚Äôs one hot night as Benise celebrates 25 years of fiery Spanish guitar and dance. 

Benise \(pronounced Buh-nes-say\) shattered the mold of Spanish guitar by combining world music and dance ‚Äì the only show of its kind! 

2025 marks the year that Benise, ‚ÄúThe Prince of Spanish Guitar,‚Äù launches his 25th Anniversary Tour and 8th PBS Special ‚Äú25 Years of Passion!‚Äù 

 Armed with his Spanish guitar and a stage full of musicians and elaborately choreographed dancers, Benise takes the audience on a musical journey through Spanish Flamenco, Cuban Salsa, Brazilian Samba, Parisian Waltz, exotic drumming, and more! 

The 25th Anniversary tour establishes Benise‚Äôs Emmy Award winning show as one of the longest running Latin-themed theatrical productions touring the world.

For Benise, music has always been a journey. From his humble beginnings as a street performer, to being featured on the \#1 rated show in the USA ‚Äì Dancing With The Stars. Guitarist and creative force behind the event, Benise, comments ‚ÄúI wanted to push the boundaries of Nuevo Flamenco/Spanish guitar while combining the elements of dance and theater. This show is a celebration of all the shows we‚Äôve done over the last 25 years.‚Äù 

The Emmy Award-winning composer along with an international cast of musicians and dancers will entertain audiences with a two-hour show that ‚Äúis an escape from all of their problems,‚Äù Benise says. Beyond the new material, Benise says ‚Äúthe live show will incorporate some fan favorites from my street performing days and rock classics like Led Zeppelin‚Äôs Kashmir and AC/DC‚Äôs Thunderstruck.‚Äù In addition, Benise adds his signature touch to classics such as ‚ÄúAve Maria, ‚ÄúMoonlight Sonata,‚Äù and Vivaldi‚Äôs ‚ÄúSummer‚Äù from The Four Seasons.

Benise adds, ‚ÄúThis is a great show for the whole family; I really think we have something for everyone. I hope people will be inspired by our story, by the music, by the production--and have the passion to follow their own dreams.‚Äù 

The Theatrical World Music and Dance spectacle that has been called ‚ÄúThe Latin Riverdance‚Äù 

‚ÄòThe Prince of Spanish Guitar‚Äô  - Dancing With The Stars

‚ÄòBennissimo!‚Äô - Chicago News

‚ÄòExtreme Flamenco Fusion‚Äô - Screen India

title: The Aris Quartett - SRJC's Chamber Concert Series
description: Expressive, dynamic, spectacular ‚Äì the Aris Quartett has been at home on international stages for more than a decade. With its unmistakable sound, it has long been known as one of the world's top-ranked chamber music ensembles.  Founded in Frankfurt am Main in 2009, the Aris Quartett continues to perform to this day in an unchanged format. The ensemble's success is no coincidence: having earned numerous first prizes at prestigious competitions, the Aris Quartett quickly achieved its international breakthrough.  The musicians have been honored as ECHO Rising Stars by the European Concert Hall Organization, were among the BBC's New Generation Artists, and have won five awards at the ARD International Music Competition in Munich.  Anna Katharina Wildermuth, violin; No√©mi Zipperling, violin; Caspar Vinzens, viola; and Lukas Sieber, violoncello     Program:  Felix Mendelssohn, String Quartet Op. 12 or  Joseph Haydn, String Quartet Op. 76/4 in B-flat minor "Sunrise"  Dmitri Shostakovich, String Quartet No. 8 in C minor Op. 110  Ludwig van Beethoven, String Quartet in F Major Op. 59/1     Ticket Prices:  Season tickets (all 6 concerts): $155  Mini Season (any 3 concerts): $90  Individual tickets: $35  Student tickets (with valid ID): $20   Buy tickets here! (https://www.cityboxoffice.com/?category=36)  SRJC Chamber Concerts Website: https://chamberconcerts.santarosa.edu/ (https://chamberconcerts.santarosa.edu/)

title: Cheese & Butter Classes
description:
Join award-winning cheesemaker Sheana Davis and wine expert Ben Sessions for unforgettable¬†cheese and butter making classes. Perfect for team building, celebrations, and educational events, our classes are interactive, fun, and easy for everyone. 

From classes on how to make Creme de Ricotta wheel to Mozzarella Pulling to butter-making classes, guests will always leave with a creamy treat to take home \(if it makes it that far!\) ‚Äì so bring a small cooler with you.¬† 

Food has a remarkable ability to bring people together. 

Cheesemaking classes are perfect for team-building activities, company meetings, team celebrations, staff events, corporate fun, bridal parties, couples classes, girlfriend getaway weekends, LGBT events, EBT education courses, and more. Classes held year-round on Thursday, Friday, and Saturday, 12:00-2:00 and 3:30-5:30pm. 

See the full schedule of all our cheese and butter making classes here.¬† 

With each class, we give back to the community by providing meals for food-insecure seniors in Sonoma Valley. After learning how to make cheese, our guests can prepare these meals and write personal notes for the seniors on the lids.¬† 

Join us in making a positive impact while having fun and learning a new skill.¬†¬† 

Your Cheesemaking Experience: 



Begin with local wine and an artisanal cheese tasting.

Learn to make cheese and compound butter with everyday ingredients and tools.

Enjoy specialized classes for dishes like lasagna and gourmet grilled cheeses.

Exclusive guest cheesemakers often share their techniques.

Ideal for corporate events, bridal parties, getaways, and more.



Sheana and Ben pride themselves on using ingredients readily available in any local grocery store, with cooking supplies used reside in most home cooks‚Äô kitchens. Guest cheesemakers are often available to showcase their own cheeses and techniques, making the class a truly unique experience. 

Check the schedule for¬†Wine Country-based cheesemaking classes.¬† 

Customize Your Class:To arrange private or corporate classes at venues like Sonoma Fairmont Mission Inn or Silverado Resort, contact us at¬†sheanadavis@gmail.com. We can help create a unique and unforgettable experience for your entire group! Private and corporate classes may be arranged and are hosted at various Wine Country venues, including The Fairmont Sonoma Mission Inn, Silverado Resort, The Lodge in Sonoma, and private homes and estates. 

To register: 

https://theepicureanconnection.com/events/

location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Out of Stock
      
    




Paint Your Pet in Watercolor: SebArts & Humane Society of SoCo

  
    
      
        
          $95.00
        
      
    
  

Saturday, February 21, 2026; 1:00 ‚Äì 4:00pm$80.00 + $15 Materials FeeJoin us for a collaborative community event, a joyful, inclusive art experience celebrating the bond between people and animals while supporting local art education and animal welfare. We invite participants to create a portrait of their beloved pet, under the guidance of an experienced Teaching Artist, with proceeds shared between SebArts and the Humane Society of Sonoma County. The event will blend creativity and compassion - core values shared by both organizations. Paint Your Pet is a 3 hour guided painting workshop where participants bring a photo of their pet (or choose from adoptable pets featured by the Humane Society) and learn to create a custom portrait using watercolor paint. Celebrate the human animal bond through art and creative expression while raising funds to support SebArts art programs and the Humane Society of Sonoma County‚Äôs animal care and adoption services.About the Instructor: Hannah Day received her BA in Visual Arts with an emphasis on drawing and printmaking from University of San Diego, then attended University of Hawaii at Manoa to receive her MFA in printmaking. Hannah‚Äôs etchings have been internationally shown and collected, but her personal practice also includes paper cutting, graphite, watercolor, mixed media, and murals. She have taught all ages and many formats (kids, teens, adults, college, private lessons, camps, etc) and many mediums. These days Hannah has been teaching primarily paper cutting but also enjoys teaching drawing, painting and printmaking.

title: 11th Annual Farmers' Convergence
location: University of California Hopland Research and Extension Center
description:
The School of Adaptive Agriculture invites you to the 11th Annual Farmers‚Äô Convergence on February 21, 2026, at the UC Hopland Research & Extension Center in Hopland, CA. 

This beloved farmer-to-farmer gathering is entering an exciting new chapter. After a decade of grassroots success, the Farmers‚Äô Convergence is expanding to UC Hopland REC, marking a significant evolution that bridges lived farming experience with deep ecological practices. This partnership represents a deeper commitment to regenerative land stewardship and our local food economy. 

The event will bring together farmers, gardeners, schools and food activists, from beginners to seasoned veterans, conventional to experimental, for innovative solutions, knowledge exchange, and forward-thinking strategies. Together, we‚Äôll explore soil regeneration, biodiversity, systems thinking, and economic sustainability while renewing our collective inspiration and momentum. It will include events the day before, and after. 

Everyone belongs in this conversation. Tickets are limited, so don‚Äôt delay. We hope you will join us as we champion collaborative progress and expanded possibility. 

Learn more: www.schoolofadaptiveagriculture.org/convergence

title: Bachata Beginners Saturday
description:
This class is perfect for bachata beginners that want to learn basic steps and skills, or those who want to refresh their foundational skills. We understand that learning something new can feel a little intimidating. That‚Äôs why our supportive and relaxed environment is specifically designed to make learning bachata basics an absolute blast!

Our friendly instructors will guide you through:

Basic directional steps:¬†You‚Äôll learn the fundamental movements that form the building blocks of all bachata dancing.

Proper frame for partner work:¬†Discover how to connect comfortably and effectively with a partner, setting you up for smooth and enjoyable dances.

Simple turn patterns:¬†We‚Äôll introduce you to easy-to-follow turn patterns that will have you dancing with a partner in no time.

We‚Äôve carefully organized our curriculum to ensure that each movement is easy to grasp and remember, building your confidence with every step. Our goal is to make learning fun. Join us to learn Bachata in Marin.

Important Details

No dance experience required:¬†Whether you‚Äôve never danced before or it‚Äôs been a while, you‚Äôre welcome here!

No partner necessary:¬†Come solo or bring a friend‚Äîeither way, you‚Äôll have plenty of opportunities to dance.

Please wear¬†non-marking shoe soles:¬†This helps us keep our dance floor in great condition.

Come join us and discover the joy of bachata! We can‚Äôt wait to see you on the dance floor.

title: Afro Fusion
description:
This annual dance and music event is a vibrant celebration of Black history, cultural awareness, and unity through the universal languages of movement and sound. Bringing together rich traditions from across the African diaspora, the event creates a powerful space where culture is honored, stories are shared, and communities connect through the love of dance and music.

Featuring special guest artists and cultural leaders:

Nigerian Dance \(Igbo\) ‚Äì Uzo Nwankpa

Guin√©e Traditional Rhythm and Dance ‚Äì Naby Bangoura

Conscious Musicality/Capoeira‚Äì Mestre Negoativo

Orix√°s in Sound: Afro-Brazilian Music and Song Traditions ‚Äì Mestra Minha Velha

Together, these artists offer an immersive experience that celebrates ancestral roots, living traditions, and the collective power of rhythm, movement, and cultural expression.

Durante Cuentos con Ritmo, los peque√±os visitantes y sus familias participan de forma l√∫dica en historias interactivas con m√∫sica y movimiento fortaleciendo nuestra diversa comunidad y entusiasmo por la lengua meta. 

Cuentos con Ritmo es presentado por Guadalupe Tausch en colaboraci√≥n con la organizaci√≥n que fund√≥, Colors of Spanish. Originaria del estado de Guanajuato en M√©xico, tiene una maestr√≠a en espa√±ol con √©nfasis en la adquisici√≥n de una segunda lengua para la primera infancia y contin√∫a sus estudios enfocada en la primera infancia especializ√°ndose en la adquisici√≥n de idiomas a trav√©s de la m√∫sica/movimiento. Colors of Spanish ofrece talleres para profesores, bibliotecarios y cuidadores y organiza programas de cuentos en espa√±ol con m√∫sica y movimiento en escuelas, bibliotecas y museos locales. www.colorsofspanish.org 

Cuentos con Ritmo | Cuentos \* M√∫sica \* Movimiento 

Presented by Colors of Spanish 

Cuentos con Ritmo \(Stories with Rhythm\) is a weekly one-of-a-kind opportunity for children ages 1-5 and their families that brings joy, understanding and appreciation for the Spanish language to Spanish- and English-speaking speakers alike. During Cuentos con Ritmo, young visitors and their families playfully engage in interactive stories with music and movement that build community and an excitement for language! 

Cuentos con Ritmo is presented by Guadalupe Tausch in collaboration with the organization she founded, Colors of Spanish. Originally from the state of Guanajuato in M√©xico, she has a master‚Äôs degree in Spanish with emphasis in second language acquisition for early childhood and continues her study of childhood and music/movement trainings. Colors of Spanish provides workshops for teachers, librarians and caregivers and hosts Spanish story time with music & movement programs at local schools, libraries, and museums. www.colorsofspanish.org 

Designed for kids 1-5, families, and siblings.

description:
Schedule

Saturday, February 21, 2026 10:00 AM ‚Äì 2:00 PM

Experience Level

Beginning

14\+

$30 ‚Äì Registration Cost $15 ‚Äì Materials Fee $45 ‚Äì Total Registration CostCelebrate Lunar New Year 2026 by creating a handmade paper lantern with LED lights. Design personalized panels using stencils, block printing, and fiber techniques.

What you‚Äôll do

Join us in our print studio to welcome in the Year of the Fire Horse for 2026! In many Asian cultures, the Lunar New Year holiday brings families and friends together to celebrate. Lanterns symbolize good luck, health and prosperity and their light is a way to set an intention, make a wish and spread good fortune. In this special annual workshop, participants will design and build a unique handmade foldable lantern using kozo paper, chipboard, fiber and small LED lights. Guests will be encouraged to experiment, craft and create their own printed personal imagery on four panels using a variety of stencils, block printing tools, and fiber. Each participant will make one personalized functional box lantern in our studio to take home and enjoy in celebration! All materials will be provided. No prior experience is necessary.

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9‚ÄìMarch 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of¬†bonsai and the season‚Äôs first flowers.¬†Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year‚Äôs all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai‚Äîtrees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot¬†bonsai¬†take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal‚Äîreminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from¬†hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through¬†Hanami Strolls‚Äîguided walks through the Garden‚Äôs Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

title: The Inner Beloved: The Heart's Journey to Divine Unity
description:
with Hameed Ali (A. H. Almaas)

Experience an exploration of the spiritual journey as a path of love, where the heart‚Äôs discontent becomes the doorway to ultimate fulfillment.

Although the heart seeks fulfillment in people, possessions, and experiences, no external love can truly satisfy our deepest longing. Our discontent is an opportunity‚Äîa sacred invitation to turn inward. True fulfillment arises only when we empty our hearts to make space for the formless and intangible inner Beloved that is our true nature.

Join A. H. Almaas, founder of the Ridhwan School and the Diamond Approach, on a transformative journey of the heart. Discover how the search for love leads us through emptiness into a luminous darkness‚Äîa place where the mind is confounded, but the heart awakens to a passionate love for the unknown and to its potential for resting into the deepest fulfillment possible.

This half-day program is based on the new book,¬†*The Inner Beloved: The Heart‚Äôs Journey to Divine Unity (Shambhala, 2026)*. Copies of the book will be available for purchase at the bookstore, and onsite participants may have their copy of the book signed.

title: The Journey: A Painter's Narrative
description: New Woman and Fox paintings by Teri Sloat celebrate the personal journeys we take as we travel outward through landscape trails or inward through thoughts and dreams. Her ongoing series, Woman and Fox, A Journey, present rich, metaphorical paintings that invite you to pause on your own path and enjoy the distance you have come.

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

title: Rise & Shine With Olive Oil - A Demo
description:
What if your favorite breakfast dishes could be healthier without sacrificing flavor? Join us for a cooking demonstration where you'll learn how extra virgin olive oil can enhance your morning meals and support your wellness.

This demonstration comes at a great time‚Äîthe USDA's recently released Dietary Guidelines for Americans encourage using oils rich in essential fatty acids, like olive oil, when cooking or adding fats to meals.

In this hour-long demonstration, Gold Ridge Organic Farms' Lori Myers will walk you through two delicious recipes that prove olive oil isn't just for lunch and dinner:

Customizable EVOO Granola ‚Äì Learn how to create a crunchy, nutrient-rich granola using Gold Ridge Organic Farms' award-winning extra virgin olive oil. We'll share creative ways to enjoy it beyond the breakfast bowl, making it a versatile staple in your kitchen.

Olive Oil Hollandaise ‚Äì Discover how to prepare a smooth hollandaise sauce made with olive oil instead of butter‚Äîperfect for eggs Benedict, asparagus, or your Sunday brunch spread.

Your Experience Includes: ‚Ä¢ Scenic ride to our charming Apple Cottage in our apple-themed trolley or apple blossom-pink VW van ‚Ä¢ Expert cooking demonstration with tips and techniques you can use at home ‚Ä¢ Generous tastings of both recipes, plated as you'd serve them at home ‚Ä¢ A take-home bag of olive oil granola ‚Ä¢ 10% discount on all Farm Shop purchases

In efforts to help the kelp and honor these magnificent animals, you‚Äôll dye a Climate Beneficial Verified Beanie using urchins from the waters surrounding Sea Ranch. $180 per person.

title: An Abstract Vision
description:
**Exhibition runs April 4 - May 30, 2026**

Deadline for Entries: March 9, 2026

An Abstract Vision celebrates the work of artists creating abstract art.

Abstract art moves beyond representation, with a strong emphasis on shape, color and form. Abstract art has the power to evoke emotions, appeal to our senses and transcend the physical world. Abstract expression captures the delicate, elusive, powerful and radiant energies that fly under the radar of explanation.

We are excited to have you share with us your visions in the abstract and look forward to putting together a dynamic exhibition of work that reflects the power and importance of abstract art.

Accepting the following mediums: painting, printmaking, photographs, sculpture, glass, wood, ceramics, fiber and paper.

title: Art Exhibit:  Color of Love
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE¬† 1/15/26

**FEBRURY EXHIBIT: COLOR OF LOVE**

EXHIBIT DATES:¬† January 26 ‚Äì February 22, 2026

**RECEPTION: SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 7, 2026, 3 ‚Äì 5 pm: Join in to meet the artists, celebrate the show and welcome the season of love. Take part in the Gallery‚Äôs free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.¬† Refreshments will be served.**

Sonoma County artists, **Linda Barretta, Nancy Gray, Bev Haley, Phyllis Rapp, Donna Schaffer, Tosya Shore, Luba Stolper and Gen Zorich** present the **Color of Love,** paintings that bring out the excitement and fun of the Valentine season.¬† Red takes a starring role in these works set against a broad spectrum of complementary violets, blues, and greens.¬† In Gray‚Äôs ‚ÄúLove Abstractly‚Äù an iconic heart is transformed through bold splashes of color. ¬†Stolper brings us delicious red delights in her ‚ÄúBowl of Strawberries,‚Äù ¬†fruit rendered so realistically, one‚Äôs mouth waters. ¬†Paintings by Haley, Schaffer and Zorich celebrate the coming of Spring with color-rich floral displays ‚Äì tulips and scarlet buglers.¬† Rapp and Barretta offer a nod to our feathered and furry friends. Barretta‚Äôs jaunty raven cocks his head as he offers up a heart on a red ribbon in ‚ÄúRaven Heart‚Äù and Rapp‚Äôs little fox peers at us from a bed of flowers in ‚ÄúFoxy Flowers.‚Äù¬† Shore‚Äôs ‚ÄúShowering You with Gifts‚Äù catches our eye with a sleek figure sporting a stunning red umbrella.¬† ‚ÄúAs we welcome the sunnier days and flowers in the fields, Valentine‚Äôs Day with its rich color palette is such a glorious way to celebrate the seasonal transition,‚Äù noted Gray.¬† ¬†

The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features **Laura Roney‚Äôs Dance!,** a collection of works that explores dance in its many forms. Part of cultures throughout the world, dance expression takes on styles that can be structured, such as ballet, or, by contrast, free flowing.¬† And dance is a beloved part of the dating scene, whether slow-dancing or rocking out.¬† In ‚ÄúHold Me Tight‚Äù one feels the close connection of the couple dancing on Valentine‚Äôs Day.¬† Another couple joyfully whoops it up in ‚ÄúBust a Move.‚Äù Bring on the music ‚Äì these works make one want to get a move on.

Meet the artist: Roney will be hosting the Gallery on February 1 and 27 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. (707) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am ‚Äì 6 pm.¬†¬†¬† **www.upstairsart gallery.net**

title: Arts Guild of Sonoma Presents: For the Love of Art
description: For the Love of Art February 5 - March 2, 2026 Arts Guild of Sonoma | 140 East Napa Street, Sonoma Celebrate creativity and Valentine's Day this February with For the Love of Art, a special exhibition at the Arts Guild of Sonoma. The show features Guest Artist Carmela Beckman-Spector, whose intricate pen-and-ink and collage works explore interconnectedness, balance, and quiet beauty, alongside new works by Arts Guild member artists in sculpture, painting, photography, ceramics, jewelry, and more. A free public reception will be held at the gallery Saturday, February 7, from 5:00 to 7:30 PM. Gallery hours: Thursday 1pm - 5pm Friday 1pm - 5pm Saturday/Sunday/Monday 11am - 5pm Admission is free. Learn more at  artsguildofsonoma.org .

description:

Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

$95 per guest | Special Club Member Pricing

title: Layered Impressions: Exploring Texture & Pattern in Gel Print Monotypes
description:
Schedule

Saturday, February 21, 2026 11:00 Am ‚Äì 3:00 PM

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Categories: Drawing & Painting, Printmaking

Age\(s\)

16\+

$115 ‚Äì Registration Cost $10 ‚Äì Materials Fee $125 ‚Äì Total Registration CostCreate unique gel plate prints using acrylics as you explore texture, color layering, and playful monoprinting techniques. All materials provided.

What you‚Äôll do

Create beautiful, one-of-a-kind designs on paper using a gel plate and acrylic paint. Mixed media artist Catherine Cruz will guide you through the basics of this playful printing process, sharing her techniques for building texture, layering colors, and creating unique designs. You will produce a collection of unique prints‚Äîperfect for use in collage, mixed media artwork, or handmade cards. This workshop is ideal for anyone curious about this exciting monoprinting method and is perfectly suited for beginners. What you‚Äôll get from this workshop:

Methods for applying paint and pulling successful prints

Techniques for creating unique and intricate layered designs

Creative use of mark-making tools and masks

Strategies for combining techniques

All materials are provided: Gel plate, brayer roller, acrylic paint, stencils, mark-making tools, paper. A variety of papers will be provided but you are highly encouraged to bring your own papers to experiment on. Examples of suitable papers include tissue paper, Japanese rice papers, calligraphy paper, recycled book pages, and basically any paper that is porous and absorbent. Class will start with a demonstration so please arrive a few minutes early to get set up so we can start on time. We will take a short lunch break from 12:30pm-1:00pm so kindly bring your lunch and a beverage.

title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description: Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

title: Redwood Writers General Meeting - Christine Walker
description:
Christine Walker: SENSORY, WHOLE-BODY WRITING: How to bring Memorable Characters Alive on the Page!

Please bring something savory or sweet to share in our potluck!

Note: The February meeting will be in Room 5 at the Finley Center, in the Senior Wing.

How do writers make the ‚Äúfabulous‚Äù feel real so that readers suspend disbelief? When we are writing from ‚Äúreality,‚Äù how do we guide readers‚Äô emotions in the direction of the story? In this presentation, we‚Äôll examine work by accomplished authors and our own writing for ways to paint vividly with words, enliven narrative, and awaken readers‚Äô awareness through sensory details within a realm of sensory information that says ‚Äúthese characters, this place, this time, this story.‚Äù

About the Presenter:Christine Walker is a visual artist and author of the novel ‚ÄúTap Dancing at the Bluebird‚Äù \(Sibylline Press\) and the memoir ‚ÄúA Painter‚Äôs Garden: Cultivating the Creative Life‚Äù \(Warner Books\), and co-author and illustrator of the children‚Äôs book ‚ÄúWooleycat‚Äôs Musical Theater.‚Äù She has an MFA in Writing and Literature in Fiction from Bennington College and an MA in Creative Arts Interdisciplinary. She is also a consultant in strategic visioning and a writing teacher. She teaches in community venues and online through Sibyl Writing Craft. She lives in Sonoma County.

title: Barrel Tasting: A Family Affair
description:
Experience wine in the making at Dry Creek Vineyard, a family-owned winery with more than 50 years of history in Sonoma County‚Äôs Dry Creek Valley. This immersive Barrel Tasting invites guests beyond the tasting room and into the heart of the winemaking process ‚Äî sampling wines straight from the barrel before they‚Äôre released to the public.

Hosted by the winery‚Äôs winemakers and longtime family grower partners, guests will hear directly from the people who farm the land, craft the wines and shape each vintage from vine to barrel.

Adding to the excitement, a skilled cooper will be on hand with a live barrel-making demonstration, showcasing the time-honored craft behind the oak barrels that influence flavor, texture and aging. It‚Äôs a dynamic, behind-the-scenes experience that blends wine, storytelling and hands-on artistry.

Perfect for curious wine lovers and anyone looking for a memorable wine country experience.

title: Barrel Tasting: A Family Affair at Dry Creek Vineyard
location: 3770 Lambert Bridge Road, Healdsburg, CA, 95448, United States

Winemakers and longtime family grower partners share insights on crafting each vintage from vine to barrel, offering a behind-the-scenes look at the winemaking process. A skilled cooper adds to the experience with a live barrel-making demonstration, showing how oak barrels shape flavor, texture, and aging. Perfect for anyone curious about wine, this event offers a unique perspective on how the vineyard‚Äôs exceptional wines come to life.

title: Naturalization and Citizenship  with Christine Cohen
description:
The Sonoma County Genealogical Society Presents

Naturalization and Citizenship

 with Christine Cohen

¬†Naturalization is the process by which a non-citizen becomes a citizen of the United States of America. Naturalization records can provide valuable information such as a person‚Äôs date of ¬†birth and location, occupation, immigration year, marital status, spouse information, witnesses' names and addresses. Naturalization and the individual steps to citizenship could be done at any ‚Äúcourt of record‚Äù in the United States.

¬†Christine is the Program Director of the Whittier Area Genealogical Society. She is also a member of the Tualatin Chapter of the Daughters of the American Revolution, the Society of Daughters of Holland Dames and the Association of Professional Genealogists. ¬†Her interest in genealogy began in 1977 with the airing of the TV mini-series ‚ÄúRoots‚Äù. Her enthusiasm was piqued when she was given a typed pedigree chart, commissioned by her maternal grandfather, of their Dutch heritage from the New Netherlands in the 1650‚Äôs.

FREE

¬†Via ZOOM

¬†Register at https://www.scgsonline.org

 Registration closes Friday, February 20th

title: American Red Cross Adult and Pediatric First-Aid/CPR/AED Class (Blended)
description:
Learn how to save a life!

Focusing on recognizing and treating life-threatening situations in the critical minutes before 911 arrives, we will cover adult and infant CPR, AED use, handling choking as well as what to do in cases of severe bleeding, sudden illness, heart attack, stroke and more.

Focusing on recognizing and treating life-threatening situations in the critical minutes before 911 arrives, we will cover adult and infant CPR, AED use and handling choking, as well as what to do in cases of severe bleeding, sudden illness, heart attack, stroke and more.

We'll be using modern manikins and equipment in a small-group setting, and answering questions along the way. Your American Red Cross certificate will be valid for 2 years.

\(This community class event is held at a branch of Sonoma County Library. We thank them for their hospitality. They have requested that we mention that this program is neither sponsored by nor affiliated with the Sonoma County Library. Done!\)

Please get in touch with any questions!

title: American Red Cross First-Aid/CPR/AED Class
description: Learn how to save a life! Focusing on recognizing and treating life-threatening situations in the critical minutes before 911 arrives, we will cover adult and infant CPR, AED use and handling choking, as well as what to do in cases of severe bleeding, sudden illness, heart attack, stroke and more. This is an American Red Cross-certified blended learning class: 50% online learning and 50% instructor-led. After booking you will receive a link directly from the American Red Cross with instructions on how to log in to complete the online portion of the class. This can be done at your convenience before we meet in person to practice our new skills with your friendly and experienced instructor. We'll be using modern manikins and equipment in a small-group setting, and answering questions along the way. Your American Red Cross certificate will be valid for 2 years.

title: Mary Poppins
description:
**The magical, family-friendly musical based on the stories of P.L. Travers and the Walt Disney film.**

***‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a roof-raising, toe-tapping, high-flying extravaganza.‚Äú* ‚Äî Joe Dziemianowicz, New York Daily News** 

**The beloved story of *Mary Poppins* soars to new heights in this Tony Award-winning musical, inspired by P.L. Travers‚Äô timeless books and the classic Disney film. Set in Edwardian London, the tale follows the Banks family, whose mischievous children, Jane and Michael, have sent every nanny packing‚Äîuntil the mysterious and enchanting Mary Poppins arrives. With a blend of magic, common sense, and a touch of mischief, she transforms their world, teaching them lessons in love, family, and imagination.**

**Filled with show-stopping dance numbers and iconic songs like ‚ÄúA Spoonful of Sugar‚Äù and ‚ÄúSupercalifragilisticexpialidocious,‚Äù this spectacular production will leave audiences of all ages believing that anything is possible‚Äîespecially with a little magic in the air!**

title: Sea Chantey and Songs of the Sea Singalong
description: Please note the change of venue and time from our previous sing-alongs.\* Avast, ye saucy sailors! Come brave the perilous waters of Point Reyes and join us for a rollicking good time at Point Reyes National Seashore's Sea Chantey Sing-along at the Ken Patrick Visitor Center. Please bring your arsenal of sea chanteys, any musical instruments you'd like, and a willingness to laugh a lot!  It's so much fun when audience members lead shanties for the rest of us to join in on the chorus, and leading a song is encouraged! If you'd like to find a song \(or songs\) to share, I highly recommend setting one of your online music services to a sea chantey radio station and hear what's out there! Practice lyrics! Teach the chorus to our audience at the singalong! Our format is informal, mellow, and supportive, so if you've been wanting to push your comfort edge and lead a song, this is a perfect low-pressure opportunity. If you'd rather just singalong with the chantey choruses, that's fine too. We always have a great time no matter what. This free event is for chantey singers of all levels. Due to the nature of sea chanteys, there may be lyrics that are not appropriate for children. Reservations not required. To be added to the notification email list for future singalong dates, please email pore\_info@nps.gov For more information, please visit: nps.gov/pore/planyourvisit/calendar.htm

title: Barrel Tasting
description:
Experience wine in the making at Dry Creek Vineyard, a family-owned winery with more than 50 years of history in Sonoma County‚Äôs Dry Creek Valley. This immersive Barrel Tasting invites guests beyond the tasting room and into the heart of the winemaking process ‚Äî sampling wines straight from the barrel before they‚Äôre released to the public.

Hosted by the winery‚Äôs winemakers and longtime family grower partners, guests will hear directly from the people who farm the land, craft the wines and shape each vintage from vine to barrel.

Adding to the excitement, a skilled cooper will be on hand with a live barrel-making demonstration, showcasing the time-honored craft behind the oak barrels that influence flavor, texture and aging. It‚Äôs a dynamic, behind-the-scenes experience that blends wine, storytelling and hands-on artistry.

Perfect for curious wine lovers and anyone looking for a memorable wine country experience.

Dido and Aeneas¬†is a monumental English Baroque opera masterpiece.¬† The story is based on Virgil‚Äôs¬†The Aeneid¬†and tells the tale of love and tragedy between Dido, Queen of Carthage, and the Trojan hero Aeneas.¬† This beloved gem includes stunning choruses, duos, trios and the iconic aria "Dido‚Äôs Lament". ¬†In contrast to Dido and Aeneas‚Äô measured passions,¬†Pagliacci¬†is full of uncontrollable passion, jealousy, tragedy, murder, and betrayal.¬† Laugh and weep with Canio as he sings "Vesti la giubba" \(the clown who cries behind his makeup\).

title: Ren√© Jenkins & Ian Dogole - Sacred Spaces and Wild Places
description:
Two adventurous musical spirits who delight in the here and now. Over the last few years, internationally acclaimed recording artist and multipercussionist **Ian Dogole** (www.iandogole.com) and master multi-instrumentalist and sound healer **Ren√© Jenkins** (www.vibetherapy.org) have developed a symbiotic chemistry that knows no bounds. Their musical forays are deeply rooted in the ancestral indigenous music cultures of the Americas, Africa and beyond, and when combined with their irrepressible spirit of adventure, the result is a sonic feast for the senses and an uplifting, healing experience that is transformational.

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† **Ren√© Jenkins ‚Äì** Native American, Zapotec and Mayan drone flutes, didjeridu, trombone, condor quill antara (Andean pan flute), djembe and assorted bowls, bells and rattles

¬∑¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† **Ian Dogole** ‚Äì udu, kalimbas, hang, doumbek, talking drum, bells and shakers

title: Will Marsh & Integration Ensemble
description: Will Marsh is an accomplished global sitarist & guitarist who carries on the rich tradition of many genres with elegance, imagination and innovation. This performance features Will along with other master musicians to complete the ensemble, bringing rich melodies and extraordinnairy combinations of instruments that blend cultures and cross traditional boundaries.  Tickets are $30, $25 for OCA members. Get tickets online or at the door.  Get Tickets   The Ensemble The Integration is the creative expression of Will Marsh's \(sitar/guitar\) unique musical journey of many years devoted to both western music and hindustani classical music. He became initiated into the rich tradition of hindustani classical music as a sitarist under the legendary Ustad Aashish Khan. Will has since become a shining expression of this tradition with international performances in the realm of traditional sitar. As a kid, Will had an insatiable curiosity for exploring the world's music. He found profound depth in the traditional music of the world and nurtured that itch by studying World Music Performance at the California institute of the Arts, completing his World Music performance MFA in 2013. Since then, Will's musical journey has been rich and diverse. He believes passionately that music is essential to all of humanity. Hearing the rich tapestry of melody for sitar, guitar, cello, saxophone and tabla in the Integration Ensemble connects audiences to the richness of the world's traditions in a vibrant, fresh expression of humanity's greatest gift, music! The ensemble performs this dynamic music at venues and festivals internationally.  Learn more about Will at  willmarshmusic.com

title: Santa Rosa Symphony - Mahler's Third
description: Mahler's Third February 21, 22 & 23, 2026 Weill Hall, Green Music Center Francesco Lecce-Chong, conductor Gabrielle Beteag, mezzo-soprano Treble Voices of the SSU Symphonic Chorus, Jenny Bent, director Gustav Mahler: Symphony No. 3 in D minor Mahler's Third Symphony explores the human condition, nature, and the divine. With six movements, it reflects Mahler's philosophical quest to "embrace everything." title: CBC Events and Producciones Vigil Presentan Tierra Cali de Humberto Plancarte
location: Luther Burbank Center for the Arts
description:
Back to All Shows

CBC Events and Producciones Vigil Presentan

Tierra Cali de Humberto Plancarte

Saturday, February 21, 2026

8:00 pm

BUY TICKETS 

Humberto Plancarte, originario del Rancho Las Juntas de Poturo, municipio de Churumuco, Michoac√°n, inici√≥ su carrera musical en 1998 con el objetivo de dejar un legado duradero en el p√∫blico. Dos a√±os despu√©s, en el a√±o 2000, fund√≥ el grupo ‚ÄúTierra Cali‚Äù. 

Humberto ha sido conocido por revitalizar la m√∫sica grupera, fusionando elementos del estilo norte√±o, banda, ritmos tropicales, entre otros, para crear un sonido √∫nico que representa la cultura mexicana. En 2008 consolid√≥ su √©xito al colocar tres de sus √°lbumes en el Top 100 de ventas, seg√∫n Soundscan y Billboard, logrando m√∫ltiples premios, incluyendo Discos de Platino y el reconocimiento como Mejor Grupo de Tierra Caliente. 

En esta nueva etapa Humberto Plancarte, busca brindar a sus fan√°ticos una nueva propuesta musical, mezclando las ra√≠ces del regional mexicano con arreglos musicales orquestados, baladas, cumbias y el ic√≥nico sabor de Tierra Caliente, apostando por sus letras honestas y rom√°nticas que veneran el amor. 

Humberto Plancarte, originally from Rancho Las Juntas de Poturo in the municipality of Churumuco, Michoac√°n, began his musical career in 1998 with the goal of leaving a lasting legacy with his audience. Two years later, in 2000, he founded the group Tierra Cali. 

Humberto became known for revitalizing m√∫sica grupera, blending elements of norte√±o, banda, tropical rhythms, and more to create a unique sound that proudly represents Mexican culture. In 2008, he solidified his success by placing three of his albums in the Top 100 sales charts, according to SoundScan and Billboard, earning multiple awards, including ‚ÄúDiscos de Platino‚Äù and the title of Best Tierra Caliente Group. 

Now entering a new chapter in his career, Humberto Plancarte offers fans a fresh musical proposal that fuses the roots of Regional Mexican music with orchestral arrangements, ballads, cumbias, and the iconic Tierra Caliente flavor‚Äîanchored in honest, romantic lyrics that celebrate love. 

 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS

Don‚Äôt get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we‚Äôre not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

title: ReVision: Writers ReGroup ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
ReVision: Writers ReGroup 2/22/26

  
    
      
        
          $35.00
        
      
    
  

Sunday, February 22, 2026; 1pm-3:30pm$35 Write your way into a productive and rewarding relationship with revision!Session Focus: Whole-body Characters We‚Äôll explore ways to create vivid people on the page and strengthen other elements through character, including point of view, sense of place, and emotional resonance.Revision is to a first draft what marriage is to falling head-over heels. It is to free write what deep friendship is to casual meeting. Revision takes time, skill, caring, and fortitude. It asks that we be generous and also draw boundaries. It presents us with choices that challenge what we believe to be true about others and ourselves. Revision is not for the faint of heart, but for writers committed to their relationship with creative expression through all the rough patches. Revision allows writers to investigate their heart work and intentions and stay true.I‚Äôll share a process that I call ‚ÄúMaster Craft Juggling,‚Äù which incorporates my Nine Ways to Mastery approach for writing fiction, memoir, and nonfiction. The session includes a craft presentation, group discussion, and writing time.You will:‚Ä¢ Gain perspectives and techniques for masterful revision‚Ä¢ Build community with writers who may become trusted readers for your projects‚Ä¢ Improve your writing and writing practice through revision‚Ä¢ Move your projects toward publicationPlease bring your:‚Ä¢ Open mind‚Ä¢ Fiction or nonfiction free write, early draft, or manuscript in progress‚Ä¢ Tools and materials for writing during the session‚Ä¢ Writing and revision challenges to discuss, particularly as relate to the session focusThe workshop will be offered periodically with a particular focus each time. Check the schedule, and sign up when you‚Äôre ready to revise.About the Instructor: Christine Walker is a visual artist, author, and strategic visioning consultant. Her published books include the novel ‚ÄúTap Dancing at the Bluebird,‚Äù the memoir ‚ÄúA Painter‚Äôs Garden: Cultivating the Creative Life,‚Äù the children‚Äôs book and songs ‚ÄúWooleycat‚Äôs Musical Theater,‚Äù and books on writing craft ‚Äî ‚ÄúA Writer‚Äôs Resolution: A Guided Journal for Realizing a Rewarding Writing Practice‚Äù and, for publication in 2027, ‚ÄúOur Writing Minds in Play: The Nine Ways Guide to Masterful Fiction & Memoir.‚Äù Her paintings are exhibited in galleries and corporate and private collections. She holds an MFA in Writing and Literature in Fiction from Bennington College and an MA in Creative Arts Interdisciplinary from San Francisco State University. The Bennington program promised: ‚ÄúRead one hundred books. Write one.‚Äù This motto inspired her to design teaching frameworks and courses‚ÄîMaster Craft Juggling, Nine Ways to Mastery, Read to Write Books‚Äîto help writers elevate their writing practice and readers to engage more deeply in enjoying and discussing books. Throughout her multi-faceted creative career, she‚Äôs found that resilience is key to a rewarding career in the arts. She brings that resilience to teaching revision as a writing skill, as well as a practice.

title: 11th Annual Farmers' Convergence
location: University of California Hopland Research and Extension Center
description:
The School of Adaptive Agriculture invites you to the 11th Annual Farmers‚Äô Convergence on February 21, 2026, at the UC Hopland Research & Extension Center in Hopland, CA. 

This beloved farmer-to-farmer gathering is entering an exciting new chapter. After a decade of grassroots success, the Farmers‚Äô Convergence is expanding to UC Hopland REC, marking a significant evolution that bridges lived farming experience with deep ecological practices. This partnership represents a deeper commitment to regenerative land stewardship and our local food economy. 

The event will bring together farmers, gardeners, schools and food activists, from beginners to seasoned veterans, conventional to experimental, for innovative solutions, knowledge exchange, and forward-thinking strategies. Together, we‚Äôll explore soil regeneration, biodiversity, systems thinking, and economic sustainability while renewing our collective inspiration and momentum. It will include events the day before, and after. 

Everyone belongs in this conversation. Tickets are limited, so don‚Äôt delay. We hope you will join us as we champion collaborative progress and expanded possibility. 

Learn more: www.schoolofadaptiveagriculture.org/convergence

title: Lake Sonoma Hike
description:
Go Wild Hikers
Wildflowers are early this year, and I have already seen some Orchids. Join me in search of early wildflowers at Lake Sonoma. We'll hike through a magical madrone forest, take in beautiful expansive views of the Mayacamas Mountain range as well as the Dry Creek and Warm Springs arms of Lake Sonoma. We will visit some of the largest manzanita and madrone trees I've seen. Best for individuals and dogs with at least a moderate level of fitness.

**Where We Meet/Important Directions**
Little Flat Parking (A large gravel parking lot)
From Hwy 101 take Dry Creek Road west towards Lake Sonoma. Go up the hill and across the bridge over the lake. Pay Attention, it's the first right turn into "Little Flat" parking lot.
Give yourself plenty of time to arrive. It's often farther than you think.

**Group Hike #333**
Dry Creek, No Name, North Slope and Bummer trails - a loop hike
Length - +/-5 miles/8 kilometers
Elevation change - +/-900 feet/274 meters
Difficulty - 7+ out of 10 some short steep rocky sections
Must be sure footed (confident and competent)!
Exposures - +/-30 % sun/70% shade - creek crossings, rocky, muddy, poison oak, ticks/insects.
Bring plenty of water. At least 68 oz./2 liters!
Dogs - Yes, must be healthy, well behaved and on a leash.
Facilities at trail head - None - Port O Potti about 1.5 miles in.
Cost - $5 cash
Parking -$7-day pass can be purchased on-site using a credit card through the Recreation.gov mobile app. Once on-site, follow the posted Scan & Pay instructions. You will need to download the free Recreation.gov mobile app prior to your arrival as some remote areas have limited or no cellular service. For more information about paying on-site, click here: [How Do I Use a Scan & Pay QR Code to Purchase an Activity Pass?](https://recreationonestoptest.servicenowservices.com/external?id=kb_article&sys_id=2011ea4a1b84bcd076c1dbdbe54bcb1d)
Remember to wear appropriate hiking shoes, bring plenty of water for your dog too, a hat, snack, layered clothing.
Please Do Not Use Any scented products the day of a group hike!
Of course, we will all look out for each other but ultimately, hikers are responsible for their own safety and well-being during hikes.

**After Hike Gathering?**
Quail & Condor
Bakery and Caf√©
44 Mill St Unit J
Healdsburg, CA 95448
[https://www.quailandcondor.com/](https://www.quailandcondor.com/)
(707) 473-8254
Outstanding new location with plenty of parking and a beautiful cafe. Behind the Parish Caf√© at the roundabout.

**When We Meet**
Sunday February 22, 2026
9:00 am - 12:00 pm
If your plans change after you sign up even if you're on the waitlist, please update your RSVP.
Do Not Attend if you are sick, running a fever, were exposed to or have tested positive for Covid-19 or any other contagion!
Hike may be changed, rescheduled or cancelled in case of excessive heat, rain, smoke/AQI, illness, zombie apocalypse etc... Check your email the night before for any possible changes.

**Notice to New Hikers Only**
**"When a New Hiker (never hiked with me before) doesn't show up (No Show) to their first hike with the group, they will be removed (not banned) from the group immediately."**

title: Online: The Inheritance of Wholeness
description:
with Amana Brembry Johnson

There is a knowing that lives beneath thought, an ancient intelligence woven into the fabric of our being. The Buddha taught that everything needed for liberating the heart is already here, within this body. The path is not about becoming different, but remembering all that has been obscured by the habits of conditioning and forgetfulness.

By returning to the body as a living archive that has never stopped guiding us, we reconnect with the sacred inheritance of wholeness‚Äîa continuity passed down through the Buddhadharma and the unbroken line of ancestors whose memories flow within us. This daylong will include silent sitting meditation, Dharma reflections, breath awareness, and gentle interpersonal connections. During our time together we will reconnect with what is already ours, a sense of belonging, spacious presence, and the dignity of simply being alive.¬†Open to both new and experienced practitioners.

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9‚ÄìMarch 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of¬†bonsai and the season‚Äôs first flowers.¬†Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year‚Äôs all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai‚Äîtrees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot¬†bonsai¬†take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal‚Äîreminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from¬†hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through¬†Hanami Strolls‚Äîguided walks through the Garden‚Äôs Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

title: The Journey: A Painter's Narrative

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

title: An Abstract Vision
description:
**Exhibition runs April 4 - May 30, 2026**

Deadline for Entries: March 9, 2026

An Abstract Vision celebrates the work of artists creating abstract art.

Abstract art moves beyond representation, with a strong emphasis on shape, color and form. Abstract art has the power to evoke emotions, appeal to our senses and transcend the physical world. Abstract expression captures the delicate, elusive, powerful and radiant energies that fly under the radar of explanation.

We are excited to have you share with us your visions in the abstract and look forward to putting together a dynamic exhibition of work that reflects the power and importance of abstract art.

Accepting the following mediums: painting, printmaking, photographs, sculpture, glass, wood, ceramics, fiber and paper.

title: Art Exhibit:  Color of Love
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE¬† 1/15/26

**FEBRURY EXHIBIT: COLOR OF LOVE**

EXHIBIT DATES:¬† January 26 ‚Äì February 22, 2026

**RECEPTION: SATURDAY, FEBRUARY 7, 2026, 3 ‚Äì 5 pm: Join in to meet the artists, celebrate the show and welcome the season of love. Take part in the Gallery‚Äôs free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.¬† Refreshments will be served.**

Sonoma County artists, **Linda Barretta, Nancy Gray, Bev Haley, Phyllis Rapp, Donna Schaffer, Tosya Shore, Luba Stolper and Gen Zorich** present the **Color of Love,** paintings that bring out the excitement and fun of the Valentine season.¬† Red takes a starring role in these works set against a broad spectrum of complementary violets, blues, and greens.¬† In Gray‚Äôs ‚ÄúLove Abstractly‚Äù an iconic heart is transformed through bold splashes of color. ¬†Stolper brings us delicious red delights in her ‚ÄúBowl of Strawberries,‚Äù ¬†fruit rendered so realistically, one‚Äôs mouth waters. ¬†Paintings by Haley, Schaffer and Zorich celebrate the coming of Spring with color-rich floral displays ‚Äì tulips and scarlet buglers.¬† Rapp and Barretta offer a nod to our feathered and furry friends. Barretta‚Äôs jaunty raven cocks his head as he offers up a heart on a red ribbon in ‚ÄúRaven Heart‚Äù and Rapp‚Äôs little fox peers at us from a bed of flowers in ‚ÄúFoxy Flowers.‚Äù¬† Shore‚Äôs ‚ÄúShowering You with Gifts‚Äù catches our eye with a sleek figure sporting a stunning red umbrella.¬† ‚ÄúAs we welcome the sunnier days and flowers in the fields, Valentine‚Äôs Day with its rich color palette is such a glorious way to celebrate the seasonal transition,‚Äù noted Gray.¬† ¬†

The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features **Laura Roney‚Äôs Dance!,** a collection of works that explores dance in its many forms. Part of cultures throughout the world, dance expression takes on styles that can be structured, such as ballet, or, by contrast, free flowing.¬† And dance is a beloved part of the dating scene, whether slow-dancing or rocking out.¬† In ‚ÄúHold Me Tight‚Äù one feels the close connection of the couple dancing on Valentine‚Äôs Day.¬† Another couple joyfully whoops it up in ‚ÄúBust a Move.‚Äù Bring on the music ‚Äì these works make one want to get a move on.

title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description: Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

title: Cool Team Leader Half-Day Training
description:
Cool Petaluma is about to launch a new cohort of Cool Team Leaders! 

In the current day, some of our strongest resources are our communities and neighbors. What better way to kick off 2026 than by building bonds with the people around you?

The Cool Teams program brings people together to take care of each other while taking care of the planet. Neighborhood-based Cool Teams are the most popular option, but the program has expanded to include friend groups, faith-based groups, and coworkers‚Äìwhoever forms your team.

Our Team Leader Training is where dedicated community members can step up and learn how to become Team Leaders. This training will show you how to gather neighbors or friends and kickstart community climate action! Including information on climate change, guides on how to host a cool event, and how to create real change, this training will give you everything you need to know so you can become a Team Leader in your own community.

Remember to bring a water bottle and a snack for the day!

title: Knitting Basics
description:
Ready to get cozy with some yarn? Join Becca Schillinger for a chill intro to knitting where you'll learn the basics and make a small project to take home!

Never picked up needles before? No worries! Becca will walk you through everything from casting on \(aka getting started\) to nailing the knit stitch. You'll work on a small project using the garter stitch, then learn how to cast off when you're done. She'll also demo some handy tricks like increases, decreases, and how to read patterns without your brain melting.

title: Becoming Beloved Community
description: Journey to the meaning, history, and current reality of Becoming Beloved Community, a tenet of Dr. King‚Äôs and a way of life that stresses wholeness for humanity. Jennifer Snow, scholar and author of Mission Race and Empire, will sketch the history and theology of the Becoming Beloved Community way of life, through activists, priests, and churches. Kirstyne Lange, President of the Santa Rosa/Sonoma County NAACP, will describe the present state of the Sonoma County racial justice experience. Stephen Shaver, Rector of The Church of Incarnation, will offer a pastor‚Äôs view of how a thriving church strives for Beloved Community.

Each tune turns familiar melodies into vibrant, jazz experiences that introduce kids to rhythm, improvisation, and musical storytelling. Whether you‚Äôre a toddler, a jazz-curious parent, or a lifelong music lover, this is a show where everyone walks away with joy, discovery, and a deeper appreciation for jazz.

title: Occidental Center for the Arts: Double Book Party, Music & Art: A Trifecta!
description: An entrancing afternoon with two esteemed poets,¬†**Donna Emerson and Gerald Fleming**, with selected readings from their recent collections, respectively,¬†*Daphne Lifts Up*¬†and¬†*The Bastard & The Bishop.*¬†musical interludes on various stringed instruments from award-winning composer and musician,¬†**Jared Emerson-Johnson**. title: Poetry, Music and Art! A Trifecta!
description: Join us for an entrancing afternoon with two esteemed poets, Donna Emerson and Gerald Fleming, with selected readings from their recent poetry collections, respectively, Daphne Lifts Up and The Bastard & The Bishop. Our audience will be swept away by musical interludes on various stringed instruments from award-winning composer and musician, Jared Emerson-Johnson. Local watercolor artist and college instructor, Barbara Marlin, creator of the Daphne Lifts Up book cover will display the original artwork and selected prints of other work at the event. Following the readings and music, a Q&A will follow, with book sales and signing in the lobby. Refreshments will be available for sale. This is free event, all donations always gratefully accepted.    Donna Emerson divides her time between Petaluma, California, and her family homestead near Ithaca, New York. Retired from teaching at Santa Rosa Jr. College and her clinical social work practice, her recent poetry publications include La Pressa, The Paterson Literary Review, and Weber: The Contemporary West. Her chapbooks: This Water, 2007, Body Rhymes, 2009, Wild Mercy, 2011, and Following Hay, 2013. Her poetry books are The Place of Our Meeting \(Finishing Line Press, 2018\) and Beside the Well \(Cherry Grove Collections. 2019\). And now, Daphne Lifts Up \(Finishing Line Press, 2025\). Donna has received two nominations for the Pushcart Prize, one for "Best of the Net," two nominations for the California Book Award \(Body Rhymes, 2009, The Place of Our Meeting, 2018\), five awards from the annual Allen Ginsberg Contests, and numerous regional awards for her poetry, creative non-fiction, and prose. Many of her poems appear in journals or anthologies with her black and white or color photography. Anais Nin used Donna's portraits of Anais in her late diaries and press coverage in the New York Times.  Donna has taught poetry to elementary school children and made it part of her community college classrooms \(1990-2015\). She worked as a volunteer with Alzheimer's patients at a residential facility to help them create individual and group poems and served as Board member and Events Chair for the Marin Poetry Center \(2012-2014\). Donna's latest book, "Daphne Lifts Up" includes poems about nature around us, nature within us, and relationships with many different people, from family to counseling clients, to students, colleagues at work, animals, birds, and strangers. It addresses birth, illness, death, and resiliency in all these verses.    Gerald Fleming is the author of the poetry collections The Bastard and the Bishop \(Hanging Loose Press, 2021\), One \(Hanging Loose, 2016\), The Choreographer \(Sixteen Rivers Press, 2013\), Night of Pure Breathing \(Hanging Loose, 2011\), and Swimmer Climbing onto Shore \(Sixteen Rivers, 2005\). His work has appeared in many magazines over the decades, including New Letters, Michigan Quarterly Review, Hanging Loose, Carolina Quarterly, New World Writing, Volt, Paris Lit Up, and Versal.  Fleming edited the print magazines Barnabe Mountain Review and Forward to Velma, the vitreous magazine One \(More\) Glass, and The Collected Poetry & Prose of Lawrence Fixel \(Sixteen Rivers, 2021\). He has written numerous books for teachers, including Rain, Steam, and Speed \(Jossey-Bass/Wiley, 2005\), and lives most of the year near San Francisco, part of the year in Paris. Fleming, a master of the prose poem, is never satisfied to sing the same song, and this adventuresome spirit pays dividends in these new prose poems. Constantly surprising and inventive,  The Bastard and the Bishop offers stories within stories that effortlessly merge the personal and the archetypal, breathing new life into a genre that has increasingly, and often sadly, become predictable.     Jared Emerson-Johnson is a video game music composer, sound designer, voice director and voice actor. He is the Music Supervisor and lead composer at Bay Area Sound, an audio production company specializing in sound design, music a

title: The Train Talk
description:
Railroad historian and former Northwestern Pacific and Southern Pacific officer Fred Codoni will discuss the history of the railroad in Sonoma County, from the early horse-drawn streetcars ‚Äì ‚Äòhorse car lines‚Äô ‚Äì to the formation of the Petaluma & Santa Rosa Railroad \(P&SR\) that went through Sebastopol. The current West County Museum in downtown Sebastopol was the terminal.¬† Fred Codoni‚Äôs collection of over 14,000 railroad images across this history represents a powerful and unique set of artifacts that bring to life an amazing century of change across transportation, manufacturing, and rural life. He has worked for the railroad industry since 1956, and is the last surviving member of the Northwest Pacific Railroad. As a member of the Western Railway Museum, Fred often ran P&SR passenger car No. 63 at the Western Railway museum at Rio Vista junction, the only remaining operating car from that railroad.

This talk is a project from the Western Sonoma County Historical Society. It will be preceded by a short update by the society board about what is happening at the Historical Society.

title: Forbidden Puppet Cabaret at the Museum
description:

title: Benise
description:
Emmy Award Winning Spanish Guitar and Dance Spectacular.

It‚Äôs one hot night as Benise celebrates 25 years of fiery Spanish guitar and dance. 

Benise \(pronounced Buh-nes-say\) shattered the mold of Spanish guitar by combining world music and dance ‚Äì the only show of its kind! 

2025 marks the year that Benise, ‚ÄúThe Prince of Spanish Guitar,‚Äù launches his 25th Anniversary Tour and 8th PBS Special ‚Äú25 Years of Passion!‚Äù 

 Armed with his Spanish guitar and a stage full of musicians and elaborately choreographed dancers, Benise takes the audience on a musical journey through Spanish Flamenco, Cuban Salsa, Brazilian Samba, Parisian Waltz, exotic drumming, and more! 

The 25th Anniversary tour establishes Benise‚Äôs Emmy Award winning show as one of the longest running Latin-themed theatrical productions touring the world.

For Benise, music has always been a journey. From his humble beginnings as a street performer, to being featured on the \#1 rated show in the USA ‚Äì Dancing With The Stars. Guitarist and creative force behind the event, Benise, comments ‚ÄúI wanted to push the boundaries of Nuevo Flamenco/Spanish guitar while combining the elements of dance and theater. This show is a celebration of all the shows we‚Äôve done over the last 25 years.‚Äù 

The Emmy Award-winning composer along with an international cast of musicians and dancers will entertain audiences with a two-hour show that ‚Äúis an escape from all of their problems,‚Äù Benise says. Beyond the new material, Benise says ‚Äúthe live show will incorporate some fan favorites from my street performing days and rock classics like Led Zeppelin‚Äôs Kashmir and AC/DC‚Äôs Thunderstruck.‚Äù In addition, Benise adds his signature touch to classics such as ‚ÄúAve Maria, ‚ÄúMoonlight Sonata,‚Äù and Vivaldi‚Äôs ‚ÄúSummer‚Äù from The Four Seasons.

Benise adds, ‚ÄúThis is a great show for the whole family; I really think we have something for everyone. I hope people will be inspired by our story, by the music, by the production--and have the passion to follow their own dreams.‚Äù 

The Theatrical World Music and Dance spectacle that has been called ‚ÄúThe Latin Riverdance‚Äù 

‚ÄòThe Prince of Spanish Guitar‚Äô  - Dancing With The Stars

‚ÄòBennissimo!‚Äô - Chicago News

‚ÄòExtreme Flamenco Fusion‚Äô - Screen India
