description:
**Debra Koehler** will share her writing journey, from believing she couldn't possibly be imaginative enough to write fiction, to producing a four-book fantasy series, the first of which she self-published August, 2025.

She will share tips on how to keep going with your writing project even when you get so fed up you want to throw it away. Which she did. Multiple times. Only to pull it out of the recycling bin, smooth out the pages, and keep going. Debra will also cover how using intuition to trust her¬†story, as well as her writing process, helped her move beyond the setbacks and blocks that can be part of any writer's journey.

title: Samba no P√© - First Class
description:
Get ready to feel the rhythm and energy of Rio de Janeiro!¬†Samba no P√©¬†\(Samba in the Foot\) is the captivating solo style of samba danced in the streets and at Carnival, known for its rapid, intricate footwork and infectious hip movements.

You will learn

The Basic Step: You will master the signature quick-quick-slow rhythm that defines Samba no P√©.

Arm & Hip Styling: You will learn how to add the authentic flair, movement, and energy that makes Brazilian samba so captivating.

Technique & Posture: You will receive tips on proper body alignment to help you dance longer, faster, and more safely.

Rhythm & Musicality: You will learn how to connect your movement directly to the irresistible beat of the bateria \(the samba drum section\).

This class is perfect for anyone looking to connect with the vibrant spirit of Brazil, improve coordination, and get a fantastic workout‚Äîall while learning the foundational steps of this iconic dance. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

title: Forr√≥ Dance with Eric and Abigail
description:
Get ready to connect, spin, and glide to the irresistible rhythms of¬†Forr√≥! Originating in the Northeast of Brazil, Forr√≥ is a captivating partner dance known for its close embrace, playful steps, and infectious, feel-good music. It is a social dance that will enrich your life, perfect for a night out or a casual gathering.

You Will Learn:

The Basic Step & Close Embrace: You will master the foundational quick-quick-slow rhythm and learn how to comfortably and confidently navigate the essential close-hold connection that defines Forr√≥.

Leading & Following Techniques: Discover the clear, subtle body cues required to effortlessly lead your partner through turns and variations, and how to follow with grace and responsiveness.

Traveling & Stationary Patterns: Learn fundamental steps like the ‚ÄòCaminhada‚Äô \(walking step\) and common stationary turns that will allow you to dance on any size floor.

Rhythm & Musicality: Connect your movement to the distinct musical styles of Forr√≥‚Äîfrom the mellow ‚ÄòXote‚Äô to the faster, more energetic ‚ÄòP√©-de-Serra.‚Äô

This class is perfect for anyone looking to learn a social partner dance, connect with Brazilian culture, and enjoy a vibrant, community atmosphere. No partner or prior dance experience is required! Just bring your enthusiasm and comfortable shoes!

Class Details

Note:¬†Arrive 10 minutes before. No floor marking shoe soles allowed.

title: Ambrosia
description:
The year is 1970, and four young musicians from the South Bay of Los Angeles, come together to create a new invigorating style of music exploring the possibilities of progressive, classical and world influences; rooted with the soul of the blues and R&B.

 

Originally labeled as America‚Äôs answer to progressive English acts such as ‚ÄúYes‚Äù and ‚ÄúKing Crimson‚Äù, the group quickly proved that and much more, garnering an impressive 5 Grammy Nominations, 5 Hit Singles, heavy airplay, and the admiration and respect of the musical community.  All this was in addition to sold out concerts around the world; attracting  collaborations with such cultural icons as Leonard Bernstein, Kurt Vonnegut Jr., and Alan Parsons.

 

Today, the band is more alive and compelling than ever with founding members Joe Puerta on bass & lead vocals, Burleigh Drummond on drums, and Christopher North on organ/synth; with the additions of Doug Jackson on electric guitar, Mary Harris on keyboards, and the powerful and contemporary lead vocals of Kipp Lennon‚Ä¶ Together Ambrosia is exploring new musical territory and continuing to wow life-long fans and new converts alike !

www.ambrosialive.net 

www.facebook.com/Ambrosiatheband  

www.instagram.com/ambrosiatheband

Joseph Puerta - bass /lead vocals

title: Vallejo, CA - Spinning Babies¬Æ Workshop w/ Nikki
description: Spinning Babies¬Æ begins with fetal rotation to reveal the lesser known physiology of birth anatomy. Your passion, our approach. Start seeing solutions in labor progress with this new lens on childbirth. After this workshop you will be able to: -Facilitate comfort in pregnancy and ease in childbirth for your clients -Improve fetal position without manipulation of the fetus - Identify issues faster; gentle actions to shorten a long labor or avoid a cesarean -Use less\(or no\) force to resolve malposition and labor dystocia And much, much more! Spinning Babies¬Æ Three PrinciplesSM. Three BalancesSM, and Three Levels Solutions offers the world‚Äôs first complete system of birth preparation and labor ease concepts using baby‚Äôs position. Physiological techniques change the effective size of the pelvis through the body‚Äôs own innate capacity to resolve or prevent labor dystocia. Who May Attend We welcome all professionals who serve people in their pregnancy and birth. Ideal for midwives, nurses, nurse practitioners, doulas and childbirth educators. Also attended by obstetricians, family medicine doctors, prenatal yoga instructors, chiropractors, acupuncturists, massage therapists, perinatal case managers, and community health workers. Recommended for people new to Spinning Babies¬Æ, as well as those practiced in it for years. CEs are available for some participants, as noted in the Continuing Education section below. Food and Refreshments Snacks, coffee, and tea will be provided. We will take a 60-minute lunch break. Bring a lunch or go out with new friends.  Special Notes Dress comfortably as we will be moving around and practicing techniques with each other. Please contact the organizer if you are able to supply a massage table for the workshop.   Public Host Information: Host Name: Kaitlyn Pfeiffer Host Email: kaitlynepfeiffer@gmail.com Cancellation Policy If you will miss this workshop due to attending a birth, you must notify the organizer before the workshop begins. Refunds will not be granted without prior notification. If you need to cancel for other reasons, please contact the organizer. About the Trainer - Nikki Zerfas Nikki Zerfas is an experienced Labor & Delivery nurse. She actively participates in the orientation and mentorship of new staff and works to bring educational opportunities to her colleagues, with emphasis on implementing physiology-based birth practices, continuous labor support, and emphasizing breastfeeding-friendly care of new families. She is especially focused on supporting physiological birth in complex medical situations. Nikki maintains her certifications in Electronic Fetal Monitoring and as an International Board Certified Lactation Consultant. She continues to work as a bedside nurse and enjoys bringing birth workers of all disciplines together in the goal of improving the care and outcomes of new families. Continuing Education Maternity House Publishing, Inc. \(dba Spinning Babies ¬Æ\) is accredited as a provider of Nursing Continuing Professional Development by the American Nurses Credentialing Center's Commission on Accreditation \(ANCC\). This activity has been awarded 7 contact hours through ANCC. The American Academy of Family Physicians has granted Spinning Babies¬Æ Workshop 7.0 Contact hours of Elective Continuing Medical Education credits for the One-day workshop. Many doula and childbirth education organizations accept these contact hours; check your organization‚Äôs policies. Advanced Offerings See our Spinning Babies¬Æ online course catalog for current list of virtual workshops and trainings. The Spinning Babies¬Æ Workshop is the prerequisite for taking Spinning Babies¬Æ Integration Workshops, the Spinning Babies¬Æ Certified Parent Educator Training or Spinning Babies¬Æ Aware Practitioner Workshop. You can attend a Resolving Shoulder Dystocia and Breech Basics Workshops before you have attended a Spinning Babies¬Æ workshop, but we recommend you attend the Spinning Babies¬Æ workshop workshop first. Terms of Use This workshop does not provide a certification in Spinning Babies¬ÆÔ∏è only a document of attendance. Participants will not be able to use the name Spinning Babies¬Æ to describe their services, such as offering Spinning Babies¬ÆÔ∏è, sessions, or saying ‚Äútrained in Spinning Babies‚Äù after registering for or attending this workshop. Participants may use concepts and techniques introduced in the workshop in the participant‚Äôs practices. Further training is available for eligible participants which does lead towards a contractual relationship for listing or certification and use of Spinning Babies¬ÆÔ∏è brand and name. Tax Exemption If you are associated with an organization that is tax exempt, you will be able to indicate this on the payment page. If someone from your organization has submitted a tax exemption form to Spinning Babies¬ÆÔ∏è previously, please contact your organization to use a tax exemption form code. Otherwise, you can upload a .pdf version of your tax exemption form on the payment page and will be required to pay tax at time of purchase, but will be refunded if/when your form is accepted by Spinning Babies¬ÆÔ∏è.

title: Cool Team Leader Half-Day Training
description:
Cool Petaluma is about to launch a new cohort of Cool Team Leaders! 

In the current day, some of our strongest resources are our communities and neighbors. What better way to kick off 2026 than by building bonds with the people around you?

The Cool Teams program brings people together to take care of each other while taking care of the planet. Neighborhood-based Cool Teams are the most popular option, but the program has expanded to include friend groups, faith-based groups, and coworkers‚Äìwhoever forms your team.

Our Team Leader Training is where dedicated community members can step up and learn how to become Team Leaders. This training will show you how to gather neighbors or friends and kickstart community climate action! Including information on climate change, guides on how to host a cool event, and how to create real change, this training will give you everything you need to know so you can become a Team Leader in your own community.

Remember to bring a water bottle and a snack for the day!

title: What About Age? Art Exhibit
description:
*What About Age?*¬†art exhibit has arrived in Marin County! Originally displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows, this exhibit explores ageism through contemporary art, featuring works by both local youth and senior artists.

*What About Age?*¬†is an art exhibit and educational initiative designed to challenge stereotypes about aging, address ageism and social isolation, and promote intergenerational dialogue through the lens of art.

In partnership with Youth in Arts, the exhibit features artworks by local youth and senior artists, showcasing how age intersects with creativity, identity, and experience. Under the guidance of Youth in Arts, these emerging and established artists work side by side to create collaborative pieces, fostering meaningful connections between generations and reflecting the exhibit‚Äôs core message: art is ageless.

The exhibit also includes artwork panels by New York-based writer and illustrator Aubrey Hirsch, first displayed at NYU‚Äôs Kimmel Windows and originally organized by Stacey Gordon, NYU‚Äôs Program Director of Next Phase Adult Caregiving and Retirement at Work Life.

The new exhibition will be on view at the Marin County Civic Center galleries from January 26 to May 6, 2026. Works will be displayed on the first and third floor exhibits, Monday to Friday from 9 a.m. to 6 p.m.

The *What About Age?* art exhibit is presented by Marin Cultural Association in partnership with Marin Community Foundation and Youth in Arts. Beyond the art exhibit, the *What About Age?* initiative offers programming, led by Vivalon, designed to challenge ageism and provide resources for Marin County's growing aging population.

title: Introduction to the Art of Bookmaking
description:
Schedule

Fridays, February 20 ‚Äì March 13, 2026 10:00 AM ‚Äì 1:00 PM

Experience Level

All Levels

Event Categories: Fiber Arts, Other, Printmaking

Age\(s\)

18 and older

$220 ‚Äì Registration Cost $30 ‚Äì Materials Fee $250 ‚Äì Total Registration CostLearn essential bookbinding techniques in this 4-week introduction to book arts. Create zines, pamphlets, accordion folds, and more using traditional paper-folding and stitching methods.

What you‚Äôll do

Join guest artist, Bettina Pauly in this incredible introduction to book arts! The art of bookmaking, otherwise known as bookbinding, is the physical craft of creating an artistic book from start to finish. In this introductory 4-session class, you will learn the basic use of bookbinding tools and materials, along with simple bookbinding structures that utilize paper softcovers. Students will learn several basic bookbinding structures and stitches that every beginning book artist should know! Experience technical skills such as paper folding, cutting, sewing and gluing, mixed with artistic elements of design to create functional, elegant objects built for storytelling. The instructor will offer guided instruction in a supportive learning environment with a limited class size. Each 3-hour session will meet for four consecutive weeks and focus on the following core bookbinding techniques:

Session 1: Intro to tools and paper folding; one sheet wonder zine, ‚Äòpants‚Äô fold with and without cover, map folds

Session 2: Pamphlets, and Japanese stab hole binding; three hole pamphlet stitch, five hole pamphlet stitch, Japanese stab binding two holes / five holes¬†

Session 3: Accordion folds; accordion fold, accordion fold tipped into envelope cover, accordion fold with non-adhesive cover

Session 4: Magic wallets, and personal projects

The class materials fee will include paper and all the tools needed to create each of these projects. Students will be able to take home all of their book projects at the end of the workshop. Please note: This class requires some hand dexterity to maneuver bookbinding tools. Participants should feel comfortable using tools with sharp edges such as an awl, x-acto knife, and scissors.

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9‚ÄìMarch 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of¬†bonsai and the season‚Äôs first flowers.¬†Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year‚Äôs all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai‚Äîtrees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot¬†bonsai¬†take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal‚Äîreminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from¬†hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through¬†Hanami Strolls‚Äîguided walks through the Garden‚Äôs Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

Date and Time: Saturday January 10, 2026 at 10:00 am to Sunday March 8, 2026 at 4:00 pm

title: An Abstract Vision
description:
**Exhibition runs April 4 - May 30, 2026**

Deadline for Entries: March 9, 2026

An Abstract Vision celebrates the work of artists creating abstract art.

Abstract art moves beyond representation, with a strong emphasis on shape, color and form. Abstract art has the power to evoke emotions, appeal to our senses and transcend the physical world. Abstract expression captures the delicate, elusive, powerful and radiant energies that fly under the radar of explanation.

We are excited to have you share with us your visions in the abstract and look forward to putting together a dynamic exhibition of work that reflects the power and importance of abstract art.

Accepting the following mediums: painting, printmaking, photographs, sculpture, glass, wood, ceramics, fiber and paper.

title: Art Exhibit: Celebrating Women
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE¬† 2/13/26

**MARCH EXHIBIT: CELEBRATING WOMEN**

EXHIBIT DATES:¬† February 23 ‚Äì March 29, 2026

**RECEPTION: SATURDAY, MARCH 7, 2026, 4-6 pm: Join in to meet the artists and celebrate the show. Take part in the Gallery‚Äôs free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.¬† Refreshments will be served.**

Sonoma County artist, **Tosya Shore,** presents **Celebrating Women,** paintings that commemorate women in honor of Women‚Äôs History Month. Shore‚Äôs watercolor works capture women in their element, showing the multiple facets of their lives.¬† These dynamic paintings break away with strong shapes and interlacing patterns that draw the viewer in exciting ways.¬† A la Degas, we catch a ballet dancer lacing her shoes in ‚ÄúGood Point.‚Äù¬† The artist takes us into nature with ‚ÄúRedwood Rendezvous‚Äù where dominant trunk shapes frame a couple enjoying a glorious forest scene.¬†¬† ¬†‚ÄúJust Back from Vegas‚Äù captures a fleeting view of elegance as the woman in question catches her breath.¬† ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs such special feeling in these everyday moments, I love to turn the mundane into magic ‚Äì women deserve nothing less,‚Äù noted Shore.¬†

Meet the artist: Shore will be hosting the Gallery on March 5 and 19 from 11am to 6 pm.

¬†The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features **Donna Schaffer‚Äôs Ooh La La, Plein Air,** a collection unveiling oil paintings made on her recent trip to France.¬† Roaming the streets of Paris, toting paints and palette, Schaffer captured iconic scenes buzzing with ‚Äúla belle vie.‚Äù The viewer catches a true cultural vibe in ‚ÄúCaf√© le Bistro‚Äù, the site of a favored hangout for espresso and conversation.¬† One is awed by the structure rising from the ground-level trees in Schaffer‚Äôs unique view of the Eiffel Tower in ‚ÄúParis is for Lovers.‚Äù ‚ÄúEvery day was an adventure in Paris ‚Äì I hope through these plein air vignettes, to share the excitement of being there‚Äù, stated Schaffer.

Meet the artist: Schaffer will be hosting the Gallery on March 21 and 22 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. (707) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am ‚Äì 6 pm.¬†¬†¬† **www.upstairsart gallery.net** 

For further information: Contact: Beverly Bird, Press Contact, at bvdrio@sonic.net or 707-799-1490.

title: Grape to Glass Experience
description:
Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. Note: This tasting experience requires a 48-hour advanced reservation.

$95 per guest | Special Club Member Pricing

title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description: Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

title: Shut Up & Write!‚Ñ¢ Santa Rosa REMOTE ZOOM FRIDAY
description:
Shut Up & Write!¬Æ Wine Country
**This event is hosted on the Shut Up & Write website, so please [sign up here](https://shutupwrite.com/series/shut-up-write-online-with-lorraine-s/7480) for your writing event.**

**ABOUT THE EVENT**
Welcome! I will email passcode to those who register.
Be sure to enable email on MeetUp!
Then, please check your email!
Join us virtually for an hour + of writing using Zoom. Let's keep together as much as we can during these uncertain times and keep on writing. Look for the schedule online and join us.

We‚Äôve discovered that it‚Äôs strikingly helpful to write with other writers. See if it‚Äôs true for you at 3pm on Friday afternoon. Be it a book, blog, script, essay, dissertation, resume, melody, poem or just plain work stuff, you are invited to write it with us. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice. Instead of just thinking about writing, come and get some real writing done.

JOIN US!

1. RSVP - space is limited to 12 people. (registration closes at one half hour before the event starts). You will receive the link to access the event at that time. REMEMBER TO CHECK YOUR EMAIL FOR PASSCODE!
2. Before or at 3pm join the meeting with the link you receive AND ADD PASSCODE.

Please note:

1. If you don't have Zoom set up on your computer yet, leave 15-30 minutes ahead of time to get it set up!
2. If you have difficulty with audio (don't have a microphone set up), as long as you have a speaker, you can call in (you'll see phone numbers when you log in).
3. If you are late, you won't be able to intro with us, but you are still welcome to join in.
4. If you won't be able to make it, please cancel so that the space is available to another writer.

SCHEDULE:
3:00 - quick intros.
around 3:10 - timer starts: write for 70 mins.
4:20 - (the end) wrap up

Wherever you are, we hope to see you online! Keep on writing...
Regards,
Lorraine Segal
source: Meetup: Shut Up & Write Wine Country

description:
We‚Äôre offering Adult Gymnastics Classes for the 18\+ crowd!

Adult Gymnastics classes occur¬†every Tuesday 5:00 PM to 6:30 PM & Friday¬†from¬†6:30 PM to 8:00 PM.

$20 per person, OR pay for a whole 8-week session in advance through our site. You can attend on Tuesday, Friday, or both!

Please bring the class fee in cash at the time of arrival. This can be a DROP IN, so there is no need to sign up online before coming!

If you‚Äôve ever wanted to try out gymnastics or get back into it in adulthood, now is your chance! During our adult classes, open to all genders, our coaches will move at the pace of each student, helping them achieve goals they set for themselves.¬†No experience is necessary¬†to be involved in this class, so this is a great opportunity to learn the basics and get some exercise, no matter what age you are! Try out our trampoline, bars, beam, and other gym equipment in a safe and supportive environment. You can build strength and increase your range of motion while having fun like you‚Äôre a kid again.

Ask our coaches what you can work on between classes, and they‚Äôll help personalize your training!

Please wear something comfortable and keep long hair tied back. Skirts and restrictive clothing are not recommended. You must remove your shoes before going onto the mat or using equipment. Please let us know if you have any physical limitations or health conditions that may interfere with doing certain motions. We recommend bringing a water bottle.

You can email us for more info or join our mailing list at:¬†info@sonomagymnasticsacademy.com

title: Online: Resilience & the Open Heart: Somatic Practices for Everyday Stress
description:
**with Pawan Bareja, PhD**

When we are out of alignment with our deepest heart values, life feels stressful. Whether the trigger is personal heartbreak, economic pressure, relational conflict, or the weight of the climate crisis, the body often reacts with anxiety, collapse, anger, or overwhelm long before the mind can make sense of it. You are invited to move from stress to love by transforming these patterns through embodied heart practices.

Each week, we will begin by gently noticing where activation lives in the body.¬†We‚Äôll then engage in embodied heart-opening practices to soothe the nervous system and reconnect with inner clarity. After practice, we will re-check the nervous system to observe what has shifted, revealing resilience as something softly felt, measurable, and trainable.

As the heart opens and the body softens, many experience deeper rest, clearer thinking, a renewed sense of connection to loved ones, and the courage to live a more meaningful life.

title: Healdsburg After Dark Stand-Up Comedy with Steve Ausburne
description:
We said we were a community hub, right? We said we bring Healdsburg to life? Well‚Ä¶ it‚Äôs time to put our money where our mouth is. And we‚Äôre doing it right! We‚Äôre kicking off a brand-new series of stand-up comedy nights with one of the best standup comedians in town (in our opinion, in other people‚Äôs opinions, and soon, in your opinion too): Steve Ausburne!

Maybe you laughed your face off at our last comedy night in November - or maybe you didn‚Äôt‚Ä¶ because you weren‚Äôt there. Either way, Steve is back. He‚Äôs our main man, living-room ringmaster, and the producer behind the show. Steve‚Äôs comedy career got its start as an MC for friends‚Äô bands, which eventually led to his first stand-up set - a set so memorable it earned him a lifetime ban from a church in Grants Pass, Oregon. But Steve didn‚Äôt let that slow him down. Instead, he embraced the stage as a place for brutally honest, painfully awkward life confessions - the kind usually reserved for therapy, or very, very funny comedy.

And he‚Äôs not coming alone.

Jalisa Robinson joins the lineup - a proud Midwesterner now living in California, and a 2022 Semi-Finalist in the San Francisco International Comedy Competition. She‚Äôs a favorite at The Punchline San Francisco, Cobb‚Äôs, San Jose Improv, Rooster T. Feathers, and Don‚Äôt Tell Comedy, and performs regularly at clubs and festivals across California and beyond. If sharp, witty, and hilarious is your vibe, Jalisa‚Äôs got you covered.

And then there‚Äôs Ronn Vigh - our headliner. Ronn has written for *Fashion Police* on E! Television and performs stand-up at clubs, colleges, and venues across the country. He still dreams of becoming a weatherman (we support the dream). In the meantime, he‚Äôs an avid yogi (when not hungover), a devoted *Golden Girls* fan, and - despite being gay - a lifelong football lover.

title: John Reischman and the Jaybirds
description: Bluegrass, old time and acoustic roots music with outstanding musicianship Like the powerful mandolinist and composer at its helm, John Reischman and the Jaybirds fashion a stylish take on bluegrass that seamlessly blends original songs and instrumentals with Appalachian old-time music for a truly unique band sound. Now in their 20th year, with seven acclaimed albums and two Juno nominations, the Jaybirds are simultaneously innovative and unadorned, sophisticated and stripped-down, happily old-fashioned and 21st-century contemporary.  Tickets are $35 advance, $40 at the door. Discount for OCA members. Doors open at 6:30 PM. OCA is wheelchair accessible. Art gallery open during intermission, refreshments for sale.  Get Tickets  Bluegrass Unlimited calls John Reischman "one of the world's undisputed masters" of the mandolin, famed for outstanding tone and taste. Many of his dozens of original instrumentals have become popular favourites for sessions and covers, such as the jam standard Saltspring. He has three critically-acclaimed solo instrumental albums and has recorded on many other projects, including the Grammy-winning True Life Blues: The Songs of Bill Monroe. John also plays Latin-based jazz and choro music with highly regarded finger-style acoustic guitarist/composer John Miller; the duo has released three superb albums. John began his career in the San Francisco Bay area in the early '80s with the eclectic Good Ol' Persons bluegrass band. He was an original member of the legendary "new acoustic" quartet, the jazz-influenced Tony Rice Unit, renowned for highly skilled instrumentals. John moved to Vancouver in the early '90s and in 1999 formed the Jaybirds. Of their latest album, Folk Radio UK said "On That Other Green Shore showcases an accomplished, experienced band at the peak of their powers, with musicianship of the very highest order." Peghead Nation called it "one of the most beguiling bluegrass-rooted recordings of 2017." Los Angeles, CA-based guitarist Patrick Sauber joined the Jaybirds in 2017. The veteran performer has played with, among others, Doc Watson, Richard Greene, John Jorgensen, Peter Rowan, Tim O'Brien and John Fogerty. He played on the 2016 Grammy-nominated album The Hazel and Alice Sessions by Laurie Lewis, and appeared in the film A Mighty Wind with Christopher Guest. Bluegrass Unlimited describes Patrick's playing on John's tune Daylighting the Creek as "a glorious flatpicking solo that hews back to the glory days of early bluegrass guitar." Chilliwack, BC-based Trisha Gagnon is portrayed by Sing Out! as "one of the most versatile" and "irresistible" lead vocalists in bluegrass, her strong and distinctive style ranging from "mournful and plaintive" to "hopeful and yearning." Trisha anchors what Dirty Linen magazine calls "gorgeous three-part harmonies." She's also known for songwriting, dating back to her early days with the award-winning B.C. bluegrass band Tumbleweed. Her solo album includes guests Vince Gill and Peter Rowan. Nanaimo, BC-based Nick Hornbuckle has developed his own voice on the five-string banjo - a two-finger roll unlike other contemporary banjo players. "Nick Hornbuckle's banjo can be downright spine-tingling," said the L.A Daily News. His solo album 12√ó2 \(\+/-1\), was nominated for a Canadian Folk Music Award in 2015, and Nick is a composer who also digs for rare old-time gems. His sprightly instrumental Wellesley Station on the new Jaybird album "showcases Nick's sharp picking and sense of melody," said Green Man Review. Spokane, WA-based Greg Spatz is hailed as a "world-class bluegrass fiddler" by Fiddler Magazine. Audiophile Audition says Greg's "virtuosic playing is flawlessly delivered time after time," while Bluegrass Unlimited says he "lays down some seriously fine bluegrass fiddle" on the latest Jaybirds release. His strong chops have made him a popular fixture down through the years on the West Coast, where he's played with iconic mandolinist Frank Wakefield, resophonic guitar master Rob Ickes, and many others including Laurie Lewis, Bryan Bowers, and Eli West and Cahalen Morrison. Greg also plays and records with Mighty Squirrel, has a solo album called Fiddler's Dream and a duo recording with his wife called All Along the Sea, and is an award-winning

title: The Savannah Sipping Society; a Jones Hope Wooten Comedy
description:
**Four Southern women turn life‚Äôs curve balls into an uproarious, heartwarming journey of friendship, laughter, and fresh starts.**

In this delightful, laugh-a-minute comedy, four unique Southern women, all needing to escape the sameness of their day-to-day routines, are drawn together by Fate‚Äîand an impromptu happy hour‚Äîand decide it‚Äôs high time to reclaim the enthusiasm for life they‚Äôve lost through the years. Over the course of six months, filled with laughter, hilarious misadventures, and the occasional liquid refreshment, these middle-aged women successfully bond and find the confidence to jump start their new lives. Together, they discover lasting friendships and a renewed determination to live in the moment‚Äîand most importantly, realize it‚Äôs never too late to make new old friends.

title: Water Tower
description:
Water Tower is the current moniker of multi-instrumentalist Kenny Feinstein‚Äôs musical brainchild, originally founded in 2005 in Portland. While their lineup has evolved over time, fuelled by Feinstein‚Äôs masterful song-crafting, fiercely DIY approach, and genre-bending sonic identity, Water Tower have established themselves as a global force to be reckoned with.

Pioneers of a new wave of bluegrass and old-time with a distinctly punk rock flair, Water Tower take influences from Foghorn Stringband and Bill Monroe to Rancid and Black Flag, passing them through a unique lens that magnifies the individual strength of their core and auxiliary members while remaining faithful to the revivalist spirit.

In 2015, the band moved to LA, where their current lineup of Kenny Feinstein \(lead vocals, guitar, fiddle, mandolin\), Tommy Drinkard \(banjo, vocals\), Taylor Estes \(Bass, Vocals, and Nicholas Leahy \(mandolin, vocals\) can often be found busking while not in the studio or on tour.

Since then, Water Tower have built major momentum, releasing a concept album Fly Around \(ft. guest vocals from Black Flag‚Äôs Ron Reyes and produced by Don Bolles of The Germs\), filming 1m\+ view viral videos, and catching the eye of A-listers including Katy Perry, whose 2023 NYE party they played at, and Riff Raff, who shouted out ‚ÄúTake Me Back‚Äù, the debut single from their upcoming album Live from Los Angeles, to be released later this year. A slew of tour dates in the US and the UK has already been announced.

As she struggles with opening up to Bo, Kate also seeks to reconnect with her estranged daughter who lives nearby. Brimming with humanity and humor,¬†*A Good Deal* is a bittersweet tale of love, loss, and family connections. Developed through the Raven Players‚Äô ScripTease program.

title: Caring for Your Olive Trees with Paul Vossen at Gold Ridge Organic Farms
description:
Join us at Gold Ridge Organic Farms for a half-day workshop dedicated to the successful management of olive trees. Whether you're a home grower with a few backyard trees or an orchard management professional, you'll gain valuable insights from this focused session. Paul will explore essential topics including the definition and physiological causes of alternate bearing, best practices for pruning, irrigation, and nutrition, as well as practical strategies to reduce alternate bearing and improve overall olive production. The class covers both organic and conventional farming methods, giving you a comprehensive toolkit for cultivating healthier, more productive olive trees.

The session will be held in our milling area, with portions taking place in the orchards if weather permits. Please dress in comfortable layers to accommodate changing conditions and wear closed-toe, non-slip footwear suitable for walking on uneven terrain. Coffee and tea will be provided throughout the event.

Paul Vossen is a legendary local Farm Advisor and Emeritus Extension Agent who retired from UC Davis in 2016 after 35 years of distinguished research and teaching. He holds an M.S. in Tree Crops Production and a Certificate in Olive Oil Production from Cordova, Spain, and is passionate about helping farmers and home growers cultivate exceptional fruit. Don't miss this opportunity to learn from a seasoned expert and gain new insights to enhance the health and productivity of your olive trees.

title: Overeaters Anonymous (OA) Newcomer Meeting
description:
**Is Food a Problem for You? You Are Not Alone.**

Overeaters Anonymous (OA) is a fellowship of people who support each other in recovering from compulsive eating and food behaviors. If you feel you have a problem with food, OA welcomes you‚Äîno matter what your background, beliefs, or eating habits.¬†

We hold an in-person newcomer meeting on first, second and fourth **Saturdays of the month from 9:45 - 10:15 AM at** ‚Äã**Unitarian Universalist Congregation of Marin, 240 Channing Way, San Rafael CA 94903**. Contact:¬†Sue M. 415-298-6792‚Äã. You may view all North Bay OA in-person and online meetings at https://www.northbayoa.org/meetings.html

In OA, members experience **spiritual, emotional, and physical recovery** by practicing the **Twelve Steps** and living by their spiritual principles‚Äîone day at a time.

OA is **not** a diet club or calorie-counting program.

Members have different plans of eating.

OA does **not** endorse any specific food plan.¬†

If food is causing problems in your life, you don‚Äôt have to struggle alone. Recovery is possible, and help is available.

**Visit:** https://www.northbayoa.org/

**Find a meeting:** https://www.northbayoa.org/meetings.html

title: A Year to Live
description:
with Vinny Ferraro, Frank Ostaseski and Pam Dunn

This yearlong journey, inspired by Stephen Levine‚Äôs¬†*A Year to Live*, is a heartfelt invitation to people of all ages, at any stage of life. Together, in the spirit of community, we will explore how contemplating death can profoundly deepen our experience of living.

In our modern world, where we often shy away from the reality of our mortality, we rarely pause to consider the preciousness of each moment. The Buddha encouraged us to reflect on death not out of fear, but as a way to awaken to the fleeting beauty of our lives. By embracing this practice, we come to appreciate the fragility and impermanence of our existence.

This program is a yearlong exploration of forgiveness, gratitude, and letting go. Through guided meditations, thoughtful inquiry, and intimate group discussions, we will support one another in discovering what death has to teach us about life and vice versa.

**Program Includes**

**Format**: Online via Zoom (must know how to join a specific breakout room manually)

**Teachings**: Monthly (12) large group sessions (attendance at 10 of 12 live sessions required; this must include the first session on Jan 31st)

**Home Groups (required!)**: Monthly (12), 1-hour, self-facilitated, self-hosted Home Groups that meet in between large group sessions. They are a foundational aspect of this program and will be organized by Spirit Rock. Each group will determine a time/day and location (online or in-person) that works for everyone during the January large group session.

**Home practice**: Guided meditations,¬†readings, reflections (estimated 5-7 hours/month + monthly Home Groups + daily meditation)

**Access**: Video and audio recording access for 1 year after program ends via our Online Learning Platform

**Q&As**: Monthly, 1-hour, recorded (optional)

title: Forest Bathing Walk
description:
Come enjoy a gentle, guided Forest Bathing Walk where East meets West at the Sonoma Botanical Garden. This event is inspired by the Japanese practice of shinrin yoku or ‚Äúforest bathing.‚Äù Forest bathing is the intentional practice of slowing down and immersing oneself in the sights, sounds, smells, and sensations of the natural world in order to restore well-being and deepen our relationship with nature.

This walk will be led by Susan Karle, a Certified Forest Therapy Guide, who brings over a decade of experience guiding nature connection practices with people of all ages. Her approach integrates her background in grief and trauma work with a deep respect for the healing power of nature.

title: Naturally Arising SamƒÅdhi and Insight
description:
with Phillip Moffitt

The Naturally Arising method starts meditation practice in a different manner. It begins with a preliminary, preparatory practice in which all the attention is systematically and repeatedly oriented inwardly. During this weekend non-residential retreat, Phillip will teach two practices that create the conditions for what he terms an ‚Äúinward staying mind‚Äù to naturally arise.

The first of these practices is ‚ÄúThe Three Renunciations,‚Äù which establishes a discerning mind that is free of reactivity and self-judgment. The second practice, the Arriving Sequence, establishes a mind state that is available for practice and aligned with the Dhamma. When combined, the fruition of these practices is a naturally arising responsive mind. In this way, we become free of the efforting that so often plagues our practice.

From there, we turn toward the Four Foundations of Mindfulness and we explore different capacities of consciousness that enhance insight. Throughout the meditation practice periods, there is continual emphasis on directly knowing experience through the felt sense. The result is a mind that has great clarity and is available to the natural emergence of wisdom and compassion.

This class is perfect for anyone ready to learn the techniques and foundational steps needed to start their salsa journey.

description:
Join¬†Sugarloaf¬†docent¬†Susan¬†Perkins¬†in¬†a¬†geology¬†hike¬†to¬†learn¬†about¬†more¬†about¬†the¬†geological¬†formations¬†that¬†give¬†Sugarloaf¬†Ridge¬†State¬†Park¬†its¬†namesake,¬†how¬†soil¬†composition¬†influences¬†native¬†flora¬†to¬†thrive,¬†and¬†take¬†a¬†lightning-fast¬†journey¬†(in¬†geological¬†terms)¬†through¬†the¬†history¬†of¬†the¬†area,¬†from¬†the¬†time¬†California¬†was¬†underwater¬†to¬†today's¬†volcanic¬†caldera¬†remains.¬†

Meet¬†at¬†the¬†White¬†Barn¬†parking¬†lot.¬†Tickets¬†are¬†$10¬†for¬†general¬†audiences,¬†$5¬†for¬†youth¬†(12-17¬†year¬†olds;¬†must¬†be¬†accompanied¬†by¬†a¬†parent¬†or¬†legal¬†guardian),¬†students,¬†Sugarloaf¬†Members,¬†Sugarloaf¬†or¬†RFO¬†volunteers,¬†and¬†free¬†for¬†children¬†under¬†12.¬†Wear¬†layers,¬†appropriate¬†footwear¬†for¬†muddy/slippery¬†trails,¬†bring¬†at¬†least¬†a¬†quart¬†of¬†water,¬†and¬†if¬†desired,¬†a¬†snack,¬†binoculars,¬†and/or¬†a¬†camera.¬†We¬†invite¬†you¬†to¬†bring¬†a¬†reusable¬†drink¬†container¬†so¬†your¬†little¬†ones¬†can¬†enjoy¬†hot¬†cocoa¬†after¬†the¬†walk,¬†if¬†desired.¬†Heavy¬†rains¬†cancel.¬†Parking¬†fees¬†apply.

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9‚ÄìMarch 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of¬†bonsai and the season‚Äôs first flowers.¬†Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year‚Äôs all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai‚Äîtrees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot¬†bonsai¬†take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal‚Äîreminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from¬†hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through¬†Hanami Strolls‚Äîguided walks through the Garden‚Äôs Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

title: The Journey: A Painter's Narrative
description: New Woman and Fox paintings by Teri Sloat celebrate the personal journeys we take as we travel outward through landscape trails or inward through thoughts and dreams. Her ongoing series, Woman and Fox, A Journey, present rich, metaphorical paintings that invite you to pause on your own path and enjoy the distance you have come.

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

Date and Time: Saturday January 10, 2026 at 10:00 am to Sunday March 8, 2026 at 4:00 pm

title: An Abstract Vision
description:
**Exhibition runs April 4 - May 30, 2026**

Deadline for Entries: March 9, 2026

An Abstract Vision celebrates the work of artists creating abstract art.

Abstract art moves beyond representation, with a strong emphasis on shape, color and form. Abstract art has the power to evoke emotions, appeal to our senses and transcend the physical world. Abstract expression captures the delicate, elusive, powerful and radiant energies that fly under the radar of explanation.

We are excited to have you share with us your visions in the abstract and look forward to putting together a dynamic exhibition of work that reflects the power and importance of abstract art.

Accepting the following mediums: painting, printmaking, photographs, sculpture, glass, wood, ceramics, fiber and paper.

title: Art Exhibit: Celebrating Women
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE¬† 2/13/26

**MARCH EXHIBIT: CELEBRATING WOMEN**

EXHIBIT DATES:¬† February 23 ‚Äì March 29, 2026

**RECEPTION: SATURDAY, MARCH 7, 2026, 4-6 pm: Join in to meet the artists and celebrate the show. Take part in the Gallery‚Äôs free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.¬† Refreshments will be served.**

Sonoma County artist, **Tosya Shore,** presents **Celebrating Women,** paintings that commemorate women in honor of Women‚Äôs History Month. Shore‚Äôs watercolor works capture women in their element, showing the multiple facets of their lives.¬† These dynamic paintings break away with strong shapes and interlacing patterns that draw the viewer in exciting ways.¬† A la Degas, we catch a ballet dancer lacing her shoes in ‚ÄúGood Point.‚Äù¬† The artist takes us into nature with ‚ÄúRedwood Rendezvous‚Äù where dominant trunk shapes frame a couple enjoying a glorious forest scene.¬†¬† ¬†‚ÄúJust Back from Vegas‚Äù captures a fleeting view of elegance as the woman in question catches her breath.¬† ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs such special feeling in these everyday moments, I love to turn the mundane into magic ‚Äì women deserve nothing less,‚Äù noted Shore.¬†

Meet the artist: Shore will be hosting the Gallery on March 5 and 19 from 11am to 6 pm.

¬†The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features **Donna Schaffer‚Äôs Ooh La La, Plein Air,** a collection unveiling oil paintings made on her recent trip to France.¬† Roaming the streets of Paris, toting paints and palette, Schaffer captured iconic scenes buzzing with ‚Äúla belle vie.‚Äù The viewer catches a true cultural vibe in ‚ÄúCaf√© le Bistro‚Äù, the site of a favored hangout for espresso and conversation.¬† One is awed by the structure rising from the ground-level trees in Schaffer‚Äôs unique view of the Eiffel Tower in ‚ÄúParis is for Lovers.‚Äù ‚ÄúEvery day was an adventure in Paris ‚Äì I hope through these plein air vignettes, to share the excitement of being there‚Äù, stated Schaffer.

Meet the artist: Schaffer will be hosting the Gallery on March 21 and 22 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. (707) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am ‚Äì 6 pm.¬†¬†¬† **www.upstairsart gallery.net** 

For further information: Contact: Beverly Bird, Press Contact, at bvdrio@sonic.net or 707-799-1490.

title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description: Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

title: Annual Chili Bowl Fundraiser for the Sonoma Community Center
description:
Never Heard of Chili Bowl?

Every year, the ceramics department artists begin making bowls in October. By the time they are done, they will have made over 800 bowls, at least 300 cups, and countless vases for table decorations. Local chefs donate delectable chili of various kinds, including vegetarian options.

When you attend a Chili Bowl lunch seating, you will first enter a room with a selection of hundreds of handmade bowls. Don't worry, the bowls are divvied up in advance so that every lunch and dinner seating has a similar selection. Pick your bowl and then head to the kitchen to choose your chili with all of the fixins. We'll have cleaning stations and bags for you to take your bowl home.

What goes into Chili Bowl each year?

900\+ unique handmade ceramic bowls

1 metric ton of clay

40 gallons of hand-mixed glaze

50 kiln loads of bowls, vases, and cups

90 gallons of chili made and served

700\+ people dining throughout the day

Saturday, February 28, 2026 Three seating options available: 11:30 AM, 1:30 PM, and 5 PM

Every February, the annual Chili Bowl celebrates community, food, and clay. Featuring artisan bowls made by the Center's ceramics team and a variety of hot, steaming chili prepared by local chefs, the Chili Bowl brings our community together to create a sense of warmth during the rainy tail-end of winter.

What comes with your ticket?

Lunch tickets \($38 per person\) include a beautiful handmade bowl of your choosing with a hearty chili of your choice, as well as toppings, cornbread, and dessert.

Dinner tickets \($75 per person\) include all of the above \+ a handmade cup and cocktail/mocktail, along with some special entertainment and auction items.

title: Fresh Pressed Flower Card Workshop
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Jan Lochner
Saturday, February 28th
2:00PM-5:00PM
Santa Rosa Location
$35.00

This is a hands on make and take class where you will make at least five items including a bookmark, a greeting card, a fridge magnet and an ornament. The class will use two different techniques and Jan will explain how to press flowers and which flowers hold their color best. It is a creative experience!


To register for this workshop, please contact Jan at: freshpressedflowercards@yahoo.com mailto:freshpressedflowercards@yahoo.com

Creating note cards from pressed flowers has been Jan‚Äôs hobby for 25 years, though she has no formal art training. She utilizes color,
shape and texture on fine quality paper, each card uniquely handmade. Jan‚Äôs home in Sebastopol is her studio: the dining room table is her workshop, the kitchen cupboards storing boxes and trays of flowers. She buy card stock by the thousand and pick blooms from her garden and other public places. Her family is used to me saying, ‚Äúcould we stop for just a few minutes so I can gather some‚Ä¶ ‚Äù

It is a wonderful way of life.

*A note to all students: Please park on in the East facing parking lot while attending classes. We greatly appreciate it. Thank you.

title: Mary Poppins
description:
**The magical, family-friendly musical based on the stories of P.L. Travers and the Walt Disney film.**

***‚ÄúIt‚Äôs a roof-raising, toe-tapping, high-flying extravaganza.‚Äú* ‚Äî Joe Dziemianowicz, New York Daily News** 

**The beloved story of *Mary Poppins* soars to new heights in this Tony Award-winning musical, inspired by P.L. Travers‚Äô timeless books and the classic Disney film. Set in Edwardian London, the tale follows the Banks family, whose mischievous children, Jane and Michael, have sent every nanny packing‚Äîuntil the mysterious and enchanting Mary Poppins arrives. With a blend of magic, common sense, and a touch of mischief, she transforms their world, teaching them lessons in love, family, and imagination.**

**Filled with show-stopping dance numbers and iconic songs like ‚ÄúA Spoonful of Sugar‚Äù and ‚ÄúSupercalifragilisticexpialidocious,‚Äù this spectacular production will leave audiences of all ages believing that anything is possible‚Äîespecially with a little magic in the air!**

title: Opening Reception: Collaborative Works 2026 by Connect the Dots Art Studio
description:
Collaborative Works 2026" showcases a selection of paintings and textiles by Anna Rochester and Barbara Libby-Steinmann. Inspired by the natural landscapes of Marin and Sonoma Counties, the artists engage in direct collaboration, applying their respective skills simultaneously to each piece. This approach yields both large-scale and smaller works, which are on view at Usher Gallery from February 17th to March 22nd.

Join us for the opening reception on Saturday, February 28th, from 5-8pm to celebrate ‚ÄúCollaborative Works 2026‚Äù, enjoy live music by Rojo, meet the artists, and graze on light refreshments and wine.

Anna and Barbara serve as co-directors of Connect the Dots Art Studio (CTD), a recently established arts-based nonprofit in Marin. CTD brings people together to experience art through installations, workshops, and events that invite individuals to tap into and express their creativity. By ‚Äúconnecting the dots,‚Äù CTD creates opportunities for the community to engage with art, make art, buy art, and connect with artists and creative individuals. More details about CTD can be found at:¬†**https://connectthedotsartstudio.org/**¬†email: art@connectthedotsartstudio.org

title: Live Music Saturday Copy
description: Joyce Grant Joyce Grant singer/songwriter, is no stranger to Vallejo. She performs regularly at the Vallejo Ferry Bldg. Taproom, the Coalshed as well as the Benicia Taphouse. A mezzo-soprano with a voice like dark honey, Grant has been singing jazz and R&B in the Bay Area for over 30 years at venues such the Donatello Hotel in San Francisco, the Ledson Hotel in Sonoma, the Empress Theater in Vallejo, Sam's Chowder House in Half Moon Bay, Nick's in Pacifica to name a few. She is the great-great-niece of famed ragtime composer Scott Joplin and is a frequent participant in the West Coast Ragtime festival. For the past 3 years she has been the lead vocalist for the Walnut Creek Jazz Band, an 18- piece big band. As a songwriter she has released the CD In The Morning \(co-produced with Doug McKeehan , 2010\), a collection of original songs ranging in style from jazz to blues to R&B. She continues to bring her sensitive and powerful vocal interpretations to appreciative audiences that keep coming back for more.

title: The Real Truth About the Black Cowboy
description:
This Black History Month Program Explores the Real Truth About the Black Cowboy

When: February 28, 2026 from 6:00-8:30 PM Where: Vallejo Naval & Historical Museum, located at 734 Marin Street, Vallejo, California Admission: $10, Open to the public

In celebration of Black History Month, Askari Sowonde~ Productions invites the public to a powerful and engaging evening titled "The Real Truth About the Black Cowboy."

This educational and cultural program challenges long-standing myths of the American West by centering the often-erased history of Black cowboys-skilled horsemen, ranchers, trailblazers, and community builders who played a critical role in shaping the nation.

Donald Jordan will emcee & speak as well as featured speaker Albert R. Harris who will lead the conversation, sharing historical insight, lived knowledge, and cultural truth about Black cowboy legacy and its lasting impact on American history.

The evening will also include dynamic entertainment featuring Julie Bland Latin Jazz, Elyon cultural fashions/ Kimberly Pergerson-Williams, young poet and storyteller Nora Sanna, Saxophonist Ric Alexander, Klassicman-Marvin Gaye tribute and more, celebrating Black creativity, artistry, and heritage across generations.

The event is open to the public and is designed for families, students, history enthusiasts, and lifelong learners seeking a meaningful Black History Month experience grounded in education, culture, and community

Dido and Aeneas¬†is a monumental English Baroque opera masterpiece.¬† The story is based on Virgil‚Äôs¬†The Aeneid¬†and tells the tale of love and tragedy between Dido, Queen of Carthage, and the Trojan hero Aeneas.¬† This beloved gem includes stunning choruses, duos, trios and the iconic aria "Dido‚Äôs Lament". ¬†In contrast to Dido and Aeneas‚Äô measured passions,¬†Pagliacci¬†is full of uncontrollable passion, jealousy, tragedy, murder, and betrayal.¬† Laugh and weep with Canio as he sings "Vesti la giubba" \(the clown who cries behind his makeup\).

description:
**Four Southern women turn life‚Äôs curve balls into an uproarious, heartwarming journey of friendship, laughter, and fresh starts.**

In this delightful, laugh-a-minute comedy, four unique Southern women, all needing to escape the sameness of their day-to-day routines, are drawn together by Fate‚Äîand an impromptu happy hour‚Äîand decide it‚Äôs high time to reclaim the enthusiasm for life they‚Äôve lost through the years. Over the course of six months, filled with laughter, hilarious misadventures, and the occasional liquid refreshment, these middle-aged women successfully bond and find the confidence to jump start their new lives. Together, they discover lasting friendships and a renewed determination to live in the moment‚Äîand most importantly, realize it‚Äôs never too late to make new old friends.

title: Collage Your Story with Catherine Cruz ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Collage Your Story with Catherine Cruz: Mar 1, 2026

  
    
      
        
          $130.00
        
      
    
  

Sunday, March 1, 2026; 11:00am - 3:00pmFee: $115 + $15 materials feeAges 16 and up; Located in Dining Room at SebArtsJoin French-American collage artist Catherine Cruz for a special, personalized workshop designed just for you! The word collage comes from the French verb coller, meaning "to glue," and is all about merging various materials to tell a visual story. Much like our lives, which are shaped by countless moments and experiences, collage pieces bring together fragments that reveal hidden connections and untold narratives. In this class, you‚Äôll reflect on what matters most to you and how that can be expressed through art. Catherine will help you release the need for perfection and trust your creative instincts. By the end of the workshop, you‚Äôll not only have a finished artwork but also a deeper connection to your creative potential and a renewed love for the art of collage.What you‚Äôll learn: Creative ways to incorporate your personal story in your art, Methods for sourcing interesting collage papers, Techniques for crafting textured, multi-layered collages, Strategies for refining your compositionYou are highly encouraged to bring your own papers to personalize your artwork like ephemera that represents your life, copies of photos, old letters, books, papers from memorable experiences or travels, or documents that hold meaning. If you‚Äôre not comfortable using these documents, you should make color copies of them. For this process, it is also best to make laser copies of your photographs.Supplies provided by instructor: some collage papers, acrylic medium, brushesCLICK HERE TO READ DOCUMENT PRIOR TO PURCHASING CLASSAbout the instructor: Catherine Cruz is a French-American artist whose work is informed by the textures and patterns created by the passing of time and the effects of the natural elements on the built environment. She has taught collage and mixed media in the Bay Area and France since 2019. Her background is in interior design and green building certification. She works from her home studio in Sebastopol, CA, and participates in Art Trails Open Studios. You may contact Catherine at beyouartstudio@gmail.com.

description:
ATTENTION‚Ä¶we are under the watchful eye of the Vintage Oaks Shopping Center! BEHAVE!

1. The first Sunday of every month, rain or shine, in front of Starbuck‚Äôs in the Vintage Oaks Shopping Center Novato, California.

2. 6:30 am in the morning to 10:00am. Arrive when you want.

title: Naturally Arising SamƒÅdhi and Insight
description:
with Phillip Moffitt

The Naturally Arising method starts meditation practice in a different manner. It begins with a preliminary, preparatory practice in which all the attention is systematically and repeatedly oriented inwardly. During this weekend non-residential retreat, Phillip will teach two practices that create the conditions for what he terms an ‚Äúinward staying mind‚Äù to naturally arise.

The first of these practices is ‚ÄúThe Three Renunciations,‚Äù which establishes a discerning mind that is free of reactivity and self-judgment. The second practice, the Arriving Sequence, establishes a mind state that is available for practice and aligned with the Dhamma. When combined, the fruition of these practices is a naturally arising responsive mind. In this way, we become free of the efforting that so often plagues our practice.

From there, we turn toward the Four Foundations of Mindfulness and we explore different capacities of consciousness that enhance insight. Throughout the meditation practice periods, there is continual emphasis on directly knowing experience through the felt sense. The result is a mind that has great clarity and is available to the natural emergence of wisdom and compassion.

title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9‚ÄìMarch 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of¬†bonsai and the season‚Äôs first flowers.¬†Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year‚Äôs all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai‚Äîtrees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot¬†bonsai¬†take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal‚Äîreminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from¬†hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through¬†Hanami Strolls‚Äîguided walks through the Garden‚Äôs Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

title: The Journey: A Painter's Narrative
description: New Woman and Fox paintings by Teri Sloat celebrate the personal journeys we take as we travel outward through landscape trails or inward through thoughts and dreams. Her ongoing series, Woman and Fox, A Journey, present rich, metaphorical paintings that invite you to pause on your own path and enjoy the distance you have come.

title: The Unknown Wayne Thiebaud: Passionate Printmaker
description:
Wayne Thiebaud's lushly painted still life's of cakes, pies, and gumball machines are icons of modern American Art. But there is another large body of Thiebaud's art that is relatively unknown: his prints. Thiebaud had a life-long passion for printmaking --- his first print was made of pieces of linoleum he ran through the wringer of his mother's washing machine! And he continued making prints until well into his 90s. This exhibition will highlight Thiebaud's printed artwork spanning 6 decades, exploring common themes and subject matter and the artist's unusual working method. In addition, the exhibition will focus on Thiebaud's extraordinary relationship with his New York gallerist Allan Stone. Stone gave Thiebaud his first major exhibition and continued to represent him for over 45 years, a legendary relationship in the art world. Also join us for a wrap-around program lecture on Thursday, January 29th, 2026 to hear Wayne Thiebaud: The Whole Story from Linda Loveland Reid, an OLLI instructor for Sonoma State and Dominican Universities. In this lecture, we will be discussing Wayne Thieband's versatile and dynamic personality who brough us not only delicious dessert paintings, but also landscapes and figures. In this discussion, we will look at his famous works, review his life, and learn about his extraordinary printmaking skills that are highlighted in the SebArts exhibit. General Admission Tickets are $15.00. Free Public Entry Days Are January 23rd and 24th, and February 21st and 22nd. SebArts Members are granted free entry, and students get $5 off per ticket. Purchase your tickets before the event, or at the door. To schedule a docent led group tour of 6 or more, email RWynne@sebarts.org.

Date and Time: Saturday January 10, 2026 at 10:00 am to Sunday March 8, 2026 at 4:00 pm

title: The Women of Beauty Ranch: Hands That Shaped the Vision
description:
In recognition of Women‚Äôs History Month, this program celebrates the women whose lives, work, and creativity helped shape the history and landscape of what is now Jack London State Historic Park.

In the five short years Jack London lived at Beauty Ranch, he imagined it on a grand scale. That vision took root and endured through the labor, intelligence, and perseverance of two key women - Charmian Kittredge London and Eliza ‚ÄúBecky‚Äù Shepard. They stewarded the dream, land, and legacy through upheaval and change, long after Jack London was gone.

Lead by the park‚Äôs Director of Interpretation and Education Programs Kristina Ellis, this two-hour tour of Beauty Ranch and the House of Happy Walls Museum, invites visitors to step into the stories of these remarkable women and discover how a vision became an enduring reality.

title: Worms to Wine: The Flavor of Compost - Workshop
description:
Join our¬†**Soil Keeper, Michael Presley**, and¬†**Farm Manager, Andrew Beebe**, for a hands-on composting workshop at the heart of our farm. It‚Äôs a three-hour experience exploring how microbes, worms, and organic matter work together to build resilient soil‚Äîand how compost and those living systems shape flavor in the wines we grow.

The morning blends short classroom sessions with hands-on practice on the farm, offering practical knowledge you can take home and use right away. Along the way, you‚Äôll taste¬†**two of our estate wines**, exploring how aromatics shaped by living soils are expressed in the glass‚Äîbringing the work beneath our feet into clear sensory focus.

Whether you‚Äôre composting in your backyard garden or managing land on a larger scale, this workshop offers practical, take-home guidance you can put to use right away‚Äîrooted in the same composting practices we continually adapt on our own farm.

title: Petaluma River High Tide Upstream Paddle
description:
When the tide is high, the Petaluma River opens into a quieter, greener world.

Join The Floathouse crew for a gentle, guided paddle upstream, timed to higher tides that allow access beyond the downtown channel and into a tranquil tidal slough. With extra water beneath us, we‚Äôre able to glide into calm, lush stretches of the river that are normally out of reach.

This unhurried paddle highlights the natural beauty of the Petaluma River‚Äôs brackish, tidal waterway. Watch for great egrets, blue herons, snowy egrets, turtles basking along the banks, and abundant plant life. The calm water and peaceful surroundings create a deeply grounding experience‚Äîmany guests say they feel their stress melt away within minutes.

Along the way, knowledgeable guides share stories of the river‚Äôs ecology and human history, offering insight into how this upper channel has shaped‚Äîand continues to shape‚ÄîPetaluma. It‚Äôs a rare opportunity to experience how close wild nature lives to the heart of downtown.

Beginner-friendly. Sit-on-top kayaks and all gear provided.

title: "Portraits" Juried Show
description: A juried show featuring "Portraits" ~ artworks that portray people, pets or other animals, posed, or active- from a classic portrait to a scene or event, from a realistic image to the limits of abstraction. Juror Michelle Carnes Artist Reception Saturday, February 21, 1pm - 4pm.

title: An Abstract Vision
description:
**Exhibition runs April 4 - May 30, 2026**

Deadline for Entries: March 9, 2026

An Abstract Vision celebrates the work of artists creating abstract art.

Abstract art moves beyond representation, with a strong emphasis on shape, color and form. Abstract art has the power to evoke emotions, appeal to our senses and transcend the physical world. Abstract expression captures the delicate, elusive, powerful and radiant energies that fly under the radar of explanation.

We are excited to have you share with us your visions in the abstract and look forward to putting together a dynamic exhibition of work that reflects the power and importance of abstract art.

Accepting the following mediums: painting, printmaking, photographs, sculpture, glass, wood, ceramics, fiber and paper.

title: Art Exhibit: Celebrating Women
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE¬† 2/13/26

**MARCH EXHIBIT: CELEBRATING WOMEN**

EXHIBIT DATES:¬† February 23 ‚Äì March 29, 2026

**RECEPTION: SATURDAY, MARCH 7, 2026, 4-6 pm: Join in to meet the artists and celebrate the show. Take part in the Gallery‚Äôs free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.¬† Refreshments will be served.**

Sonoma County artist, **Tosya Shore,** presents **Celebrating Women,** paintings that commemorate women in honor of Women‚Äôs History Month. Shore‚Äôs watercolor works capture women in their element, showing the multiple facets of their lives.¬† These dynamic paintings break away with strong shapes and interlacing patterns that draw the viewer in exciting ways.¬† A la Degas, we catch a ballet dancer lacing her shoes in ‚ÄúGood Point.‚Äù¬† The artist takes us into nature with ‚ÄúRedwood Rendezvous‚Äù where dominant trunk shapes frame a couple enjoying a glorious forest scene.¬†¬† ¬†‚ÄúJust Back from Vegas‚Äù captures a fleeting view of elegance as the woman in question catches her breath.¬† ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs such special feeling in these everyday moments, I love to turn the mundane into magic ‚Äì women deserve nothing less,‚Äù noted Shore.¬†

Meet the artist: Shore will be hosting the Gallery on March 5 and 19 from 11am to 6 pm.

¬†The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features **Donna Schaffer‚Äôs Ooh La La, Plein Air,** a collection unveiling oil paintings made on her recent trip to France.¬† Roaming the streets of Paris, toting paints and palette, Schaffer captured iconic scenes buzzing with ‚Äúla belle vie.‚Äù The viewer catches a true cultural vibe in ‚ÄúCaf√© le Bistro‚Äù, the site of a favored hangout for espresso and conversation.¬† One is awed by the structure rising from the ground-level trees in Schaffer‚Äôs unique view of the Eiffel Tower in ‚ÄúParis is for Lovers.‚Äù ‚ÄúEvery day was an adventure in Paris ‚Äì I hope through these plein air vignettes, to share the excitement of being there‚Äù, stated Schaffer.

Meet the artist: Schaffer will be hosting the Gallery on March 21 and 22 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. (707) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am ‚Äì 6 pm.¬†¬†¬† **www.upstairsart gallery.net** 

For further information: Contact: Beverly Bird, Press Contact, at bvdrio@sonic.net or 707-799-1490.

Explore the heart and soul of winemaking with our Grape to Glass Tour & Tasting at Dutton Estate Winery. Immerse yourself in the world of wine as you stroll through our chardonnay vineyard, rooted in six generations of farming legacy in the heart of the Russian River Valley. Witness firsthand the art and passion behind our winemaking process with an exclusive tour of our modest crush pad and barrel room. Relish with a tasting of five current releases and a special library wine, accompanied with a curated cheese and charcuterie board, and finished with decadent artisanal chocolates. title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description: Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

title: In Her Power
description:
In Her Power

A Collaboration by Priscila Soares & JeanCherie

In Her Power is a group exhibition celebrating women‚Äôs presence, strength, and creative expression. Anchored by a collaborative, life-size sculptural work by Priscila Soares and JeanCherie, the exhibition brings together works by women artists exploring power as something lived, embodied, and deeply personal.

At the heart of the gallery stands a mountain lioness woman ‚Äî a guardian figure shaped by two artists working together, each bringing her own voice, materials, and vision. Surrounding this central work, invited artists contribute pieces that reflect their own relationship to power, resilience, intuition, and selfhood.

Rather than offering a single definition, In Her Power invites viewers to witness many expressions of strength ‚Äî quiet and fierce, ancestral and contemporary, individual and shared. It is both a celebration of women artists and an invitation to step into presence, creativity, and connection.

Opening Reception:

March 1, 12‚Äì4pm

Gallery Hours:

Sundays in March, 12‚Äì4pm

title: Steel Spines & Sparkling Wines: A History of Women Leading the Charge
description:
License to Thrill: An Elegant Champagne Luncheon

Experience a high-stakes afternoon of history and luxury as we celebrate the premiere of License to Thrill: Lily Bollinger.

The Grand Pairing: Indulge in an elegant multi-course luncheon perfectly curated to complement the award-winning bubbles of Breathless Wines. As you savor each pairing, author Rebecca Rosenberg reveals the "steel-spined" legacy of the women who redefined the wine world.

The Legend of Lily Bollinger

Wartime Heroine: Discover how Lily outfoxed the Nazi "Wein F√ºhrer" while harboring Resistance fighters in her cellars.

The 007 Legacy: Trace her journey from the battlefields of 1940 to her audacious 1970s partnership with James Bond.

The Revolutionaries: Celebrate the daring legacies of Veuve Clicquot and Madame Pommery alongside the finale of the Champagne Widows series.

Secure your seat for an afternoon of gourmet dining, award-winning wine, and untold history.
