title: The Bonsai Show: Bonsai & Blossoms
description:
January 9‚ÄìMarch 22, 2026

Step into a wonderland of blooming miniature trees to marvel at the living art of¬†bonsai and the season‚Äôs first flowers.¬†Then stroll through our Asian Woodland to admire majestic magnolias, cherries, and camellias in bloom, or join a tour or program to explore this timeless craft.

This year‚Äôs all-new presentation by the skilled artisans of the Redwood Empire Bonsai Society \(REBS\) highlights the grace and vitality of flowering bonsai‚Äîtrees and shrubs trained to bloom in exquisite proportion to their diminutive scale. Delicate plum, azalea, camellia, cherry, and apricot¬†bonsai¬†take center stage, their blossoms appearing just as winter begins to yield to spring. These early bloomers symbolize hope and renewal‚Äîreminding us that beauty and resilience can emerge even in the coldest months.

The exhibition also draws inspiration from¬†hanami, the centuries-old Japanese tradition of celebrating the fleeting beauty of blossoms. The Garden invites visitors to participate in this art of flower appreciation through¬†Hanami Strolls‚Äîguided walks through the Garden‚Äôs Asian woodland where early-blooming magnolias, cherries, and camellias offer their own ephemeral display.

title: The Journey: A Painter's Narrative

There will be lots of singing together, interspersed with individualized "workshopping" with David, as the moment calls. Open to any experience/comfort level with singing and/or improvised singing.¬†

title: Art Exhibit: Celebrating Women
description:
Date: FOR IMMEDIATE RELEASE¬† 2/13/26

MARCH EXHIBIT: CELEBRATING WOMEN

EXHIBIT DATES:¬† February 23 ‚Äì March 29, 2026

RECEPTION: SATURDAY, MARCH 7, 2026, 4-6 pm: Join in to meet the artists and celebrate the show. Take part in the Gallery‚Äôs free monthly drawing for a beautiful work by a Gallery artist.¬† Refreshments will be served.

Sonoma County artist, Tosya Shore, presents Celebrating Women, paintings that commemorate women in honor of Women‚Äôs History Month. Shore‚Äôs watercolor works capture women in their element, showing the multiple facets of their lives.¬† These dynamic paintings break away with strong shapes and interlacing patterns that draw the viewer in exciting ways.¬† A la Degas, we catch a ballet dancer lacing her shoes in ‚ÄúGood Point.‚Äù¬† The artist takes us into nature with ‚ÄúRedwood Rendezvous‚Äù where dominant trunk shapes frame a couple enjoying a glorious forest scene.¬†¬† ¬†‚ÄúJust Back from Vegas‚Äù captures a fleeting view of elegance as the woman in question catches her breath.¬† ‚ÄúThere‚Äôs such special feeling in these everyday moments, I love to turn the mundane into magic ‚Äì women deserve nothing less,‚Äù noted Shore.¬†

Meet the artist: Shore will be hosting the Gallery on March 5 and 19 from 11am to 6 pm.

¬†The Stairway Smallworks Showcase features Donna Schaffer‚Äôs Ooh La La, Plein Air, a collection unveiling oil paintings made on her recent trip to France.¬† Roaming the streets of Paris, toting paints and palette, Schaffer captured iconic scenes buzzing with ‚Äúla belle vie.‚Äù The viewer catches a true cultural vibe in ‚ÄúCaf√© le Bistro‚Äù, the site of a favored hangout for espresso and conversation.¬† One is awed by the structure rising from the ground-level trees in Schaffer‚Äôs unique view of the Eiffel Tower in ‚ÄúParis is for Lovers.‚Äù ‚ÄúEvery day was an adventure in Paris ‚Äì I hope through these plein air vignettes, to share the excitement of being there‚Äù, stated Schaffer.

Meet the artist: Schaffer will be hosting the Gallery on March 21 and 22 from 11am to 6 pm.

Upstairs Art Gallery, 306 Center Street, Healdsburg, CA 95448. \(707\) 431-4214.: OPEN DAILY: 11am ‚Äì 6 pm.¬†¬†¬† www.upstairsart gallery.net 

For further information: Contact: Beverly Bird, Press Contact, at bvdrio@sonic.net or 707-799-1490.

About the Class

A fun¬†and positive environment where kids can learn beginning ballet and basic jazz dance steps. Instruction will include warm up exercises, increased vocabulary and beginning mini ballet barre ballet positions,¬†across the floor exercises, beginning turns and leaps and beginning choreography is taught at the end of class to¬†different styles of music. This class will help the student gain coordination and confidence to take into their daily lives. Small performing opportunities based upon a child‚Äôs interest but is not mandatory. title: Maija Peeples-Bright: Life is Just a Bowl of Terriers
description: Maija Peeples-Bright is one of the few women artists associated with Northern California's Funk Art movement of the late 1960s and '70s. Peeples-Bright's wildly inventive practice comprises robust compositions bustling with animals of all kinds-her "beasties" as she calls them-forming surreal, imaginative landscapes in audacious impasto. Her zoological arrangements represent alternate realities, infusing exuberance and a sense of the absurd into impossible scenarios. Highly distinctive, her textural creature patterns revel in the extreme, often taking up every inch of the canvas, multiplying her beasties into dizzying arrangements. Peeples-Bright invites us into a decadence-gone-wild world all her own. The exhibition will feature a retrospective look at Peeples-Bright's career, from her early days of the Funk Movement to today.

title: Reclaim Your Calm A Harmonic Vagus Nerve Reset
description:
**Reclaim Your Calm: Sound, Breath, & Flow**

Join us for a unique somatic experience that uses the hypnotic, melodic resonance of the Rav Vast drum to bathe your nervous system in healing frequencies. Unlike traditional drumming, the Rav Vast creates a ‚Äúsound forest‚Äù of overtones that helps the mind settle and the body soften. In this session, we integrate: Vibrational Sound Bath: The ethereal tones of the Rav Vast to lower your heart rate. Somatic Humming: To physically vibrate the vagus nerve from the inside out, syncing your breath with the drum. Flowing Qigong: Gentle, meditative movements to move ‚ÄúQi‚Äù (energy) and release physical bracing in the body. Experience the shift from ‚Äúsurvival mode‚Äù to ‚Äúserenity.‚Äù Denise will guide you through: Qigong to open the body‚Äôs energy channels. Humming to stimulate your internal ‚Äúcalm‚Äù switch. A Rav Vast Sound Bath to wash away tension with beautiful, resonant harmonics. Come home to your body. Leave feeling grounded, peaceful, and renewed.

**About Denise Aubin, MQT**

Denise Aubin is a certified Medical Qigong Therapist (MQT) and the founder of Dance of Qigong. She discovered Qigong many years ago while traveling her own healing path and has a passion for assisting others on their healing journey back to love. Qigong is all about loving yourself and reconnecting with your joy. Denise loves teaching and empowering others in this ancient art form of self healing exercises. Denise received her degree from the International Institute of Medical Qigong and received certification as a Medical Qigong Therapist. Denise has been a teacher and healer for over thirty years.

title: Sea Chantey and Songs of the Sea Singalong
description: Please note the change of venue and time from our previous sing-alongs.\* Avast, ye saucy sailors! Come brave the perilous waters of Point Reyes and join us for a rollicking good time at Point Reyes National Seashore's Sea Chantey Sing-along at the Ken Patrick Visitor Center. Please bring your arsenal of sea chanteys, any musical instruments you'd like, and a willingness to laugh a lot!  It's so much fun when audience members lead shanties for the rest of us to join in on the chorus, and leading a song is encouraged! If you'd like to find a song \(or songs\) to share, I highly recommend setting one of your online music services to a sea chantey radio station and hear what's out there! Practice lyrics! Teach the chorus to our audience at the singalong! Our format is informal, mellow, and supportive, so if you've been wanting to push your comfort edge and lead a song, this is a perfect low-pressure opportunity. If you'd rather just singalong with the chantey choruses, that's fine too. We always have a great time no matter what. This free event is for chantey singers of all levels. Due to the nature of sea chanteys, there may be lyrics that are not appropriate for children. Reservations not required. To be added to the notification email list for future singalong dates, please email pore\_info@nps.gov For more information, please visit: nps.gov/pore/planyourvisit/calendar.htm

title: FLAMENCO! LIVE! Saturday, May 14th 2026 at The Big Easy Petaluma
description:
Join us for an intoxicating evening of fiery flamenco performances when FLAMENCO! LIVE! sets the stage on fire with the fury and passion of Spain's legendary Gypsies \(Roma\) with a Flamenco Dinner Show in the intimate atmosphere of THE BIG EASY. EXPERIENCE flamenco as stirring dances, blazing guitars, and soulful singing will transport you to another place and time. FEEL the HEAT...

FLAMENCO! LIVE!

Saturday, March 14th 2026

Melissa Cruz ~ Dancer BAOBOB Flamenco Dancers: Maria Soledad Sanchez, Kendra Pearson and Yumi Dews Pirouz "De Caspio" ~ Singer Roberto Aguilar ~ Guitarist

Showtime: 6 pm Doors: 5 pm $25 Pay at the Door Cash or Card

at The Big Easy Club and Restaurant 128 American Alley Petaluma USA

\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\* Flamenco Shows every other Month! The 2nd Saturday of the Month. Always different Artists. Always a different Show.

Flamenco Dinner Show with delicious food and a Full Bar are available, not included in entrance fee.

Arrive early, get a good table and enjoy the food! Line forms at 4:45 pm

\*Limited Reservations available for parties of 5 - 6 or more. Call at: \(707\) 774- 9072

\*Large fully ventilated restaurant, plenty of room for spacing, masks optional.

FLAMENCO! LIVE! Ôªøwas envisioned, conceived, and has thrived since 2002 in Sonoma County, California, now celebrating 24 years! Presenting the collaborative efforts of the Bay Area's finest Flamenco Singers, Guitarists and Dancers, and supporting local Flamenco students, dreamers, and talents, our goal has been to present top-notch performances. Phoebe Vernier "La Fibi" has brought decades of artistry and energy to the public of Sonoma County for the purpose of sharing the music, song and dance, the treasure of Southern Spain. Whether in the formal theater or in a casual setting, the respect, purity, and integrity of this traditional, yet living and evolving art form is always foremost.

Now in our 4rd Year of fiery Flamenco Shows!

"Best Performing Dance Company" - The Northbay Bohemian's BEST of the Northbay!

description:
Back to All Shows


Outback Presents 
Whitney Cummings: The Big Baby Tour

Saturday, March 14, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 


Whitney Cummings is a comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, and host of the hit podcast Good for You. Best known for creating and starring in the NBC series Whitney and co-creating the syndicated, Emmy-nominated CBS comedy 2 Broke Girls, she has become a leading voice in modern comedy. Cummings has released six stand-up specials, including Money Shot (2010), I Love You (2014), I‚Äôm Your Girlfriend (2016), Can I Touch It? (2019), Jokes (2022), and her latest, Mouthy, which debuted on OnlyFans in November 2023. She has also appeared in numerous television series and films, such as Good Mourning, Studio 666, How It Ends, and FOX‚Äôs Accused, further solidifying her presence on both the big and small screens. 
Beyond performing, Cummings is a successful author and filmmaker. In 2017, she published her memoir, I‚Äôm Fine‚Ä¶ And Other Lies, and made her directorial debut with the feature adaptation of Louann Brizendine‚Äôs bestseller, The Female Brain. She continues to create, produce, and perform across platforms, bringing her sharp humor and fearless perspective to audiences worldwide. She currently lives in Los Angeles.

title: The Savannah Sipping Society; a Jones Hope Wooten Comedy
description:
**Four Southern women turn life‚Äôs curve balls into an uproarious, heartwarming journey of friendship, laughter, and fresh starts.**

In this delightful, laugh-a-minute comedy, four unique Southern women, all needing to escape the sameness of their day-to-day routines, are drawn together by Fate‚Äîand an impromptu happy hour‚Äîand decide it‚Äôs high time to reclaim the enthusiasm for life they‚Äôve lost through the years. Over the course of six months, filled with laughter, hilarious misadventures, and the occasional liquid refreshment, these middle-aged women successfully bond and find the confidence to jump start their new lives. Together, they discover lasting friendships and a renewed determination to live in the moment‚Äîand most importantly, realize it‚Äôs never too late to make new old friends.

title: Safari West Presents! Native Bird Connections
description: Conservation Dinner Series: Jenny Papkra from  Native Bird Connections joins us in the elephant room after dinner to give a talk about birds. The conservation dinner series is complimentary to all dinner guests. If you want to attend this presentation, please call our reservations team at \(707\) 566-3667 or \(800\) 616-2695 and they can book it for you. Dinner starts at 7:00 PM.    About the Speaker: Jenny has a Bachelor's degree with honors from UC Davis in Environmental Interpretation. She has been involved with wildlife since 1988, first with Lindsay Museum for 13 years and now with Native Bird Connections for 22 years. Native Bird Connections is permitted with the State and the Federal Fish and Wildlife Departments to conduct educational programs within Northern California. NBC supports 13 non-releasable raptors as educational partners. Jenny maintains the NBC collection, delivers all of the programs and consults with organizations locally and beyond. She is an advisor for the Peregrine Team and the Kestrel Campaign in the Mt Diablo region Jenny has working experience with most California native wildlife and over 30 species of raptors. She received the William Penn Mott Jr. Environmental Award from the Orinda Association in 2009.

title: The Sierra Ensemble - SRJC's Chamber Concert Series
description: This violin, French horn and piano trio has performed throughout the United States and the world since the late 90s. Rich in flavor, the trio brings to the stage a repertoire that adds depth to the violin, horn and piano through commissions and associations with other artists.  The ensemble was awarded grants for two residency programs in Turkey and was the resident chamber ensemble at the Pera College of Music in Istanbul.  To help expand the horn trio repertoire, past engagements have included commissioning composers Russell Steinberg and Tolga Ozdemir; recent commissions include new works by Andres Carrizo and Aida Shirazi, and Jan Bevan, poet and author.  Janis Lieberman, horn; Matthew Vincent, violin; and Marc Steiner, piano.     Program:  Charles Koechlin, Quatre Petites Pieces for Violin, Horn and Piano  Richard Aldag, Trio for Violin, Horn and Piano  Florence Price, Fantasy No. 1 in G minor for Violin and Piano  Lev Kogan, Kaddish for Horn Solo  Elsa Barraine, Cr√©puscules for Horn and Piano  Johannes Brahms, Trio in Eb Major; Opus 40 for Piano, Violin and Horn     Ticket Prices:  Season tickets (all 6 concerts): $155  Mini Season (any 3 concerts): $90  Individual tickets: $35  Student tickets (with valid ID): $20   Buy tickets here! AGE RESTRICTION: 18 and above 
 
One of the shyest attention hogs ever to do comedy, Ralph Barbosa‚Äôs disarming and laid-back style has made him a stand-out on stage, on TV, and as host of the Formula Bean YouTube channel with Luis Cisneros. Last summer, Barbosa premiered his second hour-long stand-up special, Ralph Barbosa: Planet Bosa, as part of Hulu‚Äôs new Hularious comedy brand. 
His first hour-long stand-up special, Ralph Barbosa: Cowabunga, premiered on Netflix on October 31, 2023, and ranked as the #3 TV show on Netflix throughout its first week on the service. 
In July 2024, Barbosa was selected as one of Variety‚Äôs 10 Comics to Watch for 2024 and toured theaters throughout North America, including two sold-out theater shows as part of the Netflix Is A Joke Fest 2024, as well as hosting the kick-off show. 2023 was Barbosa‚Äôs break-out year, during which he was a guest on The Joe Rogan Experience, made his debut on The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon, and performed Comedy Central Stand-up Featuring: Ralph Barbosa, which topped 6 million views on YouTube. 
Barbosa also starred in the HBO Max comedy special, Entre Nos: The Winners 3 in 2022, and earlier that year his Don‚Äôt Tell Comedy performance was released on YouTube and now has over 6 million views.

location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Anne Millett

This is a 6-class series, meeting 6 Tuesdays
10:30AM-1:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$270.00


*Additional: Separate $20.00 plus tax Materials Fee paid to Anne at the first class, for the high-quality Arches #140 cold press watercolor paper. Brushes, palettes, high-quality watercolor paint, and set-ups for use during class will be provided.*

There will be a materials fee of $15 plus tax for the series.


Watercolor Fundamentals - Part 1

This class focuses on the simple delight of mixing color with water, brushing it on paper, and watching what happens as it moves and dries. You will learn easy ways to create paintings that are all about color and the sometimes unpredictable nature of water.

No drawing skills are needed.

In this class we will explore the basic principles of watercolor painting. Learn or refresh your understanding of brush handling, brush care and setting up, the benefits of ‚Äúgood paper‚Äù, watercolor lights and darks, flat and graded washes, wet-on-wet techniques such as charging, wet-on-dry techniques such as glazing, color wheel, color theory, color mixing, and more. Simple applications of these techniques invite you to experiment and play.

This class is designed for adults 18+

$270 for 6 classes, 2.5 hours each class
Payable via check, cash, or Zelle.

*Brushes, palettes, set-ups, and paint will be provided.*


To see Anne's work and to learn more about this class, please visit her website at: http://www.miraaster.com https://www.miraaster.com/ www.miraaster.com


To register for this workshop, please contact Anne by email at: classes@miraaster.com mailto:classes@miraaster.com mailto:amillett@gmail.com

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‚Äòwet on wet‚Äô watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

After four successful tours across the US, Colombian Latin-mariachi-pop singer, songwriter, and producer Carlos Daniels is back with M√°s Vivo Que Nunca¬† ‚Äì Juan Gabriel Tribute (More Alive Than Ever), a spectacle that thousands of fans across the nation are waiting for. 
Known as one of the best interpreters of El Divo De Juarez‚Äôs music, Daniels has conquered fans‚Äô hearts with impressive performances at renowned venues, including five shows at the House of Blues Mandalay Bay Casino in Las Vegas. title: Drawing Daffodils with Colored Pencil
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Victoria A. Kochergin
March 21, 2026
10:30 - 3:30
Location: Santa Rosa
Fee: $95.00
We know March has arrived when daffodils start springing up from the earth. Like trumpeters, they are announcing winter is over and spring is here! Even after they have fallen to the ground heavy from rain, they muster up the strength to once again stand tall. Come join this class and capture their cheerful, bright spirit using colored pencil. Class will include demonstrations, exercises, techniques and hands-on drawing time. All levels are welcome. Instruction will be structured in a way that will address the needs of the attendees.
Materials list to be mailed once registration and payment is received.
To register, please contact Victoria at kochergi@sonic.net mailto:kochergi@sonic.net or (707) 479-3336.
Victoria A. Kochergin is a professional botanical artist who works both with colored pencil and acrylics. Her artwork has been exhibited in solo and group shows in galleries, wineries, botanical gardens, international shows and on Alcatraz. She is a member of the American Society of Botanical Artists and the Northern Society of Botanical Artists. For more information about Victoria, please visit her website at http://www.victoriakochergin.com/

title: Corks Squared!
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
Wine Cork Art

SAVE YOUR CORKS LADIES!

We are hosting a special event in March, on Saturday the 21st at our old favorite, K Squared Cellars. Local artist Tara Dickinson will be leading us as a group through creating a cork board masterpiece.

Event fee ($45) includes artist instruction and your personal cork art piece, invite your friends to join us! Please bring all those corks you have saved and don't quite know what to do with. If you don't have any, that's fine too. Let us know in the comments section so we can bring extra.

Vino is made available by K Squared for a separate fee *(by the flight or glass)*. The owner, Andrew, will be on hand to serve wine and entertainment.

About the Cellars: After spending his first 9 years in the wine industry at Charles Krug Winery in St. Helena, Andrew Moore developed a passion for crafting small lot, premium wines. In 2010, with a "the wine glass is half full" type of attitude, Andrew's plans for owning his own winery began with a single barrel of Russian River Pinot Noir produced at home.

In 2015 K Squared Cellars acquired winery and tasting room space. That single barrel of Pinot Noir and a dream of having their own family winery was realized!

About the Artist: Tara Dickinson is our artist and instructor. She has a background in fine arts and years of teaching expressive art labs to all ages. She enjoys sharing tools to help everyone feel comfortable in the creative process while learning new techniques. She moved to Santa Rosa in late 2021 after growing up mostly in FL and is loving the California lifestyle.

Wear your artsy clothing, bring your thirst, and corks for this 2-3 hour event.

* Pre-payment *(via Venmo, Zelle, or PayPal)* is required for this limited availability event. **[PLS REGISTER/PAY HERE!](https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSdHYNFReJbhlLGQh0_wl4dEJZlF3E4nmEobQzB2W93XO7tz9g/viewform?usp=publish-editor)**
* Maximum of 20 people, **guests welcome.**
* We suggest dressing warmly or in layers as the cellar will be a bit cold at this time.

The event starts promptly at 1:30 pm.
Please be a little bit early to get settled in with your wine and supplies. Tara will follow up with everyone who RSVP's 'Yes' to complete payment through her above link.

We look forward to seeing you all for this fun event in March!
Cheers!
\- Joleen and Dai

Can the poutiest fish frown turn upside down? Find out in this extraordinary musical, featuring whimsical puppets and live performers in a sweeping oceanic adventure. When Mr. Fish sets out on a quest to find Miss Clam‚Äôs missing pearl, he discovers there is more to him than his permanently plastered pout. Dive into this colorful adaptation of¬†The New York Times¬†bestseller, co-conceived, directed, and designed by the acclaimed puppeteers of AchesonWalsh Studios, whose work was featured in Broadway‚Äôs¬†The King And I,¬†On the Town and¬†Radio City‚Äôs New York Spectacular. The writing team includes New Victory LabWorks Residency recipients Christopher Anselmo, Jared Corak, Matt Acheson, and Fergus Walsh.

title: Watercolor Fundamentals Part 1
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Anne Millett

This is a 6-class series, meeting 6 Tuesdays
10:30AM-1:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$270.00


*Additional: Separate $20.00 plus tax Materials Fee paid to Anne at the first class, for the high-quality Arches #140 cold press watercolor paper. Brushes, palettes, high-quality watercolor paint, and set-ups for use during class will be provided.*

There will be a materials fee of $15 plus tax for the series.


Watercolor Fundamentals - Part 1

This class focuses on the simple delight of mixing color with water, brushing it on paper, and watching what happens as it moves and dries. You will learn easy ways to create paintings that are all about color and the sometimes unpredictable nature of water.

No drawing skills are needed.

In this class we will explore the basic principles of watercolor painting. Learn or refresh your understanding of brush handling, brush care and setting up, the benefits of ‚Äúgood paper‚Äù, watercolor lights and darks, flat and graded washes, wet-on-wet techniques such as charging, wet-on-dry techniques such as glazing, color wheel, color theory, color mixing, and more. Simple applications of these techniques invite you to experiment and play.

This class is designed for adults 18+

$270 for 6 classes, 2.5 hours each class
Payable via check, cash, or Zelle.

*Brushes, palettes, set-ups, and paint will be provided.*

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‚Äòwet on wet‚Äô watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

description: Emilly Prado is an award-winning writer, multidisciplinary artist, and speaker whose work examines identity, the systems that shape our lives, and the power of storytelling across mediums. The author will share the evolving nature of finding her path as a writer, drawing upon her experiences as a first-generation Chicana and college student, and self-proclaimed troublemaker who struggled with school and mental health. Attendees will hear a reading from Funeral for Flaca and view archival childhood photographs to better understand the author and how she found strength through music and writing. Followed by a Q&A session.  For more information, visit: https://events.santarosa.edu/womxns-history-month-2026 (https://events.santarosa.edu/womxns-history-month-2026)

title: Upcycled Journal Workshop ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Upcycled Journal Workshop: 03/26/26

  
    
      
        
          $70.00
        
      
    
  

Thursday, March 26, 2026; 6PM-9PM$60 + $10 Materials feeA fun and creative workshop turning a cereal/snack box into a unique handmade journal. Using scissors we will remove parts of the boxes until we have what we will use as our cover. Then using miscellaneous papers we fold these into the pages of our journals. With simple book-binding skills using a needle and waxed thread we will stitch the pages into our covers. We will also decorate the covers of our journals with collage papers and/or paint.Examples of completed journals will be shown and step by step instruction will be provided along with all supplies. Short exercises to boost your creativity, journal prompts, and a small gift from me are also included.Whether you are a beginning or seasoned artist/writer/crafter or just looking to try something new, this is a great way to get inspired and create something meaningful to you.About the Instructor: Rendell Hourigan received a BBA in Marketing from Texas Tech University, and has pursued art for over 25 years, focusing on sustainable mixed media. She has studied with artists including Chery Baird, Jenny London, and Teri Sloat, exploring drawing, collage, and soft pastels. Her training includes workshops and courses in art journaling, mosaics, and mark-making. She‚Äôs exhibited work at the Sebastopol Center for the Arts, The Graton Gallery, and her SOFA district studio. Drawn to the beauty of discarded materials and passionate about recycling, she incorporates reclaimed materials into her work and now leads art workshops to inspire eco-conscious creativity in others.

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

title: THIRSTY THURSDAY New Member Social for Sonoma County Women's Wine Club
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
This is our regular club meeting, held on the last Thursday of every month except for holidays and we are super excited! Come join us at 4th Street Cellars in downtown Santa Rosa. They have generously offered to host our monthly THIRSTY THURSDAY social for us.

If you are new to the area, or just looking to get out of the house and make new friends, this is the place for you. Welcoming to ALL new and (ahem, old) members.

Wine is purchased by the glass for a set fee of $13/$14 per glass with the variety of white, ros√©, and red wines offered through 4th Street Cellars which includes tip. Fees are collected at the venue by Co-organizer Daima Phipps via cash, Venmo, or Paypal. You are welcome to purchase wine separately if you choose. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash.

There is no food offered, but you are welcome to bring an appetizer or snack to share with the group, and many ladies do. We will have time to socialize while tasting in the room upstairs to the left or the outside patio if the weather is nice.

The space has a 25 person attendee limit, but the list is open to 40 to eliminate a waitlist, and guests are welcome! Please RSVP below only if you are able to make it, we have an attendance policy: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

See you there, ready to kickoff!

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‚Äòwet on wet‚Äô watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

Let's make beautiful art together!

title: Explore Gel Plate Printing ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Out of Stock
      
    




Explore Gel Plate Printing

  
    
      
        
          $130.00
        
      
    
  

Saturday, March 28, 2026; 11 AM ‚Äì 3 PMFee: $115 + $15 materials feeAge: 16+ Participants: min. 8Learn to create beautiful designs on paper by printing with a gel plate and acrylic paint. Mixed media artist Catherine Cruz will teach you the basic skills for using this fun tool from printing textural backgrounds, to layering colors, and using stencils and other applications. You will take home many prints that can be used for designing collage, mixed media art or greeting cards. This class is suitable for anyone wanting to learn this unique mono printing style and perfect for beginners.What you‚Äôll get from this workshop: Methods for applying paint and pulling successful prints (Note: Magazine image transfer is not included in this class.), Techniques for creating intricate layered designs, Creative use of mark-making tools and masks, Strategies for combining techniques.A variety of papers will be provided but you are highly encouraged to bring your own papers to experiment on.IMPORTANT: Instructions for where to purchase your materials and how to prepare them is provided in the attached PDF. The instructor will start the class with a demonstration so please arrive a few minutes early to get set up so we can start on time.  We will take a short break for lunch between 12:30 and 1:00 pm so bring your lunch and a beverage.  About the instructor: Catherine Cruz is a French-American artist whose work is informed by textures and patterns created by the passing of time and the effects of the natural elements on the built environment.  She holds a Bachelor of Science in interior design and she worked in the field of architectural design and green building certification for over 25 years.  She has taught collage and mixed media workshops in the Bay Area and in France since 2019, and this is her fifth year at the Sebastopol Center for the Arts.  Her studio is located in Sebastopol and she participates in Art Trails Open Studios.  You may contact Catherine at beyouartstudio@gmail.com.  Check out Catherine‚Äôs other classes here:  https://wwws.sebarts.org/visual-arts-classes.

title: Fresh Pressed Flower Card Workshop
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Jan Lochner
Saturday, March 28th
2:00PM-5:00PM
Santa Rosa Location
$35.00

This is a hands on make and take class where you will make at least five items including a bookmark, a greeting card, a fridge magnet and an ornament. The class will use two different techniques and Jan will explain how to press flowers and which flowers hold their color best. It is a creative experience!


To register for this workshop, please contact Jan at: freshpressedflowercards@yahoo.com mailto:freshpressedflowercards@yahoo.com

Creating note cards from pressed flowers has been Jan‚Äôs hobby for 25 years, though she has no formal art training. She utilizes color,
shape and texture on fine quality paper, each card uniquely handmade. Jan‚Äôs home in Sebastopol is her studio: the dining room table is her workshop, the kitchen cupboards storing boxes and trays of flowers. She buy card stock by the thousand and pick blooms from her garden and other public places. Her family is used to me saying, ‚Äúcould we stop for just a few minutes so I can gather some‚Ä¶ ‚Äù

It is a wonderful way of life.

*A note to all students: Please park on in the East facing parking lot while attending classes. We greatly appreciate it. Thank you.

title: Watercolor Fundamentals Part 1
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Anne Millett

This is a 6-class series, meeting 6 Tuesdays
10:30AM-1:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$270.00


*Additional: Separate $20.00 plus tax Materials Fee paid to Anne at the first class, for the high-quality Arches #140 cold press watercolor paper. Brushes, palettes, high-quality watercolor paint, and set-ups for use during class will be provided.*

There will be a materials fee of $15 plus tax for the series.


Watercolor Fundamentals - Part 1

This class focuses on the simple delight of mixing color with water, brushing it on paper, and watching what happens as it moves and dries. You will learn easy ways to create paintings that are all about color and the sometimes unpredictable nature of water.

No drawing skills are needed.

In this class we will explore the basic principles of watercolor painting. Learn or refresh your understanding of brush handling, brush care and setting up, the benefits of ‚Äúgood paper‚Äù, watercolor lights and darks, flat and graded washes, wet-on-wet techniques such as charging, wet-on-dry techniques such as glazing, color wheel, color theory, color mixing, and more. Simple applications of these techniques invite you to experiment and play.

This class is designed for adults 18+

$270 for 6 classes, 2.5 hours each class
Payable via check, cash, or Zelle.

*Brushes, palettes, set-ups, and paint will be provided.*


To see Anne's work and to learn more about this class, please visit her website at: http://www.miraaster.com https://www.miraaster.com/ www.miraaster.com


To register for this workshop, please contact Anne by email at: classes@miraaster.com mailto:classes@miraaster.com mailto:amillett@gmail.com

title: Observational Drawing 3-Week Course ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Observational Drawing 3-Week Course

  
    
      
        
          $175.00
        
      
    
  

Wednesdays, April 1 - April 15, 2026; 6-9PM$150 + $25 Materials FeeAges 16+In this three week course, participants will learn and practice observational skills and fundamental drawing techniques that will inform all of their other creative pursuits. This course is for anyone who wants to practice and advance their drawing skills - beginners, those who haven‚Äôt practiced in years, or any artists who just want to learn more and practice with consistent feedback and guidance. Learning to draw is truly learning to see - a skill that anyone can be taught, practice, and hone. Through demonstration, practice, and reflective discussion, this class will explore the foundations of classical drawing techniques in a low pressure environment. Observational drawing gives all artists a foundation of practical knowledge and skills that infinitely expands the possibilities of what one can create. If your ideas feel limited by your drawing skills, if you feel frustrated or stuck in your painting practice, or if you simply want to start drawing and are looking for a way to begin, this is the class for you. About the Instructor: Hannah Day received her BA in Visual Arts with an emphasis on drawing and printmaking from University of San Diego, then attended University of Hawaii at Manoa to receive her MFA in printmaking. Hannah‚Äôs etchings have been internationally shown and collected, but her personal practice also includes paper cutting, graphite, watercolor, mixed media, and murals. She have taught all ages and many formats (kids, teens, adults, college, private lessons, camps, etc) and many mediums. These days Hannah has been teaching primarily paper cutting but also enjoys teaching drawing, painting and printmaking.

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

Drop-In Figure Drawing session. [San Rafael location]

Fee: $20

This Figure drawing session provides artists with the opportunity to practice drawing techniques with a live model in different poses. This process helps the artist capture the essence of the human body‚Äôs posture, texture, and movement.

title: Jizo Peace Project: Clay Gathering ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Jizo Peace Project: Clay Gathering for Remembrance and Peace, April

  
    
      
        
          $10.00
        
      
    
  

Friday, April 3, 2026; 1:30 ‚Äì 4:00pmDue to limited capacity, we are asking for a suggested donation of $10 to confirm your attendance. Bring a copy of your receipt at check-in to Painting/Drawing Studio adjacent to Ceramics StudioJoin us for a monthly, heart-centered gathering where we come together to create Jizo guardians out of clay‚Äîsymbols of compassion, protection, and peace. Rooted in the Buddhist tradition and echoed across many cultures, Jizo figures traditionally honor children and all who have passed, those in transition, and those in distress.This ongoing project is dedicated to remembering those lost to war, with a special focus now on the approximately 19,000 children who have perished in Israel and Gaza in recent years. Through the simple, meditative act of working with clay, we create benevolent beings that will become part of public exhibits and peace sites, offering spaces for reflection, mourning, and hope. Our gatherings conclude with a gentle ritual to honor the lives of these children.We meet from 1:30‚Äì4:00 pm on the first Friday of each month at SebArts, in the Painting & Drawing Room. The gathering is open to ages 12 - adult, and no prior clay experience is necessary‚Äîall clay and basic materials are supplied. Registration is required to participate.There is no fee for this class; donations are welcome to help cover materials and expenses. More than a class, this is a shared space of warmth and care‚Äîan opportunity to tend to our own hearts while taking part in love in action.

title: Pt 1: Modifying Thrown Forms ‚Äì Focusing on Teapot Making with Ping Zhong ‚Äî Sebastopol Center For the Arts, California
location: Sebastopol Center for the Arts, 282 S High St, Sebastopol, CA 95472
description:
Pt 1: Modifying Thrown Forms ‚Äì Focusing on Teapot Making with Ping Zhong

  
    
      
        
          $10.00
        
      
    
  

Saturday, April 4, 2026; 10am-11amLocated in the Ceramics StudioIn this workshop, SebArts‚Äô Ceramics Residency artist, Ping Zhong, will focus on the details and assembly of a teapot. Due to time and space considerations, wheel-throwing will not be demonstrated on site. Instead, pre-thrown pot bodies will be prepared as starting points. The workshop will center on shaping small components such as knobs, spouts, and handles, including hand-building techniques for forming these parts, as well as methods for attaching them harmoniously to the body. The instructor will also share practical tool tips to help participants work confidently with fine details and achieve a polished finish. This workshop is recommended to be held shortly after the instructor‚Äôs arrival.Due to limited capacity of the Ceramics Studio, we are asking for a suggested donation of $10 to confirm your attendance. About the Artist: Ping Zhong‚Äôs artistic practice is a continuous exploration of regeneration‚Äîof materials, forms, and cultural narratives. She investigates the dialogue between ancient Chinese pottery and contemporary visual language, using wheel-throwing, hand-building, and sculpture to create works in which history and personal growth converge. This reinterpretation of classical forms is not only an artistic method, but also a philosophical inquiry into the harmony between past and future. Deeply motivated to uncover the potential within clay, Ping pushes the boundaries of design and technique. Her work reflects on universal themes: the individual‚Äôs place within the community, the relationship between essence and appearance, and the evolving connection between nature and society. Through these explorations, she seeks to create art that resonates across cultures.

title: Beginning Gel Printing Workshop
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Magdalena Bogart
Monday, April 6th
1:00pm-4:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$45.00


Join us for an inspiring gel printing workshop with Magdalena Bogart, where you'll discover the
magic of this versatile and expressive art form. You will learn techniques for creating stunning,
layered prints using gel plates, rich textures, and vibrant colors.
If you have wanted to try out this fairly new and very popular way to make your own papers, whether you are an experienced artist or simply curious about the process, this workshop will provide plenty of creative inspiration and expert insights.

During the 3-hours workshop, you will learn the fundamentals of mono-printing with a gel plate,
including an in-depth look at the essential supplies needed. Magdalena will discuss different
types of plates and brayers, as well as the wide range of acrylic paints and inks. You will learn the basics of color theory to ensure great results for your projects.

You will get to try out many fun techniques on different papers. Magdalena will introduce various papers for gel printing, including white copy paper, calligraphy paper, deli paper, marker paper, and more each offering unique effects.

The workshop will also explore tools for making marks and textures, from found objects to store-bought supplies. Magdalena will demonstrate how to use stencils - both handmade and purchased, along with unconventional tools like silicone scrapers, scrapers, bubble wrap, buttons, yarn, and cardboard to create stunning patterns.

She will also cover techniques to embellish your prints incorporating acrylic pens, Inktense pencils and other techniques.
Additionally, Magdalena will provide expert guidance on cleaning, caring for, and storing gel plates to ensure their longevity. To wrap up the session, she will showcase creative ways to use your printed papers, including ideas for collages, handmade cards, and art journals, along with a take-home list of even more ways to incorporate your gel prints into future projects. Whether you are looking to refine your skills or try something new, this workshop promises to be an engaging and educational experience. Come explore the endless possibilities of gel printing.


To register for this workshop, please contact Magdalena at: 408.781.2589 or by email
at: mailto:mag.bogart@gmail.com mailto:mag.bogart@gmail.com mailto:mag.bogart@gmail.com mailto:mag.bogart@gmail.com mag.bogart@gmail.com mailto:mag.bogart@gmail.com mailto:mag.bogart@gmail.com

title: Watercolor Fundamentals Part 1
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Anne Millett

This is a 6-class series, meeting 6 Tuesdays
10:30AM-1:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$270.00


*Additional: Separate $20.00 plus tax Materials Fee paid to Anne at the first class, for the high-quality Arches #140 cold press watercolor paper. Brushes, palettes, high-quality watercolor paint, and set-ups for use during class will be provided.*

There will be a materials fee of $15 plus tax for the series.


Watercolor Fundamentals - Part 1

This class focuses on the simple delight of mixing color with water, brushing it on paper, and watching what happens as it moves and dries. You will learn easy ways to create paintings that are all about color and the sometimes unpredictable nature of water.

No drawing skills are needed.

In this class we will explore the basic principles of watercolor painting. Learn or refresh your understanding of brush handling, brush care and setting up, the benefits of ‚Äúgood paper‚Äù, watercolor lights and darks, flat and graded washes, wet-on-wet techniques such as charging, wet-on-dry techniques such as glazing, color wheel, color theory, color mixing, and more. Simple applications of these techniques invite you to experiment and play.

This class is designed for adults 18+

$270 for 6 classes, 2.5 hours each class
Payable via check, cash, or Zelle.

*Brushes, palettes, set-ups, and paint will be provided.*


To see Anne's work and to learn more about this class, please visit her website at: http://www.miraaster.com https://www.miraaster.com/ www.miraaster.com

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‚Äòwet on wet‚Äô watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

title: Give 'Em the Axe! Ladies Night at the Range in Santa Rosa
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
Join us for an axe-throwing session to blow off some steam. I'm super excited to be able to offer a ladies' Axe-throwing night in Santa Rosa. If you've ever had a curiosity about this fun activity, this is your chance to find out more!

We have reserved a group spot with the indoor range on a Wednesday night. It will consist of an introductory lesson, and then we all get to practice taking turns. Everyone will get ample time to practice, as they have many lanes.

This event is focused on a less-competitive, relaxed, and entertaining atmosphere. All skill levels are encouraged. All equipment and targets are provided by them, and we will probably get about 1 to 2 hours to enjoy ourselves.

I encourage everyone to bring a bottle of wine or a snack to share with the rest of the group (We usually end up with a lovely charcuterie and wine spread for everyone to enjoy).

There are 10 spots available, guests welcome. The ladies' group lesson and event is $30 person, paid to the range. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash. There may be standard liability forms to be filled out with the range. Closed-toed shoes are recommended.

Please only RSVP 'Yes' if you are able to make it, I will be doing a final headcount the day of. There is an attendance policy for all our events: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

Cheers, and hope to see you there!

description:
This is a monthly on-going class designed to teach beginner or experienced students how to master painting in Acrylics. Students are given a wealth of information regarding acrylic supplies and materials for painting realism or abstraction. At each class, Hines will assist each student in the execution and completion of their painting. Including instructions and demonstrations on color, paint application, color mixing, form and composition. This is a great opportunity for anyone wishing to learn how to paint with acrylics as well as oil painters wishing to transition from oils to acrylics.

Fee:

Sign up for 4 classes: $200 (limited to 10 students)

Limited Drop-ins: $60 per class

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‚Äòwet on wet‚Äô watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

Let's make beautiful art together!

Back to All Shows



The 23rd Annual Art of Dessert
The Art of Dessert¬†is LBC‚Äôs biggest fundraising event of the year. Over the years, it has raised more than $8 million to help provide enrichment in the arts to over 1 million children, families, and educators. 
Much anticipated, spirited, and delicious,¬†The¬†Art of Dessert¬†features sumptuous family-style dining, exceptional Rodney Strong Wine Estates wines, engaging entertainment, a silent and live auction, and, of course, decadent desserts by the best bakers in the county! Bid on unique live auction items and enjoy lively entertainment and engaging speakers. Sonoma County‚Äôs best fundraiser is a night to remember, and your support will make a difference for over 50,000 students, teachers, and families in the coming year.

Thanks to your support, Luther Burbank Center for the Arts is the North Bay‚Äôs premier arts nonprofit, a vibrant gathering place providing world-class performances, a wide variety of community events, and nationally-recognized education programs that annually serve over 50,000 students, teachers, and families.

title: Watercolor Fundamentals Part 1
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Anne Millett

This is a 6-class series, meeting 6 Tuesdays
10:30AM-1:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$270.00


*Additional: Separate $20.00 plus tax Materials Fee paid to Anne at the first class, for the high-quality Arches #140 cold press watercolor paper. Brushes, palettes, high-quality watercolor paint, and set-ups for use during class will be provided.*

There will be a materials fee of $15 plus tax for the series.


Watercolor Fundamentals - Part 1

This class focuses on the simple delight of mixing color with water, brushing it on paper, and watching what happens as it moves and dries. You will learn easy ways to create paintings that are all about color and the sometimes unpredictable nature of water.

No drawing skills are needed.

In this class we will explore the basic principles of watercolor painting. Learn or refresh your understanding of brush handling, brush care and setting up, the benefits of ‚Äúgood paper‚Äù, watercolor lights and darks, flat and graded washes, wet-on-wet techniques such as charging, wet-on-dry techniques such as glazing, color wheel, color theory, color mixing, and more. Simple applications of these techniques invite you to experiment and play.

This class is designed for adults 18+

$270 for 6 classes, 2.5 hours each class
Payable via check, cash, or Zelle.

*Brushes, palettes, set-ups, and paint will be provided.*


To see Anne's work and to learn more about this class, please visit her website at: http://www.miraaster.com https://www.miraaster.com/ www.miraaster.com


To register for this workshop, please contact Anne by email at: classes@miraaster.com mailto:classes@miraaster.com mailto:amillett@gmail.com

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‚Äòwet on wet‚Äô watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

Let's make beautiful art together!

title: Acrylic Painting Workshop
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
This is a monthly on-going class designed to teach beginner or experienced students how to master painting in Acrylics. Students are given a wealth of information regarding acrylic supplies and materials for painting realism or abstraction. At each class, Hines will assist each student in the execution and completion of their painting. Including instructions and demonstrations on color, paint application, color mixing, form and composition. This is a great opportunity for anyone wishing to learn how to paint with acrylics as well as oil painters wishing to transition from oils to acrylics.

Fee:

Sign up for 4 classes: $200 (limited to 10 students)

Limited Drop-ins: $60 per class

To register contact Hines at: mailto:TheArtistHines@gmail.com TheArtistHines@gmail.com mailto:TheArtistHines@gmail.com and receive more information about the class, payment procedure and the class supply list. And please email Hines if you have any questions.

The Artist Hines http://www.hinesfineart.com/ http://www.theartisthinesphotography.com/ https://youtu.be/kfTYYMpar1M

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

description:
Drop-In Figure Drawing session. [San Rafael location]

Fee: $20

This Figure drawing session provides artists with the opportunity to practice drawing techniques with a live model in different poses. This process helps the artist capture the essence of the human body‚Äôs posture, texture, and movement.

There is no formal lesson; the sessions run for 3 hours and open to all regardless of experience. First Come First Served.

Long pose, every last Thursday of the month.

Doors open at 6:45pm, front door entry.

All mediums are welcome except oil paint (water soluble oil paint is okay).

title: Emmylou Harris
description:
Back to All Shows


Emmylou¬†Harris

Friday, April 17, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Billboard¬†Century Award recipient, Harris‚Äô contribution as a singer and songwriter spans 40 years. She has recorded more than 25 albums and has lent her talents to countless fellow artists‚Äô recordings. In recognition of her remarkable career, Harris was inducted into the Country Music Hall of Fame in 2008 and earned a Grammy Lifetime Achievement award in 2018. 
Harris is one of the most admired and influential women in music. She has recorded with such diverse artists as Linda Ronstadt, Daniel Lanois, Bob Dylan, Mark Knopfler, Neil Young, Gram Parsons, Willie Nelson, Dolly Parton, Roy Orbison, Ryan Adams, Beck, Elvis Costello, Johnny Cash, Lucinda Williams, Lyle Lovett and Rodney Crowell. Few artists have achieved such honesty or have revealed such maturity in their writing. Forty years into her career, Harris continues to share the hard-earned wisdom that‚Äîhopefully if not inevitably‚Äîcomes with getting older, though she‚Äôs never stopped looking ahead.

description:
Back to All Shows


Outback Presents
Justin Willman: One for the Ages Tour

Saturday, April 18, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Fresh off the release of Magic Lover, Netflix‚Äôs first-ever magic comedy special, Justin Willman is hitting the road with his all-new One for the Ages tour. Willman is best known as the star and creator of Netflix‚Äôs Magic for Humans and Magic Prank Show, where his signature mix of mind-blowing magic and relatable humor has made him a streaming favorite, a viral hit (1 billion views and counting), and a fan favorite for families, comedy lovers, and skeptics alike. 
He‚Äôs appeared on The Tonight Show, The Today Show, The Kelly Clarkson Show, and Conan, and he was recently named ‚ÄúStage Magician of the Year‚Äù by the Magic Castle. He‚Äôs performed at the White House, packed theaters across the country, and managed to make grown adults openly weep over a card trick. But the live show? That‚Äôs where the real magic happens. 
One for the Ages is Justin‚Äôs biggest tour to date, featuring brand-new material and more. It‚Äôs an interactive, laugh-filled, sleight-of-mind experience that‚Äôs smart, silly, and astonishing. And yes, it‚Äôs the kind of show you can bring your kids, your date, or your dad to. All ages. All generations. All-new. 
This is one for the ages!

Best available seating
