title: Watercolor Fundamentals Part 1
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Anne Millett

This is a 6-class series, meeting 6 Tuesdays
10:30AM-1:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$270.00


*Additional: Separate $20.00 plus tax Materials Fee paid to Anne at the first class, for the high-quality Arches #140 cold press watercolor paper. Brushes, palettes, high-quality watercolor paint, and set-ups for use during class will be provided.*

There will be a materials fee of $15 plus tax for the series.


Watercolor Fundamentals - Part 1

This class focuses on the simple delight of mixing color with water, brushing it on paper, and watching what happens as it moves and dries. You will learn easy ways to create paintings that are all about color and the sometimes unpredictable nature of water.

No drawing skills are needed.

In this class we will explore the basic principles of watercolor painting. Learn or refresh your understanding of brush handling, brush care and setting up, the benefits of ‚Äúgood paper‚Äù, watercolor lights and darks, flat and graded washes, wet-on-wet techniques such as charging, wet-on-dry techniques such as glazing, color wheel, color theory, color mixing, and more. Simple applications of these techniques invite you to experiment and play.

This class is designed for adults 18+

$270 for 6 classes, 2.5 hours each class
Payable via check, cash, or Zelle.

*Brushes, palettes, set-ups, and paint will be provided.*


To see Anne's work and to learn more about this class, please visit her website at: http://www.miraaster.com https://www.miraaster.com/ www.miraaster.com


To register for this workshop, please contact Anne by email at: classes@miraaster.com mailto:classes@miraaster.com mailto:amillett@gmail.com

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‚Äòwet on wet‚Äô watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

Let's make beautiful art together!

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

Gary Owen has been entertaining audiences for more than two decades with his sharp observational humor and fearless storytelling. Known for his unapologetic, rule-defying style, his material draws from his personal life, time in the military, and the everyday absurdities that connect people across backgrounds. With a fanbase that has grown by the millions in recent months and continues to surge across social media, Owen‚Äôs reach has cemented his place as one of the most in-demand touring comedians today. 
Beyond stand-up, Owen has appeared in a wide range of feature films and television. He continues to write, produce, and perform his own groundbreaking comedy specials. In addition to his on-stage and on-screen work, Owen hosts his own podcast, #GetSome with Gary Owen.

Spring is here as flowers continue to bloom all around us! What better time to learn how to draw spring flowers with colored pencil. Join this workshop as we delve into drawing spring flowers using colored pencil as a medium. The morning portion of this workshop will focus on colored pencil principles and techniques, student exercises and creating color palettes. The afternoon will be dedicated to hands-on drawing time with individual one-on-one assistance. All levels welcomed. Ability to draw freehand is not needed to participate in this workshop. Materials list to be emailed once registration is completed.

Victoria A. Kochergin is a local botanical artist and instructor who works with colored pencil and acrylics. Her artwork has been exhibited in galleries, wineries, botanical gardens, international shows and on Alcatraz. location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Jan Lochner
Sunday, April 26th
1:00PM-4:00PM
Santa Rosa Location
$35.00

This is a hands on make and take class where you will make at least five items including a bookmark, a greeting card, a fridge magnet and an ornament. The class will use two different techniques and Jan will explain how to press flowers and which flowers hold their color best. It is a creative experience!


To register for this workshop, please contact Jan at: freshpressedflowercards@yahoo.com mailto:freshpressedflowercards@yahoo.com

Creating note cards from pressed flowers has been Jan‚Äôs hobby for 25 years, though she has no formal art training. She utilizes color,
shape and texture on fine quality paper, each card uniquely handmade. Jan‚Äôs home in Sebastopol is her studio: the dining room table is her workshop, the kitchen cupboards storing boxes and trays of flowers. She buy card stock by the thousand and pick blooms from her garden and other public places. Her family is used to me saying, ‚Äúcould we stop for just a few minutes so I can gather some‚Ä¶ ‚Äù

It is a wonderful way of life.

*A note to all students: Please park on in the East facing parking lot while attending classes. We greatly appreciate it. Thank you.

Phil Collins‚Äô one-of-a-kind drum work and songwriting have left an enduring mark on music. title: The Calder Quartet - SRJC's Chamber Concert Series
description: Hailed as "superb" and "imaginative, skillful creators" by the New York Times, the Calder Quartet captivates audiences, exploring a broad spectrum of repertoire, always striving to fulfill the composer's vision in its performances. The group's distinctive artistry is exemplified by a musical curiosity brought to everything they perform and has led them to be called "one of America's most satisfying‚Äìand most enterprising‚Äìquartets."  Winners of the prestigious 2014 Avery Fisher Career Grant, they are widely known for the discovery, commissioning, recording and mentoring of some of today's best emerging composers.  Benjamin Jacobson, violin; Tereza Stanislav, violin; Jonathan Moerschel, viola; and Eric Byers, cello     Program:  Philip Glass, String Quartet No. 2, "Company"  Ben Johnston, String Quartet No. 4, "Amazing Grace"  Samuel Barber, String Quartet in B minor Op. 11  Andrew Norman, Sabrina (arr. for string quartet)  Florence Price, String Quartet No. 2*Reception immediately following concert     Ticket Prices:  Season tickets (all 6 concerts): $155  Mini Season (any 3 concerts): $90  Individual tickets: $35  Student tickets (with valid ID): $20   Buy tickets here! title: Sonoma State Rep - In Person Appointments (Santa Rosa)
Watercolor Fundamentals Part 1
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Anne Millett

This is a 6-class series, meeting 6 Tuesdays
10:30AM-1:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$270.00


*Additional: Separate $20.00 plus tax Materials Fee paid to Anne at the first class, for the high-quality Arches #140 cold press watercolor paper. Brushes, palettes, high-quality watercolor paint, and set-ups for use during class will be provided.*

There will be a materials fee of $15 plus tax for the series.


Watercolor Fundamentals - Part 1

This class focuses on the simple delight of mixing color with water, brushing it on paper, and watching what happens as it moves and dries. You will learn easy ways to create paintings that are all about color and the sometimes unpredictable nature of water.

No drawing skills are needed.

In this class we will explore the basic principles of watercolor painting. Learn or refresh your understanding of brush handling, brush care and setting up, the benefits of ‚Äúgood paper‚Äù, watercolor lights and darks, flat and graded washes, wet-on-wet techniques such as charging, wet-on-dry techniques such as glazing, color wheel, color theory, color mixing, and more. Simple applications of these techniques invite you to experiment and play.

This class is designed for adults 18+

$270 for 6 classes, 2.5 hours each class
Payable via check, cash, or Zelle.

*Brushes, palettes, set-ups, and paint will be provided.*


To see Anne's work and to learn more about this class, please visit her website at: http://www.miraaster.com https://www.miraaster.com/ www.miraaster.com


To register for this workshop, please contact Anne by email at: classes@miraaster.com mailto:classes@miraaster.com mailto:amillett@gmail.com

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

title: THIRSTY THURSDAY New Member Social for Sonoma County Women's Wine Club
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
This is our regular club meeting, held on the last Thursday of every month except for holidays and we are super excited! Come join us at 4th Street Cellars in downtown Santa Rosa. They have generously offered to host our monthly THIRSTY THURSDAY social for us.

If you are new to the area, or just looking to get out of the house and make new friends, this is the place for you. Welcoming to ALL new and (ahem, old) members.

Wine is purchased by the glass for a set fee of $13/$14 per glass with the variety of white, ros√©, and red wines offered through 4th Street Cellars which includes tip. Fees are collected at the venue by Co-organizer Daima Phipps via cash, Venmo, or Paypal. You are welcome to purchase wine separately if you choose. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash.

There is no food offered, but you are welcome to bring an appetizer or snack to share with the group, and many ladies do. We will have time to socialize while tasting in the room upstairs to the left or the outside patio if the weather is nice.

The space has a 25 person attendee limit, but the list is open to 40 to eliminate a waitlist, and guests are welcome! Please RSVP below only if you are able to make it, we have an attendance policy: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

See you there, ready to kickoff!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‚Äòwet on wet‚Äô watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

description:

Clover Sonoma Family Fun Series
Ada Twist, Scientist & Friends
by TheaterWorksUSA


Sunday, May 3, 2026

3:30 pm


BUY INDIVIDUAL TICKETS 
When Ms. Greer‚Äôs classroom field trip goes awry, three out-of-the-box thinkers must pull their STEM skills together to save the day! Meet Rosie Revere and her engineering dreams, Iggy Peck, with her relentless passion for architecture, and Ada Twist, whose science curiosity leads her to some adventurous problem solving. In this live musical performance, our heroes face the ultimate test of their problem-solving skills‚Äîa test that can only be conquered through teamwork. Don‚Äôt miss this fun musical based on the Andrea Beaty books,¬†Rosie Revere, Engineer; Iggy Peck, Architect, and Ada Twist, Scientist, which spotlight the STEM curriculum (focusing on science, technology, engineering and math). 
Recommended for ages 5-9, however, you know your child best. 
Run Time: 60 minutes 
Lap passes available day of the show, in-person at the ticket office for ages 2 and under. 

LBC performance may not include pieces from above video.

Starting one hour before each performance, please join us in the lobby for fun art projects uniquely developed for each show. We also have pizza, beverages, and snacks available, all priced with a family‚Äôs budget in mind!¬†

title: Watercolor Fundamentals Part 1
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Anne Millett

This is a 6-class series, meeting 6 Tuesdays
10:30AM-1:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$270.00


*Additional: Separate $20.00 plus tax Materials Fee paid to Anne at the first class, for the high-quality Arches #140 cold press watercolor paper. Brushes, palettes, high-quality watercolor paint, and set-ups for use during class will be provided.*

There will be a materials fee of $15 plus tax for the series.


Watercolor Fundamentals - Part 1

This class focuses on the simple delight of mixing color with water, brushing it on paper, and watching what happens as it moves and dries. You will learn easy ways to create paintings that are all about color and the sometimes unpredictable nature of water.

No drawing skills are needed.

In this class we will explore the basic principles of watercolor painting. Learn or refresh your understanding of brush handling, brush care and setting up, the benefits of ‚Äúgood paper‚Äù, watercolor lights and darks, flat and graded washes, wet-on-wet techniques such as charging, wet-on-dry techniques such as glazing, color wheel, color theory, color mixing, and more. Simple applications of these techniques invite you to experiment and play.

This class is designed for adults 18+

$270 for 6 classes, 2.5 hours each class
Payable via check, cash, or Zelle.

*Brushes, palettes, set-ups, and paint will be provided.*


To see Anne's work and to learn more about this class, please visit her website at: http://www.miraaster.com https://www.miraaster.com/ www.miraaster.com


To register for this workshop, please contact Anne by email at: classes@miraaster.com mailto:classes@miraaster.com mailto:amillett@gmail.com

description: The Free Farmer's Market is located outside, under the outdoor canopy, between buildings 400 & 500. Don't forget to bring your own grocery bags, some will be provided on a first come first serve basis.  Can't make it? title: First Tuesday Mystical Seekers Series
description:
Rosicrucians AMORC, Santa Rosa, CA
-Free Admission - Refreshments - Open to the public -

Topic to be announced.....
Speaker to be announced......

About the Santa Rosa Pronaos
We hold a monthly public presentation on mystical or metaphysical topics as a public service. The topics and speakers vary and no previous knowledge or experience is required. Just bring an open mind and heart.

The Santa Rosa Pronaos doesn't charge for admission. We operate under the law of AMRA. You may give as your heart and mind direct you.

The Santa Rosa Pronaos of the Rosicrucian Order, AMORC is a 501c3 Educational Nonprofit.

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

description: The Petaluma Cinema Series is a film education program that brings together SRJC film students, the campus community, and Sonoma County residents to engage in dialogue around classic, foreign, & independent films. title: Acrylic Painting Workshop
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
This is a monthly on-going class designed to teach beginner or experienced students how to master painting in Acrylics. Students are given a wealth of information regarding acrylic supplies and materials for painting realism or abstraction. At each class, Hines will assist each student in the execution and completion of their painting. Including instructions and demonstrations on color, paint application, color mixing, form and composition. This is a great opportunity for anyone wishing to learn how to paint with acrylics as well as oil painters wishing to transition from oils to acrylics.

Fee:

Sign up for 4 classes: $200 (limited to 10 students)

Limited Drop-ins: $60 per class

To register contact Hines at: mailto:TheArtistHines@gmail.com TheArtistHines@gmail.com mailto:TheArtistHines@gmail.com and receive more information about the class, payment procedure and the class supply list. And please email Hines if you have any questions.

The Artist Hines http://www.hinesfineart.com/ http://www.theartisthinesphotography.com/ https://youtu.be/kfTYYMpar1M

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

title: An Evening with David Sedaris
description:
Back to All Shows


David Sedaris

Friday, May 8, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
David Sedaris is one of America‚Äôs pre-eminent humor writers. He is a master of satire and one of today‚Äôs most observant writers. 
Beloved for his personal essays and short stories, David Sedaris is the author of the New York Times bestsellers Barrel Fever, Holidays on Ice, Naked, Me Talk Pretty One Day, Dress Your Family in Corduroy and Denim, When You Are Engulfed in Flames, Let‚Äôs Explore Diabetes with Owls, and Calypso. His book, The Best of Me, collects 42 previously published stories and essays. Sedaris also wrote Squirrel Seeks Chipmunk: A Modest Bestiary, a collection of fables with illustrations by Ian Falconer. He is the editor of Children Playing Before a Statue of Hercules: An Anthology of Outstanding Stories. His pieces regularly appear in The New Yorker and have twice been included in ‚ÄúThe Best American Essays.‚Äù

title: Bobby Rush & North Mississippi Allstars
description:
Back to All Shows


Bobby Rush & North Mississippi Allstars

Saturday, May 9, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Modern Mississippi Hill Country¬†band North Mississippi Allstars and blues legend¬†Bobby Rush¬†are co-headlining this unique event, with each artist performing separately before joining together to honor their Mississippi blues roots. 
North Mississippi Allstars was started by brothers Luther and Cody Dickinson in 1996 as a loose collective of musicians from their North Mississippi home. They were inspired by their father Jim Dickinson as well as neighbors and musical elders of their community, including RL Burnside, Junior Kimbrough, Otha Turner, and Fred McDowell.¬†They have multiple Grammy¬Æ nominations for their acclaimed experimental albums, and the latest album, Still Shakin‚Äô, is out now. 
The 91-year-old Bobby Rush is a three-time Grammy Award¬Æ winner for ‚ÄúBest Traditional Blues Album‚Äù for Porcupine Meat, Rawer than Raw, and 2024‚Äôs All My Love for You. He is also a 16-time Blues Music Awards winner (with 56 career nominations) and has been inducted into the Blues Hall of Fame, Mississippi Musicians Hall of Fame and Rhythm & Blues Hall of Fame.

description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

description:

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‚Äòwet on wet‚Äô watercolor technique

Napoleon Dynamite Live
A Conversation with Jon Heder, Efren Ramirez, and Jon Gries


Friday, May 15, 2026

7:30 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Since the release of the beloved indie classic,¬†Napoleon Dynamite, 20 years ago, much has changed, but the characters, as enduring as they are endearing, stay in our hearts. This unique evening includes a full screening of¬†Napoleon Dynamite,¬†followed by a lively discussion with cast members, Jon Heder (Napoleon Dynamite), Jon Gries (Uncle Rico), and Efren Ramirez (Pedro). Perfect for the whole family, this live show is a wild and hysterical blend of Q&A, comedy improv, game show, and party, with plenty of audience participation.

Elevate your event experience with this exclusive chance to meet Jon Heder (Napoleon), Efren Ramirez (Pedro), and Jon Gries (Uncle Rico), including a photo opportunity. With limited tickets available, be sure to reserve yours soon!

title: Drawing Spring Flowers with Colored Pencil
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Victoria A. Kochergin

May 16th, 2026

10:30AM - 3:30PM

Location: Santa Rosa

Fee: $95.00

Spring is here as flowers continue to bloom all around us! What better time to learn how to draw spring flowers with colored pencil. Join this workshop as we delve into drawing spring flowers using colored pencil as a medium. The morning portion of this workshop will focus on colored pencil principles and techniques, student exercises and creating color palettes. The afternoon will be dedicated to hands-on drawing time with individual one-on-one assistance. All levels welcomed. Ability to draw freehand is not needed to participate in this workshop. Materials list to be emailed once registration is completed.

To register, please contact Victoria at mailto:kochergi@sonic.net kochergi@sonic.net mailto:kochergi@sonic.net mailto:kochergi@sonic.net or (707) 479-3336.

Victoria A. Kochergin is a local botanical artist and instructor who works with colored pencil and acrylics. Her artwork has been exhibited in galleries, wineries, botanical gardens, international shows and on Alcatraz. For more information about Victoria, please visit her website at www.victoriakochergin.com http://www.victoriakochergin.com/

title: Santa Rosa Game Night
description:
Santa Rosa Game Night
An evening of board games and cards preceded by pot luck snacks. Bring a game, play what is there, learn a new game, socialize, eat! Members are welcoming and friendly, ready to teach new people how to play. Please, no Crimes against Humanity.
We ask for a $2 donation to cover the cost.
Game Night is every third Saturday unless otherwise noted. If cancelled, you will receive email notice. Lately we have a lot of no shows. Please take your reservation seriously and give us advance notice if you cannot attend. It is a good idea to arrive at 6:00.
Game night is the third Saturday of every month.

description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Paul Anka: A Man and His Music
description:
Back to All Shows


Paul Anka: A Man and His Music

Thursday, May 21, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
With his craftsmanship as a master songwriter and his youthful tenor sound, Paul Anka has been crooning his way to fans‚Äô hearts with a polished blend of classic pop and rock-and-roll energy. 
His duets albums, Body of Work in 1998 that features Frank Sinatra, Celine Dion, Tom Jones and daughter Anthea Anka, and Duets in 2013 with Frank Sinatra, Michael Jackson, Tom Jones, Celine Dion, and Michael Bubl√©, celebrate his lifelong collaborations with a variety of artists. Duets set a milestone in Billboard Chart history because, with the CD, Anka became the only artist to have a CD on the Billboard Top 100 Chart for seven consecutive decades. 
At 81 years old, Paul Anka continues to write and record. His latest two albums, Making Memories and Sessions, were released in 2021 and 2022 respectively. The albums featured new and never-before recorded songs as well as new takes on old classics, notably ‚ÄúPut Your Head On My Shoulder,‚Äù with Olivia Newton John, one of her last recorded songs, and ‚ÄúMy Way,‚Äù featuring Michael Buble and Andrea Bocelli.

title: Fresh Pressed Flower Card Workshop
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Jan Lochner
Saturday, May 23rd
2:00PM-5:00PM
Santa Rosa Location
$35.00

This is a hands on make and take class where you will make at least five items including a bookmark, a greeting card, a fridge magnet and an ornament. The class will use two different techniques and Jan will explain how to press flowers and which flowers hold their color best. It is a creative experience!


To register for this workshop, please contact Jan at: freshpressedflowercards@yahoo.com mailto:freshpressedflowercards@yahoo.com mailto:freshpressedflowercards@yahoo.com

Creating note cards from pressed flowers has been Jan‚Äôs hobby for 25 years, though she has no formal art training. She utilizes color,
shape and texture on fine quality paper, each card uniquely handmade. Jan‚Äôs home in Sebastopol is her studio: the dining room table is her workshop, the kitchen cupboards storing boxes and trays of flowers. She buy card stock by the thousand and pick blooms from her garden and other public places. Her family is used to me saying, ‚Äúcould we stop for just a few minutes so I can gather some‚Ä¶ ‚Äù

It is a wonderful way of life.

*A note to all students: Please park on in the East facing parking lot while attending classes. We greatly appreciate it. Thank you.

title: THIRSTY THURSDAY New Member Social for Sonoma County Women's Wine Club
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
This is our regular club meeting, held on the last Thursday of every month except for holidays and we are super excited! Come join us at 4th Street Cellars in downtown Santa Rosa. They have generously offered to host our monthly THIRSTY THURSDAY social for us.

If you are new to the area, or just looking to get out of the house and make new friends, this is the place for you. Welcoming to ALL new and (ahem, old) members.

Wine is purchased by the glass for a set fee of $13/$14 per glass with the variety of white, ros√©, and red wines offered through 4th Street Cellars which includes tip. Fees are collected at the venue by Co-organizer Daima Phipps via cash, Venmo, or Paypal. You are welcome to purchase wine separately if you choose. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash.

There is no food offered, but you are welcome to bring an appetizer or snack to share with the group, and many ladies do. We will have time to socialize while tasting in the room upstairs to the left or the outside patio if the weather is nice.

The space has a 25 person attendee limit, but the list is open to 40 to eliminate a waitlist, and guests are welcome! Please RSVP below only if you are able to make it, we have an attendance policy: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

See you there, ready to kickoff!

title: LBC‚Äôs Afterschool Mariachi and Ballet Folkl√≥rico programs present 2nd Annual Voces y Pasos: A Cultural Celebration
description:
Back to All Shows


LBC‚Äôs Afterschool Mariachi and Ballet Folkl√≥rico programs present
2nd Annual Voces y Pasos: A Cultural Celebration

Thursday, May 28, 2026

7:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 
Celebrate the rich cultural traditions of Mexico through the vibrant artistry of the musicians and dancers in LBC‚Äôs afterschool Marichi and Ballet Folkl√≥rico programs at Voces y Pasos (Voices and Steps): A Cultural Celebration. Featuring more than 150 of Sonoma County‚Äôs talented youth, Voces y Pasos brings these traditions and celebrations to life in an unforgettable stage performance that pays tribute to their Mexican heritage. 
LBC‚Äôs Mariachi Ensemble and its sister program, LBC‚Äôs Ballet Folkl√≥rico, enroll students from all over the county. Together they deliver stunning performances that blend technical skill, stage presence, and heartfelt expression while embodying the grace and vibrancy of traditional Mexican folk music and dance. 
The young performers in these programs devote themselves to weekly rehearsals and regular performances at community events that continue to shape them into impressive artists. Thanks to the generosity of our donors and sponsors, they can participate at no cost to their families, with all equipment and costumes provided. Join us for an inspiring evening that shines the spotlight on the voices and steps of these talented students and honors the enduring power of culture, tradition, and community.

description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‚Äòwet on wet‚Äô watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

title: Fresh Pressed Flower Card Workshop Level 2
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Jan Lochner
Saturday, May 30th
2:00PM-5:00PM
Santa Rosa Location
$35.00

This class requires that students have taken the introductory class which focuses mostly on techniques of construction of various items. We will make some of the same items but with a focus on composition, simplicity, color combinations, color enhancement and the principles of design. We will add a votive candle to be covered in tissue paper and flowers. Class critique and comments are essential.


To register for this workshop, please contact Jan at: freshpressedflowercards@yahoo.com mailto:freshpressedflowercards@yahoo.com mailto:freshpressedflowercards@yahoo.com

Creating note cards from pressed flowers has been Jan‚Äôs hobby for 25 years, though she has no formal art training. She utilizes color,
shape and texture on fine quality paper, each card uniquely handmade. Jan‚Äôs home in Sebastopol is her studio: the dining room table is her workshop, the kitchen cupboards storing boxes and trays of flowers. She buy card stock by the thousand and pick blooms from her garden and other public places. Her family is used to me saying, ‚Äúcould we stop for just a few minutes so I can gather some‚Ä¶ ‚Äù

It is a wonderful way of life.

*A note to all students: Please park on in the East facing parking lot while attending classes. We greatly appreciate it. Thank you.

description:
Rosicrucians AMORC, Santa Rosa, CA
-Free Admission - Refreshments - Open to the public -

Topic to be announced.....
Speaker to be announced......

About the Santa Rosa Pronaos
We hold a monthly public presentation on mystical or metaphysical topics as a public service. The topics and speakers vary and no previous knowledge or experience is required. Just bring an open mind and heart.

The Santa Rosa Pronaos doesn't charge for admission. We operate under the law of AMRA. You may give as your heart and mind direct you.

The Santa Rosa Pronaos of the Rosicrucian Order, AMORC is a 501c3 Educational Nonprofit.

description:

Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

title: I‚Äôm With Her
description:
Back to All Shows


I‚Äôm With Her

Saturday, June 6, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 


With the 2014 formation of I‚Äôm With Her, singer/songwriters Sarah Jarosz, Aoife O‚ÄôDonovan, and Sara Watkins introduce an essential new force into the world of folk music: a close-knit alliance of highly esteemed musicians, each graced with a deep understanding of folk tradition and unbridled passion for expanding its possibilities. 
On their long awaited second LP, Wild and Clear and Blue, their luminous harmonies infuse a soul-searching body of work that explores themes of ancestry, lineage, and the collective human experience with stories about reaching into the past, navigating a chaotic present, and bravely moving forward into the unknown. It follows a critically lauded debut album, See You Around, and standalone singles, like ‚ÄúCall My Name‚Äù (winner of the 2020 Grammy for Best American Roots Song). 
All multi-Grammy-winners with deep roots in the folk scene, Watkins, Jarosz, and O‚ÄôDonovan first discovered their chemistry during an impromptu performance at the 2014 Telluride Bluegrass Festival, then co-founded I‚Äôm With Her, and began touring extensively and performing at acclaimed festivals across the globe. 
Produced by Josh Kaufman‚Äîa member of Bonny Light Horseman and multi-instrumentalist/songwriter/arranger/producer who‚Äôs worked with Bob Weir and The National‚ÄîWild and Clear and Blue ultimately adds a bold new urgency to their delicate entangling of lived-in narrative, fable-like storytelling, and nuanced reflection on cycles of life. 
I‚Äôm With Her has partnered with PLUS1 so that $1 per ticket goes to supporting organizations working for equity, access, and dignity for all.¬†www.plus1.org 


THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don‚Äôt get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we‚Äôre not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

description:

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

description:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools

  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

title: Press Democrat Presents North Coast Wine & Food Festival
description:
Back to All Shows


Press Democrat Presents
North Coast Wine & Food Festival

Saturday, June 13, 2026

12:00 pm VIP Entry
1:00 pm General Admission


BUY TICKETS 


Get ready for a day of indulgence, discovery, and celebration at the North Coast Wine & Food Festival, the North Bay‚Äôs premier showcase of exceptional wines and culinary talent. The festival brings together gold-medal-winning wines from Sonoma, Napa, and Mendocino counties, alongside inspired bites from some of the region‚Äôs most celebrated chefs. Guests are invited to sip, savor, and connect‚Äîmeeting the winemakers behind the pours and tasting dishes that reflect the rich agricultural and cultural diversity of the North Coast. 
From elegant caviar to bold barbecue and globally inspired flavors, the culinary offerings are as diverse as they are delicious, all complemented by live music and the vibrant energy of wine country. As festival attendee Dennis McCarter of McCarter Cellars shared, ‚ÄúThe great food at the event elevates the great wine, and the great wine elevates the great food.‚Äù Established as a must-attend event for food and wine lovers alike, the North Coast Wine & Food Festival is more than a tasting‚Äîit‚Äôs a joyful celebration of craftsmanship, community, and the good life. 
Must be 21 or older to attend. 
Designated driver tickets are available, along with a limited selection of non-alcoholic beverages. 





  

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don‚Äôt get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we‚Äôre not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Drawing Roses with Colored Pencil
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Victoria A. Kochergin

Saturday, June 20th

10:30AM - 3:30PM
Location: The Santa Rosa Store

Fee: $95.00

Perhaps one of the most beloved and universally recognized flower is the rose. Throughout history, it has remained a favorite amongst gardeners and gift givers. Join this workshop as we delve into drawing the beautiful rose using colored pencil as a medium. The morning portion of this workshop will focus on colored pencil principles and techniques, student exercises and creating color palettes. The afternoon will be dedicated to hands-on drawing time with individual one-on-one assistance. All levels welcomed. Ability to draw freehand is not needed to participate in this workshop. Materials list to be emailed once registration is completed.

To register, please contact Victoria at kochergi@sonic.net mailto:kochergi@sonic.net mailto:kochergi@sonic.net or (707) 479-3336.

Victoria A. Kochergin is a local botanical artist and instructor who works with colored pencil and acrylics. Her artwork has been exhibited in galleries, wineries, botanical gardens, international shows and on Alcatraz. For more information about Victoria, please visit her website at www.victoriakochergin.com http://www.victoriakochergin.com/

title: Santa Rosa Game Night
description:
Santa Rosa Game Night
An evening of board games and cards preceded by pot luck snacks. Bring a game, play what is there, learn a new game, socialize, eat! Members are welcoming and friendly, ready to teach new people how to play. Please, no Crimes against Humanity.
We ask for a $2 donation to cover the cost.
Game Night is every third Saturday unless otherwise noted. If cancelled, you will receive email notice. Lately we have a lot of no shows. Please take your reservation seriously and give us advance notice if you cannot attend. It is a good idea to arrive at 6:00.
Game night is the third Saturday of every month.

title: THIRSTY THURSDAY New Member Social for Sonoma County Women's Wine Club
description:
Sonoma County Women's Wine Club (SCWWC)
This is our regular club meeting, held on the last Thursday of every month except for holidays and we are super excited! Come join us at 4th Street Cellars in downtown Santa Rosa. They have generously offered to host our monthly THIRSTY THURSDAY social for us.

If you are new to the area, or just looking to get out of the house and make new friends, this is the place for you. Welcoming to ALL new and (ahem, old) members.

Wine is purchased by the glass for a set fee of $13/$14 per glass with the variety of white, ros√©, and red wines offered through 4th Street Cellars which includes tip. Fees are collected at the venue by Co-organizer Daima Phipps via cash, Venmo, or Paypal. You are welcome to purchase wine separately if you choose. Starting March 2025, we ask that every attending member pay a $1 "slush" fund fee per event so that we can build up our funds for club-related expenses, which can be paid by Venmo or cash.

There is no food offered, but you are welcome to bring an appetizer or snack to share with the group, and many ladies do. We will have time to socialize while tasting in the room upstairs to the left or the outside patio if the weather is nice.

The space has a 25 person attendee limit, but the list is open to 40 to eliminate a waitlist, and guests are welcome! Please RSVP below only if you are able to make it, we have an attendance policy: if you No-Show to three events, you may not attend events for the next three months. Please put this event in your calendar so you don't miss out or get dinged. A No-Show is when you are on the 'Going' list, but do not show up.

See you there, ready to kickoff!

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

title: First Tuesday Mystical Seekers Series
description:
Rosicrucians AMORC, Santa Rosa, CA
-Free Admission - Refreshments - Open to the public -

Topic to be announced.....
Speaker to be announced......

About the Santa Rosa Pronaos
We hold a monthly public presentation on mystical or metaphysical topics as a public service. The topics and speakers vary and no previous knowledge or experience is required. Just bring an open mind and heart.

The Santa Rosa Pronaos doesn't charge for admission. We operate under the law of AMRA. You may give as your heart and mind direct you.

The Santa Rosa Pronaos of the Rosicrucian Order, AMORC is a 501c3 Educational Nonprofit.

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‚Äòwet on wet‚Äô watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

title: Santa Rosa Game Night
description:
Santa Rosa Game Night
An evening of board games and cards preceded by pot luck snacks. Bring a game, play what is there, learn a new game, socialize, eat! Members are welcoming and friendly, ready to teach new people how to play. Please, no Crimes against Humanity.
We ask for a $2 donation to cover the cost.
Game Night is every third Saturday unless otherwise noted. If cancelled, you will receive email notice. Lately we have a lot of no shows. Please take your reservation seriously and give us advance notice if you cannot attend. It is a good idea to arrive at 6:00.
Game night is the third Saturday of every month.

title: Open Painting Session
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Facilitated by Marg Stanko
Monday, Ongoing from 10:00AM-12:00pm
Location: Santa Rosa Store
Please inquire in advance before dropping in.

Come join us for a relaxing and fun morning of painting. In this open paint session you can explore your creativity and paint what inspires you in your medium of choice. These open paint sessions are self guided. There is no formal instruction. This will be a laid back time to work at your own pace and converse with fellow artists, getting feedback when desired.

Space is limited. To inquire about attending sessions, please contact Marg margstanko@hotmail.com mailto:margstanko@hotmail.com

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

About the Santa Rosa Pronaos
We hold a monthly public presentation on mystical or metaphysical topics as a public service. The topics and speakers vary and no previous knowledge or experience is required. Just bring an open mind and heart.

The Santa Rosa Pronaos doesn't charge for admission. We operate under the law of AMRA. You may give as your heart and mind direct you.

The Santa Rosa Pronaos of the Rosicrucian Order, AMORC is a 501c3 Educational Nonprofit.

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

title: The Australian Pink Floyd Show
description:
Back to All Shows


The Australian Pink Floyd Show

Saturday, August 8, 2026

8:00 pm


BUY TICKETS 


Performing the music of Pink Floyd with note for note perfection, The Australian Pink Floyd Show (TAPFS) has been astonishing audiences worldwide for more than three decades. Always striving to reproduce the complete Pink Floyd experience and bring the music to new audiences, the show continues to include a stunning light and laser show, video animations, state of the art, high resolution LED screen technology, and other special effects. In addition, and in true Pink Floyd fashion, there are several huge inflatables, including a giant pig and their own unique Pink Kangaroo. 
TAPFS has worked with Pink Floyd touring musicians like Guy Pratt and Durga McBroom. Lorelei McBroom, who was a member of the Pink Floyd touring band on both the Momentary Lapse of Reason and the Delicate Sound of Thunder tours has been a member of TAPFS for more than 15 years. 
Often described as being much more than a tribute band, The Australian Pink Floyd Show is the first Pink Floyd tribute show that took the concept into the worldwide arena circuit. The band has played to sell-out audiences throughout Europe, UK, America, Canada & South America. With more than 35 years of history, the world‚Äôs biggest, best and greatest Pink Floyd tribute show continues to delight its global fan base.

title: Santa Rosa Game Night
description:
Santa Rosa Game Night
An evening of board games and cards preceded by pot luck snacks. Bring a game, play what is there, learn a new game, socialize, eat! Members are welcoming and friendly, ready to teach new people how to play. Please, no Crimes against Humanity.
We ask for a $2 donation to cover the cost.
Game Night is every third Saturday unless otherwise noted. If cancelled, you will receive email notice. Lately we have a lot of no shows. Please take your reservation seriously and give us advance notice if you cannot attend. It is a good idea to arrive at 6:00.
Game night is the third Saturday of every month.

description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‚Äòwet on wet‚Äô watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: First Tuesday Mystical Seekers Series
description:
Rosicrucians AMORC, Santa Rosa, CA
-Free Admission - Refreshments - Open to the public -

Topic to be announced.....
Speaker to be announced......

About the Santa Rosa Pronaos
We hold a monthly public presentation on mystical or metaphysical topics as a public service. The topics and speakers vary and no previous knowledge or experience is required. Just bring an open mind and heart.

The Santa Rosa Pronaos doesn't charge for admission. We operate under the law of AMRA. You may give as your heart and mind direct you.

The Santa Rosa Pronaos of the Rosicrucian Order, AMORC is a 501c3 Educational Nonprofit.

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‚Äòwet on wet‚Äô watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

title: Acrylic Painting Workshop
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
This is a monthly on-going class designed to teach beginner or experienced students how to master painting in Acrylics. Students are given a wealth of information regarding acrylic supplies and materials for painting realism or abstraction. At each class, Hines will assist each student in the execution and completion of their painting. Including instructions and demonstrations on color, paint application, color mixing, form and composition. This is a great opportunity for anyone wishing to learn how to paint with acrylics as well as oil painters wishing to transition from oils to acrylics.

Fee:

Sign up for 4 classes: $200 (limited to 10 students)

Limited Drop-ins: $60 per class

To register contact Hines at: mailto:TheArtistHines@gmail.com TheArtistHines@gmail.com mailto:TheArtistHines@gmail.com and receive more information about the class, payment procedure and the class supply list. And please email Hines if you have any questions.

The Artist Hines http://www.hinesfineart.com/ http://www.theartisthinesphotography.com/ https://youtu.be/kfTYYMpar1M

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

title: How to Draw People, Places and Things
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Ann Marie Torrez
On-going, Thursdays
2:00PM-4:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$35.00 Per Class

Join Ann Torrez and learn a few different ways to achieve instant gratification quickly in your drawings and get to the fun part of creating!

Ann will introduce you to a variety of drawing materials and teach you how to use them. You can also expect to explore a variety of different papers, and materials that will aid in transferring your sketch to a more refined, complete piece of artwork.

You can expect a mix of practical tips, upbeat encouragement and a little entertainment that will help you break through mental barriers and hesitations!


To register, please email Ann at: annde_2@yahoo.com mailto:annde_2@yahoo.com or call/ text her at 707-548-6499

title: Figure Drawing DROP-IN Session
location: Rileystreet Art Supply (San Rafael),1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Drop-In Figure Drawing session. [San Rafael location]

Fee: $20

This Figure drawing session provides artists with the opportunity to practice drawing techniques with a live model in different poses. This process helps the artist capture the essence of the human body‚Äôs posture, texture, and movement.

There is no formal lesson; the sessions run for 3 hours and open to all regardless of experience. First Come First Served.

Long pose, every last Thursday of the month.

Doors open at 6:45pm, front door entry.

All mediums are welcome except oil paint (water soluble oil paint is okay).

title: Acrylic Painting Workshop
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
This is a monthly on-going class designed to teach beginner or experienced students how to master painting in Acrylics. Students are given a wealth of information regarding acrylic supplies and materials for painting realism or abstraction. At each class, Hines will assist each student in the execution and completion of their painting. Including instructions and demonstrations on color, paint application, color mixing, form and composition. This is a great opportunity for anyone wishing to learn how to paint with acrylics as well as oil painters wishing to transition from oils to acrylics.

Fee:

Sign up for 4 classes: $200 (limited to 10 students)

Limited Drop-ins: $60 per class

To register contact Hines at: mailto:TheArtistHines@gmail.com TheArtistHines@gmail.com mailto:TheArtistHines@gmail.com and receive more information about the class, payment procedure and the class supply list. And please email Hines if you have any questions.

The Artist Hines http://www.hinesfineart.com/ http://www.theartisthinesphotography.com/ https://youtu.be/kfTYYMpar1M

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

title: How to Draw People, Places and Things
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,103 Maxwell Ct, Santa Rosa, CA 95401, USA
description:
Instructor: Ann Marie Torrez
On-going, Thursdays
2:00PM-4:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$35.00 Per Class

Join Ann Torrez and learn a few different ways to achieve instant gratification quickly in your drawings and get to the fun part of creating!

Ann will introduce you to a variety of drawing materials and teach you how to use them. You can also expect to explore a variety of different papers, and materials that will aid in transferring your sketch to a more refined, complete piece of artwork.

You can expect a mix of practical tips, upbeat encouragement and a little entertainment that will help you break through mental barriers and hesitations!


To register, please email Ann at: annde_2@yahoo.com mailto:annde_2@yahoo.com or call/ text her at 707-548-6499

title: Figure Drawing DROP-IN Session
location: Rileystreet Art Supply (San Rafael),1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Drop-In Figure Drawing session. [San Rafael location]

Fee: $20

This Figure drawing session provides artists with the opportunity to practice drawing techniques with a live model in different poses. This process helps the artist capture the essence of the human body‚Äôs posture, texture, and movement.

There is no formal lesson; the sessions run for 3 hours and open to all regardless of experience. First Come First Served.

Long pose, every last Thursday of the month.

Doors open at 6:45pm, front door entry.

All mediums are welcome except oil paint (water soluble oil paint is okay).

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083
