title: An Evening with the Rush Tribute Project
description:
Back to All Shows


Emporium Presents
An Evening with the Rush Tribute Project

Thursday, October 15, 2026

7:30 pm


BUY TICKETS 
The Rush Tribute Project is an homage to one of the most enduring and influential bands in rock music. Combining skilled musicianship with exciting performances, The Rush Tribute Project (known as RTP to its dedicated fanbase) painstakingly recreates the sound and energy that made Rush one of the top-selling rock bands of all time. Using vintage instruments, multi-camera projection, state-of-the-art lighting & lasers, and signature virtuosity, RTP will be performing two full sets of music, including Moving Pictures in its entirety, as well as deep cuts like ‚ÄúLa Villa Strangiato‚Äù and ‚ÄúEnter Nous.‚Äù 
Having performed for more than a decade across North America and around the world, including RushCon, RTP stands as one of the premiere tributes to this legendary rock ‚Äòn‚Äô roll power trio. 


Platinum Tickets are tickets that are dynamically priced up and down based on demand. Platinum Tickets are not part of VIP packages ‚Äì they are tickets only. 
Platinum Seating provides fans with direct access to securing some of the best seats in the venue at market value. The market value for Platinum Seating is subject to change based on the overall demand and popularity for the event.¬† Platinum Seating allows fans to purchase tickets in a safe and secure environment without running the risk of purchasing tickets that may be considered lost, stolen, or counterfeit. 

 

THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don‚Äôt get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we‚Äôre not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

title: Beginning Watercolor Class
location: Rileystreet Art Supply,1138 4th St, San Rafael, CA 94901, USA
description:
Discover the joy of Watercolor Painting!

Unlock your creativity with our Beginning Watercolor Class, designed for beginners and advanced beginners alike! Dive into the vibrant world of watercolor and master the techniques to create stunning artwork.





Course Details:

  * Instructor: Eva Mautner
  * Fee: $60 per class or $220 for 4 classes
  * Days & Times: Wednesdays & Fridays, 10:30 AM - 12:30 PM
  * SAN RAFAEL LOCATION ONLY

Learning Objectives:

  * Get acquainted with basic watercolor materials and tools
  * Master the ‚Äòwet on wet‚Äô watercolor technique
  * Learn the fundamentals of layering color and creating shadows
  * Build confidence and find joy in the creative process
  * Create and label a swatch of colors
  * Practice layering color with a grid exercise
  * Proper brush care and maintenance
  * Learn to correct mistakes and know when to leave them
  * Masking border edges for clean finishes
  * Develop tight underdrawings to guide your work
  * Navigate the entire painting process, from choosing colors to building layers

Key Skills You'll Gain:

  * Selecting and using brushes
  * Layering and drying techniques
  * Building and placing colors effectively
  * Understanding complementary colors
  * Capturing shapes and light in your work
  * Creating solid underdrawings
  * Applying wet-on-wet techniques

Join us and experience the satisfaction of producing your own watercolor masterpieces. Register now and save with our early registration discount!

For more information or to register for this class, please contact Eva at: evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com mailto:evamautner@gmail.com

You can also visit Eva's website at: http://evamautner.com http://evamautner.com evamautner.com

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

title: Leonid & Friends 2026 Tour
description:
Back to All Shows


Emporium Presents
Leonid & Friends 2026 Tour

Saturday, November 7, 2026

7:30 pm


BUY TICKETS 


Leonid & Friends is a globally acclaimed, genre-defying 11-piece collective renowned for their astonishingly precise recreations of classic Chicago songs, as well as high-energy performances of other rock, pop, and jazz-fusion hits from the 1970s. Formed by multi-talented musician and producer¬†Leonid Vorobyev, the group features elite vocalists and instrumentalists from Russia, Ukraine, Moldova, and beyond, all united by a shared passion for celebrating this iconic era of music. 
Originally conceived as a studio project in Moscow, Leonid & Friends skyrocketed to international fame when their note-perfect video covers went viral online, earning praise from members of Chicago themselves. What began as a YouTube phenomenon has since evolved into a world-class touring act, captivating audiences across North America, Europe, and Asia. 
With more than¬†500 million combined video views, multiple sold-out U.S. tours, and a devoted global fanbase, the band is beloved worldwide for honoring the classics, while expanding far beyond them 


After-show Meet & Greet
Meet & Greet is a wonderful opportunity for fans to meet and interact with Leonid & Friends. Quantity is limited at each show. Shortly after the concert, attendees with a M&G wristband will be allowed to meet the band, have a group photo taken, and the opportunity to chat with band members and have merchandise or memorabilia signed.


Platinum Tickets are tickets that are dynamically priced up and down based on demand. Platinum Tickets are not part of VIP packages ‚Äì they are tickets only. 
Platinum Seating provides fans with direct access to securing some of the best seats in the venue at market value. The market value for Platinum Seating is subject to change based on the overall demand and popularity for the event.¬† Platinum Seating allows fans to purchase tickets in a safe and secure environment without running the risk of purchasing tickets that may be considered lost, stolen, or counterfeit. 



THIRD PARTY RESELLERS
Don‚Äôt get taken by deceptive online resellers who use bots to buy tickets and then mark up their prices. The only safe way to protect your purchase and guarantee the best seats at the lowest cost is to work directly with us: through our website, by phone, or at our box office in Santa Rosa. Plus, we‚Äôre not bots. Our friendly team members are easily accessible by phone or at the box office to provide customer support.

title: The Art of Acrylics
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson
Wednesday, Ongoing
10:00AM-12:00PM
Location: Santa Rosa Store
$30.00 per class

Suzanne will demo each week as students follow along with weekly projects, exploring techniques such as layering thick and thin paint, using gels and palette knife, and applying color theories. Students can work on their own projects as well.

Whether you're a beginner or looking to refine your skills, this class covers everything you need to know. You'll get informed instruction on how to begin a piece, from choosing the right materials to selecting the perfect color palette. We‚Äôll dive into composition techniques to help you craft a balanced, captivating piece, and walk you through the finishing touches that bring your work to life.

Suzanne's artwork ranges from portraits, figurative genre, landscapes and caricatures. She has exhibited in juried shows including The Society of Illustrators in New York and for 10 years at the Southern California Laguna Beach Art Festival. She has taught classes and workshops for many years and led lecture-demos at art associations from California to Washington State.

For enrollment and supply list, please text or call Suzanne Carson at 707 888 2083

description:
This is a monthly on-going class designed to teach beginner or experienced students how to master painting in Acrylics. title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083

BUY TICKETS 
Pound for pound, Brad Williams is the funniest comedian in the country right now and has become one of the most in-demand comedians working today. His humorous and inspiring observations on disability, relationships, sex, and race consistently win over audiences, proving anyone can overcome their shortcomings. 
Williams started doing stand-up comedy as a teenager and has been touring successfully ever since, routinely selling out prestigious venues all over the country and world. He has parlayed his live performances into a multitude of stand-up television appearances, including The Tonight Show, Dave Attell‚Äôs Comedy Underground, and Jimmy Kimmel Live. His comedy specials include Fun Size, the highest rated special on Showtime, and Daddy Issues, which was even more successful. For his third special, he hosted some of the edgiest comedians in the country from the prestigious Montreal Just For Laughs Festival. His last groundbreaking special on Netflix, The Degenerates, garnered more huge ratings and rave reviews.

title: Expressive Portraits
description:
Instructor: Suzanne Carson

Thursdays 11 am - 1 pm

Beginning March 19

Fee: $30/Session/Ongoing

Drawing a Portrait is Challenging and Fun!

Portraits have always been my forte. I spent many years as a quick sketch portrait artist and later studied classical and impressionistic portraits.

This class will have projects and demos covering basic head structure and features, how to get a likeness and capture those qualities that make a portrait unique. We will also explore different portrait styles in art history.

Using photo references, we will begin with pencil and charcoal before using color. Students can work on their own projects as well. Beginning to advanced students.

To enroll please call or text Suzanne at 707-888-2083
